original: @56b * // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @56b * // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ma dhy'a ma ka aa lam ka ra britti /
analyzed: ma dhy'a ma ka aa lam ka ra britti /
translated: Madhyamakalamkaravritti

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbu ma'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Manjushri

original: gang dag su rnams dag brten blo mnga' sa la bzhugs //
analyzed: gang dag su rnams dag brten blo mnga' sa la bzhugs //
translated: Those who have the intelligence to rely on the stages of the path

original: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs //
analyzed: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs //
translated: And have crossed the ocean-like profound way of dharma

original: lhag par mos pa yongs bsgoms thugs mnga' che rnams kyi //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa yongs bsgoms thugs mnga' che rnams kyi //
translated: To those who have great minds, who have meditated on the special intent

original: bla bzhugs de dag rnams la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bla bzhugs de dag rnams la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I always pay homage to those who have the wisdom.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par ci la yang ma rag par chas pa /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par ci la yang ma rag par chas pa /
translated: In order to accomplish the perfect benefit of self and other, without relying on anything else,

original: dngos po'i rnam pa ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba ma lus pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba ma lus pa gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bur /
translated: The aspects of entities, which are delightful only when not examined, are like reflections and so forth.

original: yang dag par na rang bzhin med par rtogs na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par na rang bzhin med par rtogs na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one realizes that they are, in reality, devoid of nature, one will abandon all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de bas na rigs pa dang lung gi /
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa dang lung gi /
translated: Therefore, through reasoning and scripture,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'bad do /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'bad do /
translated: They strive to understand that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: de la lung dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang shin tu yongs su tshim par mi 'gyur bas rigs pa de brjod par / bya'o //
analyzed: de la lung dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang shin tu yongs su tshim par mi 'gyur bas rigs pa de brjod par / bya'o //
translated: Since those who follow faith are not completely satisfied without scriptural citations and reasoning, we will state the reasoning.

original: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
translated: These things that are said to be selves and other things

original: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: are essenceless, like a refl ection,

original: rang bzhin @57a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin @57a * //
translated: because they are devoid of being

original: yod par gyur na ni gcig pa'am cig shos las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: yod par gyur na ni gcig pa'am cig shos las mi 'da'o //
translated: a single thing or a plurality of things in reality.🔽If they had essence, they could not escape from being either one or many.

original: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gzhan sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gzhan sel bar byed do //
translated: Since these are mutually exclusive and exhaustive, they eliminate any other alternative.

original: rang gi sde pa dang / phyi rol pa dag gis smras pa'i phung po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa de dag yang dag par na med de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang / phyi rol pa dag gis smras pa'i phung po dang / gtso bo la sogs pa de dag yang dag par na med de /
translated: The aggregates and so forth that are said to be selves and other things by our own schools and by non-Buddhists do not exist in reality.

original: rang bzhin med par gsal bar shes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par gsal bar shes so //
translated: and that they are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo snyam du ma sems shig /'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo snyam du ma sems shig /'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
translated: Do not think that this reason is unestablished, because of the sequential production of effects,

original: rtag rnams gcig pu'i bdag nyid min //
analyzed: rtag rnams gcig pu'i bdag nyid min //
translated: the permanent cannot be a unitary entity.

original: 'bras bu re re'i tha dad na //
analyzed: 'bras bu re re'i tha dad na //
translated: If the effects are different,

original: de dag rtag las nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag rtag las nyams par 'gyur //
translated: then they would be destroyed by the permanent.

original: rang gi sde pa dang ; gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i dngos po de dag ni rtag pa'am cig shos dang / phung po gnyis su rnam par gnas grang na /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang ; gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i dngos po de dag ni rtag pa'am cig shos dang / phung po gnyis su rnam par gnas grang na /
translated: If those things accepted by our own and other schools are permanent or unitary, they would be either sequential or simultaneous.

original: de la dang po ni 'bras bu rim can dga' ba dang / gdung ba la sogs pa skyed pas rim can ma yin pa dang / gcig pu'i bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'bras bu rim can dga' ba dang / gdung ba la sogs pa skyed pas rim can ma yin pa dang / gcig pu'i bdag nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: In the first case, because of the sequential production of effects, such as pleasure and pain, it is not reasonable that they are not sequential or unitary.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu rnams kyang cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu rnams kyang cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their effects would occur simultaneously.

original: 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu ma tshang na shol gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu ma tshang na shol gyi /
translated: If the effects are not simultaneous, it is because the causes are incomplete.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu'i nus pa thogs pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu'i nus pa thogs pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when the power of the cause becomes unobstructed,🔽then the effect must occur.

original: de dag la shol ba srid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la shol ba srid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be possible for them to be delayed?

original: shol na ni de la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shol na ni de la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If they were delayed, then because they would not follow the presence or absence of that,

original: 'di dag de'i 'bras bur ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di dag de'i 'bras bur ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could they be the effect of that?

original: bye brag tu bsgyur du mi rung ba rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'thad par shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: bye brag tu bsgyur du mi rung ba rnams ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos par mi 'thad par shin tu gsal lo //
translated: It is very clearly untenable that those that cannot be transformed into something else rely on the cooperative conditions.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu byed pa'i dus na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang 'dug pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i dus na yang 'dod na ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu byed pa'i dus na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang 'dug pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i dus na yang 'dod na ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe lhan cig byed pa'i
translated: Moreover, if you assert that at the time of the effect the thing that exists in dependence on the cooperative conditions is also the cooperative cause at the time of the absence of the cooperative conditions, then because it would follow that it is the cooperative cause at that time,

original: rkyen rnams kyang mgul nas btags pa bzhin du stobs kyis drangs nas gnas te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyang mgul nas btags pa bzhin du stobs kyis drangs nas gnas te /
translated: the cooperative conditions would be like a rope tied around its neck, forcibly pulling it.

original: 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa bzlog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa bzlog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect would be uninterrupted and irreversible.

original: 'dis ni gang dag lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de nyid nus pa'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang dag lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de nyid nus pa'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: This refutes those who say that the very cause that is a collection is the cause that is a potency,

original: de'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i rim byas so zhes smra ba de dag la lan btab par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i rim byas so zhes smra ba de dag la lan btab par gyur to //
translated: and that the order of the effects is due to the order of that potency.

original: ji ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
analyzed: ji ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
translated: If you say that this fault arises because

original: 'bras bu rim can rnams la de dag gi rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan du rim can nyid do zhe na ni de dag la rtag par 'dod pa dor bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rim can rnams la de dag gi rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan du rim can nyid do zhe na ni de dag la rtag par 'dod pa dor bar bya ste /
translated: the order of the effects is due to the order of their nature, which is different for each, then you should abandon the assertion that they are permanent,

original: 'bras bu so so bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang @57b bzhin 'jig pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu so so bas snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang @57b bzhin 'jig pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the individual effects destroy the previous nature and give rise to the later nature.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag bsgoms pa'i stobs tsam gyis 'byung ba'i shes pa'i dmigs pa 'dus byas kyi 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa rang la dmigs pa'i yid tsam la yang dgos pa med pa'i 'dus ma byas ni de kho na shes pa'i yul yin
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag bsgoms pa'i stobs tsam gyis 'byung ba'i shes pa'i dmigs pa 'dus byas kyi 'jug pa thams cad dang mi mthun pa rang la dmigs pa'i yid tsam la yang dgos pa med pa'i 'dus ma byas ni de kho na shes pa'i yul yin
translated: Some Buddhist schools say that the object of the consciousness that arises merely through the power of meditation is the unconditioned, which is not related to any conditioned state, and is the mere mental object. They say that it is the object of the wisdom that knows reality.

original: pa'i phyir don dam par yod do zhes smra ba de dag gi lugs ltar na rang bzhin gcig pu nyid du 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i phyir don dam par yod do zhes smra ba de dag gi lugs ltar na rang bzhin gcig pu nyid du 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, according to the system of those who say that things ultimately exist, there is no contradiction in their being singular natures.

original: 'gal te 'di ltar /🔽bsgoms las byung ba'i shes pa yis //
analyzed: 'gal te 'di ltar / bsgoms las byung ba'i shes pa yis //
translated: There is a contradiction, because🔽the system of those who say🔽that the unconditioned object of knowledge

original: shes bya 'dus ma byas smra ba'i //
analyzed: shes bya 'dus ma byas smra ba'i //
translated: arises from meditation

original: lugs la'ang gcig min de dag ni //
analyzed: lugs la'ang gcig min de dag ni //
translated: is also not singular, because

original: rim can shes dang 'brel phyir ro //
analyzed: rim can shes dang 'brel phyir ro //
translated: it is related to a sequential consciousness.🔽Because they are object and subject, are the consciousnesses related to a sequence not also singular natures?🔽They are not, because

original: yul dang yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rim can dang 'brel pa can dag kyang ci gcig pu'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ram zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul dang yul can yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rim can dang 'brel pa can dag kyang ci gcig pu'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ram zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: if the nature of the object of knowledge

original: 'di ltar / rnam shes snga mas shes bya ba'i //🔽rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam shes snga mas shes bya ba'i // rang bzhin rjes su 'brang na ni //
translated: of the former consciousness were to follow,

original: shes pa snga ma'ang phyi mar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma'ang phyi mar 'gyur //
translated: then the former consciousness would be the latter,

original: phyi ma'ang de bzhin snga mar 'gyur ;
analyzed: phyi ma'ang de bzhin snga mar 'gyur ;
translated: and the latter would be the former.

original: / de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa snga mas shes par bya ba 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin ni phyi ma'i dus na'ang yod la /
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa snga mas shes par bya ba 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin ni phyi ma'i dus na'ang yod la /
translated: If that were not so, then the nature of the unconditioned object of knowledge of the former consciousness would exist in the latter time,🔽and the nature of the latter consciousness would exist in the former time.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma ni med pa dang / de bzhin du shes pa phyi mas shes par bya ba ni snga na yod la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma ni med pa dang / de bzhin du shes pa phyi mas shes par bya ba ni snga na yod la /
translated: The former consciousness does not exist, and the object of the latter consciousness existed previously.

original: shes pa phyi ma ni med do zhes bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma ni med do zhes bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latter consciousness does not exist.

original: ji ste shes pa phyi ma dang snga mas shes par bya ba de'i ngo bo sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas dag na med na /
analyzed: ji ste shes pa phyi ma dang snga mas shes par bya ba de'i ngo bo sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas dag na med na /
translated: If the object of the former and latter consciousnesses does not exist in the prior and subsequent moments,

original: gal te de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas rnams su //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas rnams su //
translated: In the prior and subsequent moments,

original: de yi ngo bo mi 'byung na //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo mi 'byung na //
translated: its nature does not occur.

original: 'dus ma byas te shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas te shes pa bzhin //
translated: It is unconditioned like consciousness.

original: skad cig 'byung bar shes par bya //
analyzed: skad cig 'byung bar shes par bya //
translated: It should be understood that it arises in a moment.

original: bsam gtan gyi thur mas blo gros kyi mig phye ba rnams kyis rnam par shes pa byung ma thag tu 'jig pa rgyun du 'bab pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi thur mas blo gros kyi mig phye ba rnams kyis rnam par shes pa byung ma thag tu 'jig pa rgyun du 'bab pa /
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are opened by the spoon of meditative concentration see that consciousness, which arises and ceases immediately,

original: yul de la 'jug pa gzhan gyi dus na med pa'i rang bzhin ltar de yang skad cig re re la 'jig pa las mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul de la 'jug pa gzhan gyi dus na med pa'i rang bzhin ltar de yang skad cig re re la 'jig pa las mi 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: is like a river, whose nature does not exist at another time when it engages other objects. In the same way, it should be understood that it does not transcend momentariness, since it disintegrates in every moment.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de'i ming don dang mthun pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa /🔽snga ma snga ma'i skad cig gi //
analyzed: de'i ming don dang mthun pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa / snga ma snga ma'i skad cig gi //
translated: It is also unreasonable to call it a “self” because of its similarity to a name.

original: mthu yis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: mthu yis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na //
translated: Because they arise through the power of prior moments,

original: 'dus ma byas su 'di mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su 'di mi 'gyur //
translated: they are not unconditioned,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin //
translated: like mind and mental factors.

original: ci ste skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams rang dbang du 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams rang dbang du 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that later moments arise on their own,

original: de ltar 'gyur bar ni mi nus te /🔽skad cig pa rnams 'di dag tu //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bar ni mi nus te / skad cig pa rnams 'di dag tu //
translated: that is impossible.

original: rang dbang 'byung bar 'dor na ni //🔽gzhan la @58a * //🔽ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang dbang 'byung bar 'dor na ni // gzhan la @58a * // ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: If you claim that these moments arise on their own,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
translated: then they would always exist or not exist,🔽because they would not depend on anything else.

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung ba de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du gsal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba'i phyir de dag kyang sems dang sems las byung ba de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid du gsal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Like mind and mental factors, they should be clearly understood to be dependently arisen, because they sometimes arise and sometimes do not.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni bdag gis rloms te smras su zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni bdag gis rloms te smras su zad kyi /
translated: All of this is just my own speculation.

original: don bya ba thams cad kyi nus pa dang bral ba la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i don ci yang med de /
analyzed: don bya ba thams cad kyi nus pa dang bral ba la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i don ci yang med de /
translated: But those who are devoid of the capacity for any function are not at all worthy of examination by the intelligent,

original: don bya bar nus pa rnam par brtag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya bar nus pa rnam par brtag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not objects to be imagined as having the capacity for a function.

original: gzhan du na /🔽don byed nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: gzhan du na / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
translated: Otherwise,🔽if one were to imagine that which is not capable of a function,

original: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //🔽ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
translated: what would be the use?

original: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
translated: What is the use of the lustful imagining that an impotent man is handsome?

original: de bas na mkhas pa rnams kyis ni don byed nus pa la dngos po'i mtshan nyid ces smra'o //
analyzed: de bas na mkhas pa rnams kyis ni don byed nus pa la dngos po'i mtshan nyid ces smra'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise say that the characteristic of an entity is the capacity for a function.

original: dngos po rnam pa de lta bu la /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa de lta bu la /
translated: In regard to such an entity,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa ston cing de las bzlog pa sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni dgag par byed de /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa la sogs pa ston cing de las bzlog pa sgro btags pa'i ngo bo ni dgag par byed de /
translated: the non-existence of a self in persons and things, etc., is taught, and the opposite, the imagined nature, is refuted,

original: skyes bu'i don ces brjod pa 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'di nyid la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don ces brjod pa 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'di nyid la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the occurrence of the result, which is called the purpose of a person, depends on just that.

original: gzhan ni sgrub pa yang med 'gag pa yang med de /
analyzed: gzhan ni sgrub pa yang med 'gag pa yang med de /
translated: The other is neither established nor ceased.

original: de ni btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni btang snyoms su bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it abides in a state of indifference.

original: de ltar na dngos po yul thams cad bdag med pa la sogs par ma bstan to snyam du ma sems shig / thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don ma lus pa la brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po yul thams cad bdag med pa la sogs par ma bstan to snyam du ma sems shig / thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don ma lus pa la brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Do not think that all things, such as the objects of the domain of selflessness, etc., are not taught.🔽The word “all” is used to express all the meanings that are intended to be expressed.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni don byed nus pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni don byed nus pa'i dngos po thams cad do //
translated: What is intended to be expressed is all things that are able to perform a function.

original: de lta bas na don byed nus pa ni skad cig pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: de lta bas na don byed nus pa ni skad cig pa nyid du nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that what is able to perform a function is momentary.

original: gzhan ni rim dang cig shos kyi don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni rim dang cig shos kyi don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is not tenable as the performer of a function either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: gang zag skad cig pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag skad cig pa'am /
translated: The person is either momentary or not momentary.🔽If it is not momentary, it is not tenable that it is the basis of the mind.

original: skad cig ma yin par brjod du med pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de /🔽nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ltar bsgrim mi dgos par grub bo //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par brjod du med pa ni rang bzhin med pa nyid de / nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ltar bsgrim mi dgos par grub bo //

analyzed: pha rol gyis khas blangs pa'i gang zag chos can la /

analyzed: skad cig par gyur na ni du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /

analyzed: skad cig ma yin na ni rtag tu bstan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir gcig pu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang brjod du med na ni tshigs med par gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du grub bo //

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis gzhan du dngos po rnams la khyab pa dang ma khyab pa'i phung po gnyis su khas blangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis gzhan du dngos po rnams la khyab pa dang ma khyab pa'i phung po gnyis su khas blangs te /
translated: Moreover, others assert that things are of two types: pervasive and nonpervasive.

original: de la khyab pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyab pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //

original: ma khyab pa ni rags pa dang rdul phra rab rnams so /
analyzed: ma khyab pa ni rags pa dang rdul phra rab rnams so /

original: de dag thams cad kyang gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang 'gal bar bstan pa /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang 'gal bar bstan pa /
translated: All of these are inconsistent with being a single nature.

original: tha dad phyogs dang 'brel bas na //
analyzed: tha dad phyogs dang 'brel bas na //
translated: Since they are related to different directions,

original: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: khyab rnams gcig pur ga la 'gyur /

original: bsgribs dang ma bsgribs dngos sogs phyir //
analyzed: bsgribs dang ma bsgribs dngos sogs phyir //
translated: Since coarse things are obscured and unobscured, and so on,

original: rags pa rnams kyang gcig pu min /
analyzed: rags pa rnams kyang gcig pu min /
translated: they are also not singular.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa'i shing la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag gi gcig dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang yin na ni des na de dang 'brel ba'i phyir de gcig pu'i bdag nyid
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs tha dad pa'i shing la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag gi gcig dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can yang yin na ni des na de dang 'brel ba'i phyir de gcig pu'i bdag nyid
translated: If the nature of that which is related to one of the pervasives, such as space, which is related to different directions, such as trees, were the same as the nature of that which is related to another, then because it would be related to that, it would be related to all.

original: yin pa bzhin du gzhan yang de dang tha dad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin pa bzhin du gzhan yang de dang tha dad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as it is, so too would the other be, not different.

original: 'on te de phyogs tha dad na ni rang bzhin de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de phyogs tha dad na ni rang bzhin de nyid gzhan dang 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is different in part, then that intrinsic nature would not be related to the other.

original: rags par 'dod pa lus la sogs pa yang bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dang / tshig pa dang ma tshig pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin na gcig pu'i rang bzhin du rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rags par 'dod pa lus la sogs pa yang bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dang / tshig pa dang ma tshig pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin na gcig pu'i rang bzhin du rigs par 'gyur /
translated: If the coarse, which is asserted to be the body, etc., were to hold an intrinsic nature that is in a position of being discordant, such as being obstructed or unobstructed, moving or not moving, dyed or not dyed, burned or not burned, etc., then it would be reasonable to be of a single intrinsic nature.

original: gal te bsgribs pa la sogs pa dag yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi yan lag can gyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgribs pa la sogs pa dag yan lag rnams kyi yin gyi yan lag can gyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the obstructed, etc., are of the parts, but not of the whole,

original: ci yan lag can 'di dag de dag dang 'du ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci yan lag can 'di dag de dag dang 'du ba ma yin nam /
translated: then are these wholes not in combination with those parts?

original: 'di dag ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di dag ma yin no /
translated: They are not.

original: gal te de bden du gzhug na 'o na bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rkang pa dang lus la sogs pa'i dngos po'i gnyis su ci'i phyir mig gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de bden du gzhug na 'o na bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rkang pa dang lus la sogs pa'i dngos po'i gnyis su ci'i phyir mig gi spyod yul du mi 'gyur /
translated: If you accept that, then why wouldn’t the mutually exclusive things, such as being obstructed and not being obstructed, and the things that are the feet, body, and so on, become the objects of the eye?

original: gal te de dag kyang de'i yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang de'i yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that they are the objects of the eye,

original: ci yan lag gzhan dang ldan pa nyid dam de nyid do //
analyzed: ci yan lag gzhan dang ldan pa nyid dam de nyid do //
translated: then is it the eye that possesses the other parts or is it the eye itself?

original: gzhan du na rags pa gcig phur mi 'gyur ro /🔽'di ni de bas kyang ches rags te /
analyzed: gzhan du na rags pa gcig phur mi 'gyur ro / 'di ni de bas kyang ches rags te /
translated: If it is the eye itself, then a single coarse object would not be established.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams dang ldan na ni /🔽de rnam pa @59a * //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams dang ldan na ni / de rnam pa @59a * //
translated: But if it is the eye that possesses the other parts, then that eye would be a coarse object.

original: de lta bu'i chos kho nar dmigs par 'gyur ro //🔽'on kyang gang thog mar de rtsom pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kho nar dmigs par 'gyur ro // 'on kyang gang thog mar de rtsom pa'am /
translated: If it is the eye that possesses the remaining parts, then it would be observed to have that kind of aspect.

original: rags pa gdags pa'i rgyu rdul phra rab don dam pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa gdags pa'i rgyu rdul phra rab don dam pa gcig pu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the eye that is the cause of the designation of a coarse object, then the ultimate, which is a single particle, would be the cause of the designation of a coarse object.

original: de yang de ltar 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang de ltar 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: de yang 'byar bar 'gyur na ni ji ltar gzegs zan pa dag na re /
analyzed: de yang 'byar bar 'gyur na ni ji ltar gzegs zan pa dag na re /
translated: If it is the case that the particles join together, then, as the Vaiśeṣikas say,

original: phrad de tshogs nas dgos pa rtsom mo zhes zer ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: phrad de tshogs nas dgos pa rtsom mo zhes zer ba lta bu'am /
translated: Or, they come together and perform their function.

original: yang na phan tshun mthus 'dzin gyis ma 'byar ba'i rang bzhin par yod cing bskor ba ste /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun mthus 'dzin gyis ma 'byar ba'i rang bzhin par yod cing bskor ba ste /
translated: Or, they exist as a collection, not touching each other, but held together by the power of mutual support.

original: ci ltar kha cig na re /
analyzed: ci ltar kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:🔽Many things can surround something else

original: tha dad phyogs nas mang po dag /'ga' la kun nas bskor tsam du //🔽brjod par zad kyi rdul de ni //
analyzed: tha dad phyogs nas mang po dag /'ga' la kun nas bskor tsam du // brjod par zad kyi rdul de ni //
translated: from all sides, but the atom

original: cha shas bcas pa'i bdag nyid min //🔽zhes zer ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: cha shas bcas pa'i bdag nyid min // zhes zer ba lta bu'am /
translated: does not have a composite nature.

original: yang na mang po dag par med de /
analyzed: yang na mang po dag par med de /
translated: Or, they do not exist as a collection,

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams mi reg kyang bar med pas reg par 'du shes so zhes bya ba lta bu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams mi reg kyang bar med pas reg par 'du shes so zhes bya ba lta bu yang mi rung ste /
translated: because, like subtle atoms, they do not touch each other, but are perceived as touching because there is no space between them.

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa tsam kho na'i snying por zad do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag thams cad ni brtags pa tsam kho na'i snying por zad do //
translated: All these theories are mere fabrications.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar na ni rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar na ni rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were to touch each other with their entire being, then substances would merge.

original: rdul gyi rang bzhin gcig pu gang gis 'byar ba de nyid gzhan dang yang 'byar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul gyi rang bzhin gcig pu gang gis 'byar ba de nyid gzhan dang yang 'byar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the single nature of the atom would be joined to one and also to another.

original: phyogs gcig gis 'byar na ni cha shas yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis 'byar na ni cha shas yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were joined by one part, it would have parts.

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan dag gis rdul gzhan dang 'byar ba'i phyir ro //🔽bar yod pa yang bar dag tu snang ba dang mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi go skabs yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan dag gis rdul gzhan dang 'byar ba'i phyir ro // bar yod pa yang bar dag tu snang ba dang mun pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi go skabs yod par 'gyur te /
translated: because the atom would be joined to another atom by another nature.🔽If there were an interval, there would be an interval between the atoms of light and darkness, because the interval is of the nature of light and darkness.

original: phrag ni mun pa dang snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag dang 'byar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrag ni mun pa dang snang ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag dang 'byar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And they would be joined to the atoms of light and darkness.

original: bar med pa'i phyogs kyang 'byar ba'i phyogs dang tha dad pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bar med pa'i phyogs kyang 'byar ba'i phyogs dang tha dad pa med pa nyid de /
translated: And the part without an interval would not be different from the part with an interval.

original: bar med pa ni phrag med pa'o //
analyzed: bar med pa ni phrag med pa'o //
translated: The part without an interval is the part without an interval.

original: phrad pa dang 'byar ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa dang 'byar ba zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The terms “joined” and “joined to” are not different in meaning.

original: shing rta chen po rnams kyis lam po che btod zin to //
analyzed: shing rta chen po rnams kyis lam po che btod zin to //
translated: The great wayfarers have already opened the great way.

original: de lta yin yang mdor bsdus te rnam par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin yang mdor bsdus te rnam par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Even so, let us investigate it briefly.

original: 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
analyzed: 'byar ba dang ni bskor ba'am //
translated: They are either joined or surrounded,

original: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //🔽dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
analyzed: bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung // dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
translated: or else they are situated without intervals.🔽The nature of the atom in the center🔽that faces one atom

original: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: is the same as the nature of the atom

original: rdul phran gzhan la lta ba yang //
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan la lta ba yang //
translated: that faces other atoms.

original: de nyid gal te yin brjod na //🔽de lta yin nas chu sogs //
analyzed: de nyid gal te yin brjod na // de lta yin nas chu sogs //
translated: If you say that the nature of the atom in the center🔽that faces one atom is the same as the nature of the atom🔽that faces other atoms,

original: ji ltar rgyas 'gyur ma yin nam //🔽phyogs gsum char yang phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra @59b rab gang yin pa de shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gal te phyogs lhag ma
analyzed: ji ltar rgyas 'gyur ma yin nam // phyogs gsum char yang phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra @59b rab gang yin pa de shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la bltas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid gal te phyogs lhag ma
translated: then how could water and so on expand?🔽The atom in the center that is situated among the atoms in the ten directions has a nature that faces the atom in the east. If you say that the nature of that atom is the same as the nature of the atom that faces the other directions,🔽then the atom in the center would have parts, because the nature of the atom that faces the east is not the nature of the atom that faces the south.

original: na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la bltas pa yang yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin la bltas ba nyid kyi phyir shar phyogs na gnas par 'dod pa'i rdul phra mo lta bu'am /
analyzed: na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la bltas pa yang yin na ni de'i tshe de'i rang bzhin la bltas ba nyid kyi phyir shar phyogs na gnas par 'dod pa'i rdul phra mo lta bu'am /
translated: If you say that the atom in the center has no parts, then how could the atom that faces one atom also face other atoms?

original: shar phyogs kyi khang pa la khang pa gcig bltas pa lta bur phyogs lhag ma gzhan na gnas pa rnams don ji lta ba bzhin mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi khang pa la khang pa gcig bltas pa lta bur phyogs lhag ma gzhan na gnas pa rnams don ji lta ba bzhin mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one house in the east is seen to be one house, the others in the other directions are not so seen.

original: de lta bas na shar dang nub la sogs pa'i cha can mi gnas pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na shar dang nub la sogs pa'i cha can mi gnas pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the eastern and western parts, etc., do not endure, the earth mandala, etc., do not endure.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'dir 'gyur du 'ong zhes te /
translated: If you say, “Let us avoid this fault,”

original: rdul phran gzhan la lta ba'i ngos //🔽gal te gzhan du 'dod na ni //
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan la lta ba'i ngos // gal te gzhan du 'dod na ni //
translated: and assert that the atom has parts,

original: gal te de lta yin na /🔽rab tu phra rdul ji lta bu //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na / rab tu phra rdul ji lta bu //
translated: if it has parts,🔽how can the atom be one

original: gcig pu cha shas med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig pu cha shas med par 'gyur //
translated: and partless?

original: phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab tu gyur pa'i grangs kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na rnam par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab tu gyur pa'i grangs kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it has the nature of the number of parts that are the atoms situated in the ten directions,🔽thus, speak of the establishment of one!

original: 'di ltar gcig pu rnam par gzhag pa smos shig / rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po tha dad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig pu rnam par gzhag pa smos shig / rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po tha dad de /
translated: Since it has the characteristic of a different nature, it is a different thing.

original: rdul phra rab de dag kyang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag kyang de snyed du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the atoms would be as numerous as those.🔽And why?

original: gang gi phyir de dag kyang de ltar /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag kyang de ltar /
translated: Because they are like that.

original: rdul phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
analyzed: rdul phran rang bzhin med grub pa //
translated: The establishment of the atom as essenceless

original: de phyir dmigs dang rdzas la sogs //
analyzed: de phyir dmigs dang rdzas la sogs //
translated: Therefore, the many things🔽That are said to be the self and other

original: bdag dang gzhan smras mang po dag / rang bzhin med par mngon pa yin //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan smras mang po dag / rang bzhin med par mngon pa yin //
translated: Are clearly seen to be essenceless.🔽If it is ascertained that the atoms do not exist, then it is ascertained without effort that the things that are said to be the reality of the eye, form, and the consciousness of form by our own schools, and the substance, quality, etc.,

original: rdul phra rab rnams med pa nyid du nges na rang gi sde pa dag mig dang gzugs dang de'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de kho na nyid du 'dod pa dang / gzegs zan pa la sogs pas smras pa'i rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa bsgrim mi dgos par rang bzhin gyis stong par nges so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams med pa nyid du nges na rang gi sde pa dag mig dang gzugs dang de'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de kho na nyid du 'dod pa dang / gzegs zan pa la sogs pas smras pa'i rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa bsgrim mi dgos par rang bzhin gyis stong par nges so //
translated: said by the Vaiśeṣika and so on, are empty of essence.

original: ci 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am zhe na /
translated: Are these like the words of a king?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.🔽The essence of that, that which is composed of that,

original: de yi rang bzhin des brtsams dang // de yi yon tan de las bdag / de yi spyi dang khyad par yang //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin des brtsams dang // de yi yon tan de las bdag / de yi spyi dang khyad par yang //
translated: The quality of that, the self of that,🔽The universal of that, and the particular

original: de dag de dang ldan pa can //
analyzed: de dag de dang ldan pa can //
translated: Of that are the possessors of that.

original: rang gi sde pa dag ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po de dag rdul phra rab la sogs pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po de dag rdul phra rab la sogs pa yin par brjod de /
translated: Our own Buddhist schools say that the ten physical constituents are atoms and so on.

original: de dag de med na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag de med na mi rung ngo //
translated: They are not tenable without them.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang de med na ci la brten te skye bar 'gyur /🔽rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen des mngon par bsgrubs pa'i @60a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brten pa dang dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang de med na ci la brten te skye bar 'gyur / rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga med na de ma thag pa'i rkyen des mngon par bsgrubs pa'i @60a * //
translated: Thus, in the statement, “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,” the five constituents of consciousness that are dependent and have form as their object would arise in dependence on what if they did not exist?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi 'thad pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //🔽de ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs ma grub na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi 'thad pa'i rang bzhin nyid do // de ltar rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs ma grub na /
translated: If the five constituents of consciousness did not exist, the mental consciousness that is established by that immediately preceding condition would also be untenable.

original: rnam par shes pa de 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang yang dag par rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang yang dag par rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, if the collection of the six consciousnesses is not established, the immediately past consciousness that is the mental faculty is also not tenable.

original: de ltar sems rang bzhin med par gyur na de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs sems las byung ba rnams kyang rang bzhin med par bde blag tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar sems rang bzhin med par gyur na de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs sems las byung ba rnams kyang rang bzhin med par bde blag tu shes so //
translated: Thus, if mind is seen to be essenceless, then it is easily understood that mental episodes such as feeling, discrimination, intention, and so forth, which are essentially identical to it, are also essenceless.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa la dpa' ba mkhas pa rnams kyis lan brgyar dum bu dum bur bshig zin pas shi zin pa de dag la bsnan mi dgos so //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa la dpa' ba mkhas pa rnams kyis lan brgyar dum bu dum bur bshig zin pas shi zin pa de dag la bsnan mi dgos so //
translated: Since the wise have already reduced non-psychophysical aggregates into a hundred pieces through analysis, it is not necessary to add anything to those that have already died.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa de dag dang dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'brel pa can de dag kyang de med pas gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa de dag dang dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'brel pa can de dag kyang de med pas gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: Or, those that are directly or indirectly related to such things as form are also primordially unborn because they do not exist.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pas grub par brjod pa de yang de dag med na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pas grub par brjod pa de yang de dag med na med pa nyid do //
translated: That which is said to be established through the non-psychophysical aggregates, the fundamental material elements, which are its cause, also does not exist when they do not exist.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas mtha' dag kyang sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas mtha' dag kyang sngar bstan zin te /
translated: All of the unconditioned things such as space have already been explained.

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag ni rang bzhin med pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: The eighteen elements are clearly devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can /
analyzed: rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can /
translated: The atoms and so on, which are the parts of the aggregates,

original: rdul phra rab de dag gis dngos dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brtsams par 'dod pa de dag kyang de med na med do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag gis dngos dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de brtsams par 'dod pa de dag kyang de med na med do //
translated: are asserted to be composed of those atoms in a direct or indirect manner. But if they do not exist, neither do those.

original: gzugs dang ro dang dri la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang phal cher 'bras bu dang bcas pa de dag nyid kyi yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dang dri la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang phal cher 'bras bu dang bcas pa de dag nyid kyi yin no //
translated: The qualities such as form, taste, smell, and so on, are also mostly the qualities of those very effects.

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa las kyi dngos po rnams kyang de'i las kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa las kyi dngos po rnams kyang de'i las kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: The entities of the actions such as lifting and so on are also just the nature of the actions of those very things.

original: spyi dang spyi'i khyad par dang khyad par yang yod pa dang / sa la sogs pa phal cher brten pa dang nye bar brten pa dang bcas pa de dag nyid kyi yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang spyi'i khyad par dang khyad par yang yod pa dang / sa la sogs pa phal cher brten pa dang nye bar brten pa dang bcas pa de dag nyid kyi yin te /
translated: The universals, the specific universals, and the particularities also belong to those very things, which are mostly supported and supported by earth and so on.

original: de dag kyang de dag 'du ba can du 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang de dag 'du ba can du 'dod do //
translated: They are also asserted to be the collections of those.

original: de bas na 'brel pa can med pa'i phyir 'du ba yang rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'brel pa can med pa'i phyir 'du ba yang rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since they are not related, the collections are also devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / phra rab dag kyang bsal te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / phra rab dag kyang bsal te /
translated: Space, time, direction, self, and the most subtle particle have been refuted.

original: rang bzhin med par sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown that they have no intrinsic reality.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dpyad pa'i zhar la rnam par shes pa'i phung po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa yang rang bzhin med par bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dpyad pa'i zhar la rnam par shes pa'i phung po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa yang rang bzhin med par bstan to //
translated: In the course of analyzing the aggregate of form, it has been shown that the aggregate of consciousness, together with its associated factors, has no intrinsic reality.

original: da ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyis gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod pa dngos su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyis gnyis dang gnyis ma yin pa'i tshul du brjod pa dngos su bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, the position of our own schools and that of other schools, which are expressed in terms of duality and nonduality, will be directly addressed.

original: de la @60b gnyis kyi tshul ni gang dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis yang dag par yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: de la @60b gnyis kyi tshul ni gang dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis yang dag par yod par 'dod la /
translated: In this regard, the position of duality is that of those who assert that the apprehended and the apprehender are real.

original: rnam par shes pa ni shel sgong dag pa lta bu yul gyi rnam pa mi 'dzin par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni shel sgong dag pa lta bu yul gyi rnam pa mi 'dzin par brjod pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is said to be like a pure crystal sphere, which does not apprehend the aspects of objects.

original: de dag gi dpyad pa / rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: de dag gi dpyad pa / rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
translated: Their analysis is as follows:

original: bzlog pa rab tu skye ba ste //
analyzed: bzlog pa rab tu skye ba ste //
translated: Consciousness arises in the opposite way🔽From the nature of matter.

original: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: That which has the nature of nonmatter

original: de 'di'i bdag nyid shes pa yin //
analyzed: de 'di'i bdag nyid shes pa yin //
translated: This is the nature of consciousness.

original: de la re zhig gnyis kyi tshul rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig gnyis kyi tshul rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: First, the position that consciousness is devoid of a dual aspect is untenable.

original: rnam par shes pa yul gyi snang ba dang ma phrad pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yul gyi snang ba dang ma phrad pa /
translated: Consciousness does not contact the appearance of objects.

original: bdag tsam rig pa tsam la gzhol ba kho nar zad pas //
analyzed: bdag tsam rig pa tsam la gzhol ba kho nar zad pas //
translated: It is only directed to the mere self-awareness of itself.

original: bdag dang tha dad pa'i don myong ba'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: bdag dang tha dad pa'i don myong ba'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo ;
translated: It is not suitable to be the nature of the experience of an object that is different from itself.

original: /'di rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa ni rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: /'di rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa ni rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The establishment of this as the nature of self-awareness is because it is the nature of natural luminosity,

original: shing rta la sogs pa la rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing rta la sogs pa la rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: unlike such things as chariots, which are by nature nonaware.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo rig par bya ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rig par byed pa gzhan la mi ltos pas te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo rig par bya ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rig par byed pa gzhan la mi ltos pas te /
translated: Because it is not dependent on another agent of awareness in order to be aware of its own nature, like blue and so on,

original: rig pa med pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rang rig pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: rig pa med pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rang rig pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: it is not nonaware. This is the meaning of the term self-awareness.

original: gcig pa cha med rang bzhin la //
analyzed: gcig pa cha med rang bzhin la //
translated: If it is a single partless nature,

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Because the nature of three things is untenable.

original: de yi rang gi rig pa ni //
analyzed: de yi rang gi rig pa ni //
translated: Self-awareness

original: bya dang byed pa'i dngos por min //
analyzed: bya dang byed pa'i dngos por min //
translated: Is not in the manner of an object and an agent.

original: ji skad du yul rang gi rnam pa 'jog nus pa ni rgyu nyid de rig par bya ba nyid yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa yul gyi ngo bor gzhag pa ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de rig pa po nyid do zhes rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i tshul las rjod pa lta bur rang rig pa la ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad de /🔽rnam par shes pa cha med pa'i bdag nyid las bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed ba po dang / bskyed pa'i bya ba'i tshul du'am /
analyzed: ji skad du yul rang gi rnam pa 'jog nus pa ni rgyu nyid de rig par bya ba nyid yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa yul gyi ngo bor gzhag pa ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de rig pa po nyid do zhes rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i tshul las rjod pa lta bur rang rig pa la ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad de / rnam par shes pa cha med pa'i bdag nyid las bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed ba po dang / bskyed pa'i bya ba'i tshul du'am /
translated: As it is said, “The object that is able to posit its own features is the cause, that is, the object of awareness, and the consciousness that is posited as the entity of the object is the product, that is, the agent of awareness.” In the context of consciousness with aspects, it is said that things are posited in this way. However, in the case of reflexive awareness, such a way of positing things is untenable.🔽This is because in the context of partless consciousness, the product, the producer, and the action of production cannot be observed in the manner of three different things.

original: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po dang / rig pa'i bye brag gis gsum gyi tshul du mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang rig pa po dang / rig pa'i bye brag gis gsum gyi tshul du mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Nor can the object of awareness, the agent of awareness, and the action of awareness be observed in the manner of three different things.

original: 'di ltar skye ba'i snga logs na ni med pas nus pa med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba'i snga logs na ni med pas nus pa med la /
translated: This is because, since it does not exist prior to arising, it is not a producer.

original: nus pa'i dus na ni skyed pa por 'dod pa'i ngo bo bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa bskyed par bya bar 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang yongs su grub ste /
analyzed: nus pa'i dus na ni skyed pa por 'dod pa'i ngo bo bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa bskyed par bya bar 'dod pa'i ngo bo yang yongs su grub ste /
translated: When it is able to, then the nature of the object to be produced, which is not different from the nature of the producer, is fully established.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang gsal ba'i bdag nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i rang rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa gzhan la mi ltos par rang gsal ba'i bdag nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i rang rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of consciousness that is self-illuminating, not relying on another illuminator, is called “self-awareness.”

original: de'i phyir 'di ni shes pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni shes pa yi //
translated: Therefore, this is the nature of consciousness,

original: rang bzhin yin pas bdag shes rung //🔽don gyi rang bzhin gzhan dag la //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pas bdag shes rung // don gyi rang bzhin gzhan dag la //
translated: so it is reasonable that it is self-aware.🔽How can it be aware

original: de yis ji ltar @61a * //🔽shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis ji ltar @61a * // shes par 'gyur //
translated: of other objects that are not its nature?

original: dper na bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pas rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa la gsal bar 'dod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang rig par 'dod do //
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pas rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa la gsal bar 'dod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang rig par 'dod do //
translated: For example, just as the nature of consciousness is self-illuminating, and it is asserted that it illuminates its own nature, in the same way, consciousness is asserted to be self-aware because it is the nature of experience.

original: ci ste rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ni don yongs su dpyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ni don yongs su dpyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
translated: But if you say that consciousness is by nature the experience of objects, since its characteristic is the perception of individual objects,

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo bzhin du don kyang myong bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo bzhin du don kyang myong bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: then just as it experiences its own nature, it must also experience objects.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: de yi rang bzhin gzhan la med //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin gzhan la med //
translated: The nature of that is not in others.

original: gang gis de shes gzhan yang shes //🔽shes dang shes par bya ba'i don //
analyzed: gang gis de shes gzhan yang shes // shes dang shes par bya ba'i don //
translated: By what means would it know others?🔽Because it is asserted that

original: tha dad par ni 'dod phyir ro ;
analyzed: tha dad par ni 'dod phyir ro ;
translated: the object of cognition and the cognition are different.

original: / yongs su gcod ces bya ba'i ngo bo de ni shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: / yongs su gcod ces bya ba'i ngo bo de ni shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The nature of that which is called “determining” is not shared by all cognitions.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bde ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bde ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
translated: It is like the pleasure of pleasure itself and so on.

original: de 'dra ba de gzhan la ji ltar yod /🔽'brel pa gang gis na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba de gzhan la ji ltar yod / 'brel pa gang gis na /
translated: How could that which is like that exist in others?🔽By what means would it know others?

original: 'di'i 'di zhes bsnyad pa myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di zhes bsnyad pa myong bar 'gyur //
translated: By what means would it be said that it experiences this?

original: de las byung ba de tsam gyis ni don myong bar mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba de tsam gyis ni don myong bar mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established that the mere fact that it arises from that proves that it experiences objects.

original: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same consequence applies to the eye and so on.

original: gal te don kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te don kyang yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If the object is the nature of the determination of the object,

original: rnam par shes pa yang de'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang de'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: and consciousness is the nature of that,

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pas myong ba'i ngo bor tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pas myong ba'i ngo bor tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, since the object of consciousness is the nature of the determination of the object, it is not different from the nature of experience.

original: shes pa rig pas don rig par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: shes pa rig pas don rig par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, consciousness would be the awareness of the object.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis ma rungs par byas pa'i bsam pa can gyi lugs la ni de mi srid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis ma rungs par byas pa'i bsam pa can gyi lugs la ni de mi srid do //
translated: But in the system of those whose thoughts are corrupted by the poison of attachment to external objects, that is impossible.

original: don dang shes pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang shes pa gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object and consciousness are different.

original: gang rnam pa bzhin du shes pa yang rig pa med par 'dod pa de'i ltar na gnyi ga la rig pa med de don dang shes pa zhes bya bar 'grub par bsnyad du med do //
analyzed: gang rnam pa bzhin du shes pa yang rig pa med par 'dod pa de'i ltar na gnyi ga la rig pa med de don dang shes pa zhes bya bar 'grub par bsnyad du med do //
translated: For those who assert that consciousness is not awareness, like the object, in their system, neither is awareness, and it is impossible to designate them as the object and consciousness.

original: shes pa ni gsal ba yin na gsal ba na gsal bar ma gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa ni gsal ba yin na gsal ba na gsal bar ma gyur te /
translated: If consciousness is clear, it is not clear,

original: gsal ba gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi gzhan gyi mngon sum du 'dod pa'i don bzhin du 'dod pa'i don kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur la rab tu 'brel pa'i rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi gzhan gyi mngon sum du 'dod pa'i don bzhin du 'dod pa'i don kyang mngon sum du mi 'gyur la rab tu 'brel pa'i rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is clear is not clear. Just as the object that is asserted to be directly perceived by another person is not directly perceived, the object that is asserted to be directly perceived is not directly perceived because it is not clear. And there is no cause for the connection.

original: gzhan yang shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs 'di ni shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs shin tu 'brel pa med pas kyang ches dman par bstan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa rnam pa med pa'i phyogs 'di ni shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs shin tu 'brel pa med pas kyang ches dman par bstan pa /
translated: Moreover, this position that consciousness is without aspect is inferior even to the position that consciousness has aspects, because it is completely unrelated to that position.

original: shes pa rnam bcas phyogs la ni //
analyzed: shes pa rnam bcas phyogs la ni //
translated: In the position that consciousness has aspects,

original: dngos su de gnyis tha dad kyang //🔽de dang gzugs brnyan 'dra bas na //
analyzed: dngos su de gnyis tha dad kyang // de dang gzugs brnyan 'dra bas na //
translated: the two are actually different,🔽but because it is like a reflection,

original: gdags pa tsam gyi tshor bar @61b rung ;
analyzed: gdags pa tsam gyi tshor bar @61b rung ;
translated: it is suitable to be a mere designation.

original: / des gzhag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan rigs pa gang yin pa de nyid don shes pa'o //
analyzed: / des gzhag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs brnyan rigs pa gang yin pa de nyid don shes pa'o //
translated: The reflection that is the nature of consciousness that is posited by that is the object that is consciousness.

original: de'i phyir na don gyi 'bras bu gzugs brnyan myong ba la don kyang myong ngo zhes gdags so //🔽don gyi rnam pas bsgyur ldan pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir na don gyi 'bras bu gzugs brnyan myong ba la don kyang myong ngo zhes gdags so // don gyi rnam pas bsgyur ldan pa'i //
translated: Therefore, in the experience of the reflected image, which is the object, the object is also experienced.🔽What person does not accept

original: rnam shes su zhig mi 'dod pa //🔽de la phyi rol rig pa yi //
analyzed: rnam shes su zhig mi 'dod pa // de la phyi rol rig pa yi //
translated: consciousness that is endowed with the aspect of the object?

original: rnam pa 'di yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di yang yod ma yin //
translated: But this aspect does not exist as an external object,🔽and there is no consciousness without an object.

original: rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rig pa'i don gyi dngos po ni don las ring du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rig pa'i don gyi dngos po ni don las ring du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Since the nature of consciousness is non-existence, the object of consciousness is far removed from the object.

original: 'brel pa'i rgyu gzugs brnyan yang khas mi len pas gdags pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rgyu gzugs brnyan yang khas mi len pas gdags pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Since the cause of the connection, the reflected image, is not accepted, designation is also not possible.

original: gal te de lta na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du ni rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du ni rung ngo //
translated: If that is so, it is suitable that consciousness is endowed with an aspect.

original: de yang de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'di la yang /
analyzed: 'di la yang /
translated: In this regard,

original: shes gcig tha dad ma yin pas //
