analyzed: sems ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste // don gyi rnam par snang yang ni //
translated: The mind is like a reflection.🔽Although it appears as the aspect of an object,

original: yang dag ji bzhin don mthong med //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin don mthong med //
translated: it does not see the object as it is.

original: gang zag rgyu dang phung po dang // rkyen dang de bzhin rdul rnams dang // gtso bo dbang phyug byed pa dag / sems tsam po las rnam par brtags//
analyzed: gang zag rgyu dang phung po dang // rkyen dang de bzhin rdul rnams dang // gtso bo dbang phyug byed pa dag / sems tsam po las rnam par brtags//
translated: primal substance, Īśvara, and action are imagined from mere mind.

original: don yod ma yin sems nyid de //
analyzed: don yod ma yin sems nyid de //
translated: There is no external object; it is mind only.

original: phyi rol don mthong log pa yin //
analyzed: phyi rol don mthong log pa yin //
translated: The perception of external objects is mistaken.

original: rigs pas rnam par bltas na ni //
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par bltas na ni //
translated: When examined with reasoning,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the grasped and grasper cease.

original: mkhas pa dag tshul 'di la brten nas bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams la phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams sel to //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag tshul 'di la brten nas bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa rnams la phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams sel to //
translated: The wise, relying on this method, eliminate the errors of self and “mine,” the grasped and grasper, and their divisions.

original: 'on kyang 'di la dpyad par bya ba cung zad tsam 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la dpyad par bya ba cung zad tsam 'di yod de /
translated: However, there is a slight analysis to be done here.

original: ci rnam pa de dag de kho na nyid yin nam 'on te ci gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ltar ma brtags pa gcig bu na dga' ba zhig yin /
analyzed: ci rnam pa de dag de kho na nyid yin nam 'on te ci gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ltar ma brtags pa gcig bu na dga' ba zhig yin /
translated: Are those aspects reality or are they like a reflection and so on, delightful only if not examined?

original: 'dis cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dis cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the consequence of this?

original: gal te yang dag rnam par shes //
analyzed: gal te yang dag rnam par shes //
translated: If it is real consciousness,

original: du mar @65b 'gyur ro yang na ni //
analyzed: du mar @65b 'gyur ro yang na ni //
translated: Or else, they would be one.

original: de dag gcig 'gyur 'gal ldan pas //
analyzed: de dag gcig 'gyur 'gal ldan pas //
translated: Since they are mutually contradictory,

original: gdon mi za bar so sor 'gyur //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar so sor 'gyur //
translated: they must be distinct.🔽Since they are not different from the aspects, consciousness would be multiple, like the aspects.

original: yang dag pa'i rnam pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas rnam pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa du mar 'gyur ba'am yang na rnam par shes pa gcig bu dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pas rnam pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa du mar 'gyur ba'am yang na rnam par shes pa gcig bu dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi
translated: Or else, since they are not different from consciousness, the aspects would be one, like consciousness.

original: ngo bo bzhin du gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o //🔽'gal ba'i chos gnas pa nyid pas don dam par na rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa nyid tha dad nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo bzhin du gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o // 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa nyid pas don dam par na rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa nyid tha dad nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are mutually contradictory, they must be distinct.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: rnam pa tha dad ma yin na //🔽g-yo dang mi g-yo la sogs pa //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad ma yin na // g-yo dang mi g-yo la sogs pa //
translated: If the aspects are not different,🔽then all, moving, unmoving, etc.,

original: gcig gis thams cad g-yo la sogs //
analyzed: gcig gis thams cad g-yo la sogs //
translated: would be one, moving, unmoving, etc.

original: thal bar 'gyur te len gdab dka' //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te len gdab dka' //
translated: This consequence is hard to avoid.

original: tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Not different” indicates that it is the same.

original: de bas na gal te rnam pa gcig g-yo ba la sogs pa'i byed pa zin tam /
analyzed: de bas na gal te rnam pa gcig g-yo ba la sogs pa'i byed pa zin tam /
translated: Therefore, if one aspect, such as movement, is completed,

original: ser po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na lhag ma rnams kyang rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur na lhag ma rnams kyang rnam pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: then the remaining aspects would also be like that.

original: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would certainly be diverse.

original: thal ba 'di ni phyi rol gyi don gyi phyogs la yang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa khas len na mtshungs pa rab tu ston te /
analyzed: thal ba 'di ni phyi rol gyi don gyi phyogs la yang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa khas len na mtshungs pa rab tu ston te /
translated: This reductio is shown to apply equally to the position of external objects if one accepts that consciousness has aspects.

original: phyi rol don gyi tshul la yang //
analyzed: phyi rol don gyi tshul la yang //
translated: Even in the case of external objects,

original: de ltar rnam par ma bral na //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par ma bral na //
translated: if they are not devoid of aspects,

original: gcig gi chos su thams cad kyang //
analyzed: gcig gi chos su thams cad kyang //
translated: then all would be the object of one,

original: 'jug par 'gyur te bzlog pa med //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur te bzlog pa med //
translated: and there would be no avoiding this consequence.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos su gnas na ni de nyid nges par tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos su gnas na ni de nyid nges par tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are established as having incompatible properties, then they are certainly different.

original: gang dag bde ba la sogs pa ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang myong ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste shes pa de dag ni mang la de dag kyang rigs mthun pa sha stag ste ;
analyzed: gang dag bde ba la sogs pa ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyang myong ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste shes pa de dag ni mang la de dag kyang rigs mthun pa sha stag ste ;
translated: Those consciousnesses are many and they are all of the same type, like consciousnesses of the same type arising.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes smra ba de dag gi ni gang snga phyi med par sems gnyis 'byung ba 'di ni gnas ma yin te go skabs med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sems can thams cad ni rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i lung dang 'gal ba bzlog pa dka'o ;
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'byung ngo zhes smra ba de dag gi ni gang snga phyi med par sems gnyis 'byung ba 'di ni gnas ma yin te go skabs med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du sems can thams cad ni rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i lung dang 'gal ba bzlog pa dka'o ;
translated: It is difficult to reverse the objection that this contradicts the scriptures that state, Two minds do not occur without interval and all sentient beings possess a single continuum of consciousness.

original: / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: It is stated from the perspective of the maturational consciousness.

original: de skad gsungs par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de skad gsungs par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: We assert that it is stated in this way.

original: gal te de ltar na 'di ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tshul /🔽de dag rnams la rigs mthun pa'i //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'di ni sngon gyi slob dpon gyi tshul / de dag rnams la rigs mthun pa'i //
translated: If that is so, then this is the system of past masters.🔽They assert that consciousnesses of the same type

original: rnam par shes pa nges par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nges par 'gyur //
translated: are definitely concomitant.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams //
translated: Thus, it is contradictory to say that conceptualization

original: rim gyis 'byung @66a * //🔽bar yang dag rtogs //🔽zhes bya ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung @66a * // bar yang dag rtogs // zhes bya ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: arises in succession.

original: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i sems kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba bkag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i sems kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba bkag pa ste /
translated: At that time, two minds do not occur simultaneously, in terms of the mind that is the counteragent to the adverse side.

original: rigs pas shin tu gsal bar kho bo de skad du smra'o //
analyzed: rigs pas shin tu gsal bar kho bo de skad du smra'o //
translated: We state this in a very clear way, using reasoning.

original: cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi bye brag gi tshig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig ces bya ba'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa yin gyi bye brag gi tshig ni ma yin te /
translated: The word “only” is a synonym for “alone,” not a word that specifies a difference.

original: de dag la bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems nyid yod kyi gzhan ni ci yang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems nyid yod kyi gzhan ni ci yang med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the mind alone exists, free from the notions of “I” and “mine,” the notions of object and agent, and so on.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pas tha dad par thal bar 'gyur gyi gnod pa ni ci yang mi skyed do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pas tha dad par thal bar 'gyur gyi gnod pa ni ci yang mi skyed do //
translated: But this does not create any problems.

original: ci lugs 'di rma med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci lugs 'di rma med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this system free of wounds?

original: ma yin par brjod pa /🔽ci ste rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du //
analyzed: ma yin par brjod pa / ci ste rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du //
translated: No, it is not.

original: rnam par shes pa khas len na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa khas len na //
translated: If you accept consciousnesses🔽In accordance with the number of aspects,

original: de tshe rdul phran 'drar 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de tshe rdul phran 'drar 'gyur ba //
translated: Then, like atoms, they would be multiple,

original: dpyad pa 'di la bzlog par dka' //
analyzed: dpyad pa 'di la bzlog par dka' //
translated: And this analysis would be hard to avoid.

original: gal te bar med par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo rnams ltar rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mang po 'di dag kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te bar med par gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo rnams ltar rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mang po 'di dag kyang 'byung na /
translated: If many consciousnesses of the same type arise, like the nature of the minute particles that abide without interstice,

original: de'i tshe rdul phra rab la dpyad pa ci 'dra ba sngar byas pa de 'dra ba nyid rnam par shes pa rnams la yang bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul phra rab la dpyad pa ci 'dra ba sngar byas pa de 'dra ba nyid rnam par shes pa rnams la yang bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur te /
translated: then, like the analysis of the minute particles, it would be hard to avoid this analysis of the consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar dbus su 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa rdul gyis bskor ba lta bur 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gang gis gcig la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid kyis ci gzhan la yang phyogs sam 'on te gzhan gyi phyogs zhes rnam par rtog pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar dbus su 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa rdul gyis bskor ba lta bur 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gang gis gcig la mngon du phyogs pa de nyid kyis ci gzhan la yang phyogs sam 'on te gzhan gyi phyogs zhes rnam par rtog pa'i
translated: Thus, the fault that is stated, “If the consciousness is asserted to be in the center, surrounded by the particles, then by whatever nature it faces one particle, does it face the others with that same nature or does it face them with another nature?”

original: nyes pa de nyid do //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid do //
translated: is the same.

original: bar med par rigs gcig pa'i rdul du ma 'dzin pa na rags pa gong bu gcig tu 'khrul pa dang bar med par du ma myong ba'i bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa rig pa la gcig tu 'khrul zhes bya ba 'di la bye brag ci yod de
analyzed: bar med par rigs gcig pa'i rdul du ma 'dzin pa na rags pa gong bu gcig tu 'khrul pa dang bar med par du ma myong ba'i bdag nyid sngon po la sogs pa rig pa la gcig tu 'khrul zhes bya ba 'di la bye brag ci yod de
translated: What is the difference between apprehending many particles of the same type without an interstice and being mistaken about a single gross object and apprehending a blue patch, etc., without an interstice and being mistaken about a single entity?

original: / sngon po la sogs pa bar med par snang ba de nyid kha cig ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du khas len /
analyzed: / sngon po la sogs pa bar med par snang ba de nyid kha cig ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid du khas len /
translated: Some assert that the appearance of the blue patch, etc., without an interstice is the nature of subtle particles.

original: gzhan ni rig pa'i ngo bo zhes zer ba skyon mtshungs pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rig pa'i ngo bo zhes zer ba skyon mtshungs pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Others say that it is the nature of cognition. But they do not escape the same fault.

original: gang du nor bu gzi bzhin du rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas sna tshogs kyi ngo bo blangs so zhes bya ba de dag gi lugs la dogs pa brjod pa /
analyzed: gang du nor bu gzi bzhin du rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas sna tshogs kyi ngo bo blangs so zhes bya ba de dag gi lugs la dogs pa brjod pa /
translated: In the system of those who say that consciousness alone takes on the nature of the various things, as a jewel does, the following doubt is expressed:

original: gal te sna tshogs de gcig na //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs de gcig na //
translated: If the various things are one,

original: nam mkha'i gos can lus sam ci //
analyzed: nam mkha'i gos can lus sam ci //
translated: are they the body of the sky-clad one?

original: 'di ni nam mkha'i @66b gos 'chang ba'i lta ba /
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha'i @66b gos 'chang ba'i lta ba /
translated: This is the view of the sky-clad one.

original: du ma'i ngo bo dngos po la //
analyzed: du ma'i ngo bo dngos po la //
translated: In the case of things with multiple natures,

original: brjod par 'dod pas ngo bor 'dod //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pas ngo bor 'dod //
translated: the one who wishes to speak conceives of them as having a single nature.

original: cig ca'am rim gyis tshul gnyis las //
analyzed: cig ca'am rim gyis tshul gnyis las //
translated: In the two modes, simultaneous or gradual,

original: tshig gi bya ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba gzhan med do //
translated: there is no other way of speaking.

original: zhes bya ba la de la brten tam de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de la brten tam de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so in dependence on that,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: that also is not reasonable.

original: sna tshogs gcig pa'i rang bzhin min //
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig pa'i rang bzhin min //
translated: The various things do not have a single nature,

original: rin chen sna tshogs la sogs 'dra //
analyzed: rin chen sna tshogs la sogs 'dra //
translated: like a jewel with various colors and so on.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa tha dad pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, “various” refers to different aspects.

original: de ni yang dag par na gcig gi rang bzhin dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni yang dag par na gcig gi rang bzhin dang 'gal lo //
translated: That is incompatible with a single nature in reality.

original: rnam pa de dag ji snyed par rang bzhin yang de snyed de /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ji snyed par rang bzhin yang de snyed de /
translated: The natures are as many as the aspects.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po tha dad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of a different nature is a different entity.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sna tshogs gcig pu'i rang bzhin na //
translated: If the nature of the various is a single one,🔽how is it that the various appear as different,

original: sna tshogs ngo bor snang ba dang // bsgribs dang ma bsgribs la sogs pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs ngo bor snang ba dang // bsgribs dang ma bsgribs la sogs pa //
translated: and that some are obscured and some are not?

original: tha dad 'di ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad 'di ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: This difference would not occur.

original: rin po che gzi la sogs pa la sna tshogs kyi ngo bo gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur na rnam pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa snang ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rin po che gzi la sogs pa la sna tshogs kyi ngo bo gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur na rnam pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa snang ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: If a jewel and so on has the nature of the various as a single self, it is contradictory that the various aspects appear.

original: de ni / rnam pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: de ni / rnam pa tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du 'khrul pa med de /
translated: It is not that there is an error in the nature of the various.

original: rin po che'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rin po che'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar to the various aspects of a jewel.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gcig bsgribs pas thams cad bsgribs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gcig bsgribs pas thams cad bsgribs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no difference, if one is obscured, all would be obscured.

original: de bzhin du gcig rtogs pas thams cad rtogs pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //🔽ji ste ngo bo nyid du de'i //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig rtogs pas thams cad rtogs pa la sogs par 'gyur ro // ji ste ngo bo nyid du de'i //
translated: In the same way, if one is known, all would be known, and so on.🔽If these aspects

original: rnam pa 'di dag med pa ste//
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag med pa ste//
translated: do not exist in reality,

original: yang dag tu na rnam med pa'i //
analyzed: yang dag tu na rnam med pa'i //
translated: In reality, consciousness is devoid of aspects.

original: rnam par shes pas nor pas snang //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas nor pas snang //
translated: It appears to be otherwise due to error.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni don dam par na shel sgong dag pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni don dam par na shel sgong dag pa lta bu ste /
translated: That consciousness is, in the ultimate sense, like a pure crystal sphere.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin na /🔽de lta bu de la yang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi phyin ci log gi bag chags smin pa'i mthus rnam pa rnams snang ste sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can rnams la 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rta dang glang po che la sogs par
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag tu gyur pa ma yin na / de lta bu de la yang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi phyin ci log gi bag chags smin pa'i mthus rnam pa rnams snang ste sngags la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i mig can rnams la 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rta dang glang po che la sogs par
translated: It does not become differentiated into the various aspects of blue and so on.

original: snang ba bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: snang ba bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: However, due to the ripening of habitual tendencies of error from beginningless time, aspects appear to it, just as a lump of clay and so on appear as horses, elephants, and so on to those whose eyes have been affected by spells and so on.

original: gal te med na ji lta bur //
analyzed: gal te med na ji lta bur //
translated: If they do not exist, how is it that

original: de dag 'di ltar gsal bar tshor //🔽de yi dngos las tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar gsal bar tshor // de yi dngos las tha dad pa'i //
translated: they are so vividly experienced?

original: shes pa de 'dra ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa de 'dra ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is not like that,🔽which is different from the thing.

original: de kho na nyid du de dag med kyang shin tu gsal bar shes par mi 'thad pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du de dag med kyang shin tu gsal bar shes par mi 'thad pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If they do not exist in reality, what is wrong with the vivid experience of consciousness?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'di ltar gang la dngos gang med //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar gang la dngos gang med //
translated: If something does not exist in something else,

original: de la de shes yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la de shes yod ma yin //
translated: But it does not exist as it is cognized.

original: bde ba min la bde sogs dang // dkar ba rnams la'ang mi dkar bzhin //🔽'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @67a * //
analyzed: bde ba min la bde sogs dang // dkar ba rnams la'ang mi dkar bzhin // 'di la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @67a * //
translated: Just as there is no pleasure in what is painful, and just as there is no whiteness in what is not white.

original: las bzlog pa dang sgrub pa'i chos 'gal ba ci zhig yod na /
analyzed: las bzlog pa dang sgrub pa'i chos 'gal ba ci zhig yod na /
translated: What is the contradiction between the property to be established and the reversal of the property of the counter-position?

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la som nyi'i skabs med par 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la som nyi'i skabs med par 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
translated: In this way, there is no occasion for doubt about the reversal of the counter-position.

original: rnam pa 'di la shes pa'i don //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di la shes pa'i don //
translated: In this case, the meaning of cognition is

original: dngos su 'thad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos su 'thad pa ma yin te //
translated: not actually tenable.

original: shes pa'i bdag dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of the nature of cognition,

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs bzhin //
translated: like a sky-flower and so forth.

original: gang rnam par shes pa bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa ni btags pa ma yin par rig pa'i tshig gi don yin na /
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa bems po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa gang yin pa ni btags pa ma yin par rig pa'i tshig gi don yin na /
translated: If the nature of consciousness that abides as non-material is the meaning of the word unimagined,

original: nam mkha'i me tog lta bu sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir mi srid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog lta bu sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir mi srid do //
translated: then such aspects like blue, which are like sky-flowers, are impossible because they are devoid of the nature of consciousness.

original: med pa nus pa med pas na //
analyzed: med pa nus pa med pas na //
translated: Since it is nonexistent, it is not a potentiality.

original: gdags pa'ang mi rung rta ru bzhin //
analyzed: gdags pa'ang mi rung rta ru bzhin //
translated: It is not even a mere designation, like a horse’s horns.

original: bdag snang shes pa mi skyed la //
analyzed: bdag snang shes pa mi skyed la //
translated: It does not generate a consciousness appearing as itself.

original: nus pa rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not a suitable potentiality.

original: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i rnam pa la ni gdags pa tsam du yang rig pa'i don mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i rnam pa la ni gdags pa tsam du yang rig pa'i don mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: A form that does not have the power to generate a consciousness appearing as itself is not even a mere designation that has the purpose of being known.

original: rta ru med pa ni rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'gyur te rig pa gdags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta ru med pa ni rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'gyur te rig pa gdags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not exist as a horse does not generate a consciousness appearing as itself; it is not a cause that can be designated as a horse.

original: 'di gzhan du yang 'dir dpyad par bya ste rnam pa de /
analyzed: 'di gzhan du yang 'dir dpyad par bya ste rnam pa de /
translated: This should be analyzed in other contexts as well.

original: gang phyir de yod nges tshor ba //
analyzed: gang phyir de yod nges tshor ba //
translated: Since it definitely exists, it is felt.

original: shes dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: shes dang 'brel pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What is its relationship to consciousness?

original: bdag med de yi bdag nyid dang // de las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med de yi bdag nyid dang // de las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the self of that nor does it arise from that.

original: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of consciousness.

original: shes pa bzhin du yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'am rnam pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'am rnam pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the error of existing like consciousness would arise or the error of consciousness not existing like the form would arise.

original: med pa'i ngo bo de shes pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo de shes pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the nature of nonexistence arise from consciousness,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of what is to be generated does not exist.

original: de las byung na yang snga phyi yod pas cig car du rig pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te 'di ni re zhig 'dir btang snyoms su bor ro //
analyzed: de las byung na yang snga phyi yod pas cig car du rig pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te 'di ni re zhig 'dir btang snyoms su bor ro //
translated: If it did arise from that, the error would arise that there is no simultaneous cognition because of the existence of earlier and later . This is for the time being set aside here.

original: shes pa dang dus mnyam du dmigs pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: shes pa dang dus mnyam du dmigs pa'i rnam pa /
translated: The aspect of the object that is simultaneous with consciousness

original: rgyu med na ni gang zhig gis //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni gang zhig gis //
translated: If it is causeless,

original: res 'ga' 'byung ba 'di rung 'gyur //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'byung ba 'di rung 'gyur //
translated: how could it sometimes occur?

original: rgyu dang ldan na gang zhig gis //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan na gang zhig gis //
translated: If it has a cause,

original: gzhan gyi dbang las bzlog par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang las bzlog par 'gyur //
translated: how could it be different from the dependent?

original: rnam pa ni med pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa ni med pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu med pa nyid do //
translated: The aspect is causeless because it does not exist.

original: rgyu med na res 'ga' 'byung bar mi srid de /
analyzed: rgyu med na res 'ga' 'byung bar mi srid de /
translated: If it is causeless, it is impossible that it sometimes occurs,

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is independent.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes rgyu dang ldan par khas len na gal te de lta na yod par khas blangs ma thag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid du de 'gyur ba la ji ltar lan @67b gdab par nus /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'di 'byung du 'ong zhes rgyu dang ldan par khas len na gal te de lta na yod par khas blangs ma thag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid du de 'gyur ba la ji ltar lan @67b gdab par nus /
translated: But if you accept that it has a cause, saying that this fault will not occur, then how can you respond when we say that it is dependent on something else, since it does not occur without that which you accept as existing?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan gyi dbang du ni gud na med do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las gzhan gyi dbang du ni gud na med do //
translated: There is no other dependent nature apart from dependent origination.

original: rkyen las byung ba'i rang bzhin las kyang yod pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i rang bzhin las kyang yod pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Nor is existence anything other than the nature that arises from conditions.

original: rnam pa med par khas len na nyes pa gzhan yang smras pa /🔽de med na ni shes de yang //
analyzed: rnam pa med par khas len na nyes pa gzhan yang smras pa / de med na ni shes de yang //
translated: If you accept that it is without aspects, there is another fault.🔽If it does not exist,

original: rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid kyis 'gyur //
translated: then that consciousness would be without aspects.🔽Consciousness would be like a pure crystal

original: shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: shel sgong dag pa 'dra ba yi //
translated: sphere,

original: shes pa rab tu tshor ba med //
analyzed: shes pa rab tu tshor ba med //
translated: without any sensation of anything at all.🔽You cannot posit a consciousness that has the nature of eye consciousness, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nye bar bzhag pas kha sgyur ba med pa'i shel sgong lta bu ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba nye bar bzhag pas kha sgyur ba med pa'i shel sgong lta bu ni mi dmigs so //
translated: without the aspects of blue, etc., like a pure crystal sphere without any color.

original: nang dang phyi rol du gyur ba'i rnam pa med na stobs kyis 'di 'ba' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol du gyur ba'i rnam pa med na stobs kyis 'di 'ba' zhig dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has no form, either internal or external, then it is perceived only by force of habit.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pas nges pa ma yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pas nges pa ma yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it is not the case that it is not ascertained by such things as mirages,

original: brgal zhing brtag pa mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the objection and the response are the same.

original: 'di ni 'khrul pas shes she na //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pas shes she na //
translated: But it is known through error.

original: de ci 'khrul la rag las sam //
analyzed: de ci 'khrul la rag las sam //
translated: Is that error dependent on something else?

original: de yi mthu yis byung na ni //
analyzed: de yi mthu yis byung na ni //
translated: If it arises through the power of that,

original: de yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid do //
translated: then that is also dependent on something else.🔽For example, a person with an eye disease sees a hair, a fly, or a clump of coarse hairs, but it is not the case that there is no error.

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i mig can gyis med bzhin du dung la gser gyi rnam pa lta bur rig pa de bzhin du 'khrul pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis med kyang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden par mngon par 'dod ce'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i mig can gyis med bzhin du dung la gser gyi rnam pa lta bur rig pa de bzhin du 'khrul pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis med kyang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden par mngon par 'dod ce'o //
translated: In the same way, although there is no external object, through the power of the habitual notion of the unreal, the false notion of the reality of such things as blue is born.

original: 'dir yang 'di 'khrul pa'i bag chags la rag las pa yin no//
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di 'khrul pa'i bag chags la rag las pa yin no//
translated: And here, that error is dependent on the habitual notion of the unreal.

original: ci zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: What is that?

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni de nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni de nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were related by the characteristic that arises from that, then it would be dependent on that, because it would be dependently arisen.

original: bag chags kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni 'khrul pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yin na ni 'khrul pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ba bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were related by the characteristic that has the nature of error, which is the result of the latent potentialities, then it would be difficult to reverse it, because it would be dependent on that, just like error.🔽This also answers the following statement by the opponent:

original: 'dis ni / dper na thag ring mya dman //
analyzed: 'dis ni / dper na thag ring mya dman //
translated: For example, a rope in the distance,

original: chung du chen por snang ba bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pas dbang med par gyur pa'i blo can la rnam pa med kyang snang ngo zhes smras pa'i lan kyang btab zin to //
analyzed: chung du chen por snang ba bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pas dbang med par gyur pa'i blo can la rnam pa med kyang snang ngo zhes smras pa'i lan kyang btab zin to //
translated: small, and of a certain kind, appears as a snake.🔽Thus, although there is no aspect, there is appearance.

original: de bas na dngos dang cig shos kyis rig pa'i don ma grub pa dang 'khrul pa'i bag chags la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i 'brel pa ma grub pas kha cig na re /
analyzed: de bas na dngos dang cig shos kyis rig pa'i don ma grub pa dang 'khrul pa'i bag chags la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i 'brel pa ma grub pas kha cig na re /
translated: Therefore, since the object of awareness, whether it is a real entity or not, is not established, and since the habitual tendencies of error are not related to the features of blue and so on, some say:

original: rnam shes rig pa tsam nyid de //
analyzed: rnam shes rig pa tsam nyid de //
translated: Consciousness is mere awareness.

original: bag chags nyes pas dkrugs pas na //
analyzed: bag chags nyes pas dkrugs pas na //
translated: Because it is disturbed by the faults of habitual tendencies,

original: sngon po la sogs tshor @68a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs tshor @68a * //
translated: The features of the experience of blue and so on

original: ba yi // rnam pa 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ba yi // rnam pa 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Alone arise.

original: de ni sngo sogs rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: de ni sngo sogs rtogs pa ste //
translated: That is the cognition of blue and so on,

original: sngo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: sngo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid min //
translated: But it is not the characteristic of blue and so on.🔽The deluded mind engages in blue and so on,

original: de yi 'jug pa rmongs pa'i bdag / phyi rol sngo la sogs pa'i sems //
analyzed: de yi 'jug pa rmongs pa'i bdag / phyi rol sngo la sogs pa'i sems //
translated: Thinking that it is an external mind of blue and so on.

original: zhes smra ba de dag gi len yang btab zin to //
analyzed: zhes smra ba de dag gi len yang btab zin to //
translated: We have already refuted this position.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'khrul pa dang de'i bag chags dang yang 'brel par ma grub pas /
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'khrul pa dang de'i bag chags dang yang 'brel par ma grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since the features of blue and so on are not established as being related to error and its habitual tendencies,

original: de log ste shin tu rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang rnam pa thams cad ldog par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de log ste shin tu rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang rnam pa thams cad ldog par mi rigs te /
translated: when error is reversed and the time of complete purification is reached, it is illogical that all features are reversed.

original: 'brel pa med na gcig log pas gzhan yang ldog par nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na gcig log pas gzhan yang ldog par nges pa med de /
translated: If there is no relation, then it is not certain that the reversal of one thing will entail the reversal of the other.

original: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang rta la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of cows and horses.🔽For example:

original: dper na / dngos po gang dang gang dpyad pa //
analyzed: dper na / dngos po gang dang gang dpyad pa //
translated: Whatever thing is analyzed

original: de dang de la gcig nyid med //
analyzed: de dang de la gcig nyid med //
translated: In that there is no singularity.

original: gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la gcig nyid yod min pa //
translated: Where there is no singularity,

original: de la du ma nyid kyang med //
analyzed: de la du ma nyid kyang med //
translated: There is also no multiplicity.

original: pha rol dang bdag gi lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dag gis khas blangs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / khyab pa dang / cig shos dang / rdul dang / rags pa dang ; shes bya dang / shes pa la sogs pa so sor tha dad pa'i dngos po gang la gcig pur brtags na de la de ltar brtags pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: pha rol dang bdag gi lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dag gis khas blangs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / khyab pa dang / cig shos dang / rdul dang / rags pa dang ; shes bya dang / shes pa la sogs pa so sor tha dad pa'i dngos po gang la gcig pur brtags na de la de ltar brtags pa de'i tshe /
translated: When those who follow the views of the non-Buddhists and the Personalists imagine that things are permanent, impermanent, pervasive, non-pervasive, particles, gross objects, objects of knowledge, consciousness, and so on, and imagine that each of these is a separate thing, then at that time,

original: brtag pa'i khur lci ba bzod pa phra rab tsam yang med do //
analyzed: brtag pa'i khur lci ba bzod pa phra rab tsam yang med do //
translated: there is not even the slightest particle that can bear the burden of such an imagination.

original: gang gcig pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa de du ma'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gcig pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa de du ma'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: It is not reasonable to accept that which is not tenable as a single nature to be a multiple nature.

original: 'di ltar du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, many is the characteristic of the accumulation of one.

original: gcig med na de yang med de /
analyzed: gcig med na de yang med de /
translated: If one does not exist, then many also do not exist.

original: shing la sogs pa med na nags tshal la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa med na nags tshal la sogs pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nonexistence of a forest, etc., if trees, etc., do not exist.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / dngos po gang dang gang brtags pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po gang dang gang brtags pa //
translated: Whatever things are imagined

original: de dang de la gcig pa med //
analyzed: de dang de la gcig pa med //
translated: do not exist as one.

original: gang la gcig pa yod min pa//
analyzed: gang la gcig pa yod min pa//
translated: That which does not exist as one

original: de la du ma'ang med pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la du ma'ang med pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: does not exist as many.

original: mdo de nyid las kyang /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las kyang /
translated: Also, in that same sutra it says:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
translated: When the mind analyzes

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
translated: an essence is not apprehended.🔽Therefore, they are explained as inexpressible

original: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid kyang med par bshad //
analyzed: de phyir de dag brjod med dang // ngo bo nyid kyang med par bshad //
translated: and also as essenceless.

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
translated: When the mind analyzes

original: gzhan dbang med cing brtags pa med //
analyzed: gzhan dbang med cing brtags pa med //
translated: there is no other-dependent and no imagined.

original: grub pa'i dngos po yod med na //
analyzed: grub pa'i dngos po yod med na //
translated: If an established thing does not exist,

original: blo yis ji ltar rnam par brtags //🔽rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
analyzed: blo yis ji ltar rnam par brtags // rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
translated: how can the mind imagine it?🔽There is no essence, there is no consciousness,

original: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med //
translated: there are no things, there is no foundation consciousness.

original: ro mtshungs byas pa'i rtog ge pa //
analyzed: ro mtshungs byas pa'i rtog ge pa //
translated: The logicians who make equal the taste of all things

original: ngan pa rnams kyis 'di dag brtags //
analyzed: ngan pa rnams kyis 'di dag brtags //
translated: The wicked ones examine these.

original: mtshan ma dngos po rnam rig dang // yid kyi g-yo ba gang @68b yin las //
analyzed: mtshan ma dngos po rnam rig dang // yid kyi g-yo ba gang @68b yin las //
translated: From the signs, the entities, the awareness, and the movements of the mind,

original: da yi sras rnams rab 'das nas //
analyzed: da yi sras rnams rab 'das nas //
translated: The sons of the Buddha have transcended them.

original: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
translated: They practice non-conceptually.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na blo gros dkar po rnams kyis don 'di de dang der smos te /
analyzed: de bas na blo gros dkar po rnams kyis don 'di de dang der smos te /
translated: Therefore, those with pure intelligence mention this point here and there.

original: gang gis dngos rnams nges brtags nas //
analyzed: gang gis dngos rnams nges brtags nas //
translated: Having ascertained entities,

original: yang dag tu na dngos de med //
analyzed: yang dag tu na dngos de med //
translated: In reality, those entities do not exist.

original: 'di ltar de dag gcig pu dang // du ma'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gcig pu dang // du ma'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, they do not have a nature of singularity or multiplicity.

original: sna tshogs dngos po don rnams la //
analyzed: sna tshogs dngos po don rnams la //
translated: With regard to various entities and objects,

original: gal te gcig nyid ma rigs na //
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid ma rigs na //
translated: If singularity is not reasonable,

original: de blo sna tshogs snang ba yang //
analyzed: de blo sna tshogs snang ba yang //
translated: Then how could the various appearances to the mind

original: ji lta bur na gcig pur 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na gcig pur 'gyur //
translated: Become a singularity?

original: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
translated: To the extent that one contemplates the meaning,

original: de lta de ltar rnam par 'bral //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rnam par 'bral //
translated: To that extent one becomes free from conceptual elaborations.

original: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the emptiness of characteristics,

original: rang bzhin med par rab bshad ces //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab bshad ces //
translated: It is well explained that there is no intrinsic nature.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //
translated: This is what the wise ones have said.

original: de ni gsal bar 'os pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gsal bar 'os pa yin //
translated: That is what should be understood.

original: zhe'o / de ltar rigs pa dang lung dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na /
analyzed: zhe'o / de ltar rigs pa dang lung dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis brtags na /
translated: Thus, when one examines with the wisdom that is endowed with reasoning and scripture,

original: dngos po ma lus pa brgya tshal du gzhigs te gcig pa dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs grub po //
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa brgya tshal du gzhigs te gcig pa dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs grub po //
translated: all things are reduced to a hundred parts, and the argument that they are devoid of the nature of unity and multiplicity is established.

original: gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang chos gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i dpe ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub tu zin kyang chos gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i dpe ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if the argument is established, is it not the case that there is no example that possesses both properties?

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: me long gi ngos la mig gi 'od zer phog nas slar log pas rang gi bzhin la sogs pa de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long gi ngos la mig gi 'od zer phog nas slar log pas rang gi bzhin la sogs pa de ltar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one observes one’s own face, etc., when the light rays from the eye strike the surface of the mirror and are reflected back.

original: yang na me long la sogs pa'i nang du shin tu dang ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na me long la sogs pa'i nang du shin tu dang ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because another extremely clear form arises within the mirror, etc.

original: yang na dngos po'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthus de ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthus de ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because a mere consciousness that appears in that way arises through the power of the inconceivable potential of things.

original: gal te de lta na yang de ma lus par dpyad zin pas yang dbyung ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang de ma lus par dpyad zin pas yang dbyung ba mi rigs so //
translated: But even if that were so, it is illogical to say that it is emitted again because it has been completely analyzed.

original: gzhan yang gal te me long gi ngos la sogs pa la mig gi 'od zer phog nas slar log pa rang gi bzhin la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te me long gi ngos la sogs pa la mig gi 'od zer phog nas slar log pa rang gi bzhin la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the light rays of the eye strike the surface of a mirror and so on and then return and connect with one’s face and so on, it would be the cause of apprehending it.

original: de lta na me long gi ngos byang phyogs su bltas na gzugs brnyan lho phyogs su bltas pa mthong ba dang / me long gi ngos chung du la rang gi bzhin chen po'i gzugs brnyan chung ngur snang ba yang mi rigs pa dang / me long gi ngos kyi nang du song bar snang ba yang mi rigs pa dang /
analyzed: de lta na me long gi ngos byang phyogs su bltas na gzugs brnyan lho phyogs su bltas pa mthong ba dang / me long gi ngos chung du la rang gi bzhin chen po'i gzugs brnyan chung ngur snang ba yang mi rigs pa dang / me long gi ngos kyi nang du song bar snang ba yang mi rigs pa dang /
translated: If that were the case, it would be illogical to see the reflection of a face that faces south in a mirror that faces north, or for the reflection of a large face to appear small in a small mirror, or for the reflection to appear to have entered inside the surface of the mirror.

original: chu dangs pa'i mtsho de'i 'gram na 'dug pa'i ri dang shing gi rtse mo dang yal ga gyen du bltas pa mang po'i gzugs brnyan yal ga dang rtse mo thur du bltas par dmigs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu dangs pa'i mtsho de'i 'gram na 'dug pa'i ri dang shing gi rtse mo dang yal ga gyen du bltas pa mang po'i gzugs brnyan yal ga dang rtse mo thur du bltas par dmigs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the reflections of many trees and mountain peaks that are seen standing on the shore of a clear lake would not be observed with their tree branches and peaks pointing downward.

original: de bas na gzugs brnyan shes pa de dang @69a * //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs brnyan shes pa de dang @69a * //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of a reflection is not a cognition of a reflection.🔽

original: mi 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir rang gi bzhin la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir rang gi bzhin la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because the reflection appears unlike the consciousness, it does not apprehend its own face, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpag par nus so //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpag par nus so //
translated: It can be inferred like the consciousness of sound, etc.

original: gzugs gzhan 'byung ba yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de /🔽gzugs rnams lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir te gzugs brnyan rnams ni me long gi ngos kyi phyogs de nyid na dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs gzhan 'byung ba yang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid de / gzugs rnams lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir te gzugs brnyan rnams ni me long gi ngos kyi phyogs de nyid na dmigs la /
translated: It is not logical for another form to arise.

original: lus can gyi dngos po rnams ni phyogs mtshungs par nam yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus can gyi dngos po rnams ni phyogs mtshungs par nam yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The forms of the reflection are observed in the very place of the surface of the mirror, but the forms of the body never become the same place as the reflection.

original: de dag gcig pu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gcig pu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would become the very same nature.

original: der snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung bar zad de /
analyzed: der snang ba'i shes pa tsam 'byung bar zad de /
translated: It is merely the arising of the consciousness appearing as that.

original: bye brag med na de lhag ma rnams kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ;
analyzed: bye brag med na de lhag ma rnams kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ;
translated: If there is no difference, why not accept the rest as well?

original: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams dang yan lag can rnams mi rigs pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar thams cad nye bar sbyar bas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phra rab rnams dang yan lag can rnams mi rigs pa dang / gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal bar thams cad nye bar sbyar bas khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the atoms and the wholes are unreasonable, and everything is applied to the contradiction of the characteristic of the apprehended. Thus, the pervasion is established.

original: 'dis sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i gong khyer dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dpe yang bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i gong khyer dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dpe yang bshad do //
translated: This also explains the examples of the illusion, the dream, the mirage, the city of the Gandharvas, the circle of fire from a whirling firebrand, and so on.

original: de la yang 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de la yang 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: In that regard, even though the lump of clay and so on exist,

original: de sgyu ma la sogs par mi brjod de /
analyzed: de sgyu ma la sogs par mi brjod de /
translated: they are not called an illusion and so on.

original: gang glang po che la sogs pa de ltar dmigs pa de nyid de ltar dpe byed kyi /
analyzed: gang glang po che la sogs pa de ltar dmigs pa de nyid de ltar dpe byed kyi /
translated: That which is perceived as an elephant and so on is exemplified as such,

original: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa ni de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa ni de ltar dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: but the lump of clay and so on is not perceived as such.

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yang gang gi ngo bor snang ba dang / rig pa de nyid dmigs pa yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la yang gang gi ngo bor snang ba dang / rig pa de nyid dmigs pa yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: In both cases, the cognition with an aspect and the cognition without an aspect, that which appears and is cognized is the object, not just the cause.

original: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the same consequence applies to the eye, etc.

original: de bas na /🔽skye ba de dang gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: de bas na / skye ba de dang gzhan dang ni //
translated: Therefore,🔽“The external object is not perceived

original: dus de dang ni dus gzhan na //🔽thams cad du ni phyi rol dmigs //
analyzed: dus de dang ni dus gzhan na // thams cad du ni phyi rol dmigs //
translated: at any time or place.

original: yul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid do //🔽rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid do // rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The object is not the same as the cognition,🔽nor is it different from the cognition.🔽The object of cognition in a dream

original: yul de dang ni yul gzhan no //🔽mgal me'i 'khor lo 'gal ba ni //
analyzed: yul de dang ni yul gzhan no // mgal me'i 'khor lo 'gal ba ni //
translated: is neither the same as nor different from the dream cognition.🔽The appearance of a circle of fire

original: myur du bskor bar byas pa yin //
analyzed: myur du bskor bar byas pa yin //
translated: is due to the rapid whirling of a firebrand.🔽The city of gandharvas, clouds,

original: dri za'i grong khyer sprin rnams dang // son shes khyim la sogs pa yin ;
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer sprin rnams dang // son shes khyim la sogs pa yin ;
translated: and the cognition of mirage, etc.

original: / smig rgyu chu yi rnam shes la //
analyzed: / smig rgyu chu yi rnam shes la //
translated: are like the appearance of water in a mirage

original: dgon dung 'od zer gdungs de bzhin //
analyzed: dgon dung 'od zer gdungs de bzhin //
translated: or the appearance of light in the eye.

original: zhes bya ba de gnas med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de gnas med do //
translated: This is not the case.

original: de dag rgyu nyid du yod kyang dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de dag rgyu nyid du yod kyang dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Although they exist as causes, it is not reasonable that they are perceived as objects.

original: rgyu'i don kyang gzhan dmigs pa'i don kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: rgyu'i don kyang gzhan dmigs pa'i don kyang gzhan te /
translated: The meaning of cause is one thing, and the meaning of object is another.

original: bshad ma thag pas rgya cher ni mi dgos so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pas rgya cher ni mi dgos so //
translated: Since this has been explained, there is no need to elaborate further.

original: 'di phyogs @69b dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par gyur du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ji ltar nges te /
analyzed: 'di phyogs @69b dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par gyur du zin kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par ji ltar nges te /
translated: Even if it were to exist in the similar class, how could it be ascertained as the opposite of the dissimilar class?

original: gang gis na ldog pa la the tshom gyi skyon du mi 'gyur snyam pa'i re ba 'di ni brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis na ldog pa la the tshom gyi skyon du mi 'gyur snyam pa'i re ba 'di ni brdzun pa'o //
translated: This hope that the fault of doubt in the opposite will not arise is false.

original: de bas na 'di brjod de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di brjod de /
translated: Therefore, this is stated:

original: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from one and many,

original: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa yi //
translated: an entity with another aspect

original: dngos po mi rung 'di gnyis ni //
analyzed: dngos po mi rung 'di gnyis ni //
translated: is not possible, because these two

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas phyir ro //
translated: are mutually exclusive.

original: gcig pu'i bdag nyid dang / du ma'i bdag nyid ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gzhan sel to //
analyzed: gcig pu'i bdag nyid dang / du ma'i bdag nyid ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas phung po gzhan sel to //
translated: The nature of being one and the nature of being many are characterized by mutual exclusion, so other categories are eliminated.

original: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du gzhag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'di la ldog pa mi ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du gzhag pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'di la ldog pa mi ldog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since an entity with another aspect is not possible, there is no fault of the opposite not being ascertained in this.

original: gtan tshigs 'di la ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa yang med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di la ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig pa yang med de /
translated: In this reason, there is also no partial object of the thesis.

original: grub pa'i yul gyis yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: grub pa'i yul gyis yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad rnams grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the object of the term is the consciousness that is the object possessor and because the term itself is established.

original: dper na 'di ni ba glang ste lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar ji skad smras pa'i 'thad pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni ba glang ste lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar ji skad smras pa'i 'thad pa rnams kyis /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “This is a cow because of the nature of the collection of dewlap and so on.”

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bstan du zin kyang /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar bstan du zin kyang /
translated: Although it has been shown that it is free from the nature of one and many by the previously stated reasonings,

original: gang dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas phyin ci log gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: gang dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas phyin ci log gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: those who have been continuously habituated in error from beginningless time in samsara

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pas yongs su 'phel ba spang bar dka' ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas goms par byed pa'i phyir spang dka' bas yang dag par na dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rang bzhin med pa nges par mi sems mi brjod cing /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pas yongs su 'phel ba spang bar dka' ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pas goms par byed pa'i phyir spang dka' bas yang dag par na dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rang bzhin med pa nges par mi sems mi brjod cing /
translated: and who are thoroughly inflated by clinging to things as real do not think or say that in reality there is no nature that pervades all things because it is difficult to abandon and because they are habituated to it through proper mental application.

original: gzhan dag la yang nges par bskyed par 'dod pas tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed pa 'di de ltar shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi yul nyid du bsgrub ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang nges par bskyed par 'dod pas tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed pa 'di de ltar shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad kyi yul nyid du bsgrub ste /
translated: He establishes that the object of cognition, sound, and conventional expressions are just like that.

original: dmigs su yod pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa las mi dmigs pas med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “Non-apprehension” is like saying “It does not exist” because of the non-apprehension of something that has the character of being apprehensible.

original: 'di thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis kyang gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One himself has also taught all of this.

original: yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: In the Meeting of Father and Son Sūtra,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: it says:

original: me long shin tu yongs dag la //
analyzed: me long shin tu yongs dag la //
translated: “Just as in a very clear mirror🔽an image appears

original: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa yi //🔽gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa yi // gzugs brnyan snang ba de bzhin du //
translated: that is devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: ljon pa chos 'di shes par gyis //🔽nga yis rang bzhin stong pa zhes //
analyzed: ljon pa chos 'di shes par gyis // nga yis rang bzhin stong pa zhes //
translated: so should you understand this dharma, Jönpa.🔽I have explained that intrinsic reality is empty;

original: gang bshad stong par lta bar gyis //
analyzed: gang bshad stong par lta bar gyis //
translated: you should view it as empty.

original: byis pa log pa'i blo can rnams //
analyzed: byis pa log pa'i blo can rnams //
translated: Foolish people with mistaken minds

original: rang bzhin stong par mi shes pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong par mi shes pa //
translated: do not understand intrinsic reality to be empty.

original: de dag rnams la bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag rnams la bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach them,

original: rang bzhin stong zhes bde gshegs ston //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong zhes bde gshegs ston //
translated: the Tathāgata teaches that intrinsic reality is empty.”

original: kun @70a * //🔽tu rtog pa'i rtog pas bskyed //
analyzed: kun @70a * // tu rtog pa'i rtog pas bskyed //
translated: All are produced by the imagination of what was not.

original: yang dag ma yin rtog pas bcings //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rtog pas bcings // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are bound by the imagination of what was not.

original: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra it is said,🔽“Form is like a reflection in a mirror,

original: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa yi //🔽gzugs ni ji ltar me long la //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan nyid spangs pa yi // gzugs ni ji ltar me long la //
translated: abandoned by one and the same,

original: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
translated: and yet it appears.

original: de bzhin dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ;🔽/ ces bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ; / ces bstan to //
translated: So it is with the nature of entities.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar gyur pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar gyur pa /
translated: Since this is the case,

original: de phyir dngos po 'di dag ni //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po 'di dag ni //
translated: therefore these entities

original: kun rdzob kho na'i mtshan nyid 'dzin //
analyzed: kun rdzob kho na'i mtshan nyid 'dzin //
translated: are characterized as only conventional.

original: gal te 'di dag don 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag don 'dod na //
translated: If you want to know the truth,

original: de la kho bos ci zhig bya //🔽ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa dag gis /
analyzed: de la kho bos ci zhig bya // ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa dag gis /
translated: what can I do for you?

original: dngos po thams cad ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ma brtags na nyams dga' ba kho na'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ma brtags na nyams dga' ba kho na'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo 'dzin te /
translated: By the reasoning explained above, all entities are apprehended as having a nature that is pleasant only as long as it is not examined, because they cannot withstand analysis.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po che dang rta dang mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po che dang rta dang mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like illusory elephants, horses, and so on.

original: gal te rnam pa de ltar gzhan gyis ma bcos pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo nges par 'dzin par 'dod na de la kho bos dgag tu ci yod /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de ltar gzhan gyis ma bcos pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo nges par 'dzin par 'dod na de la kho bos dgag tu ci yod /
translated: If you assert that all things that are not modified by others hold their own nature, then what can I say to refute that?

original: de dag gis dngos po'i ngo bo 'di bdag nyid kyis rang gir byas kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis dngos po'i ngo bo 'di bdag nyid kyis rang gir byas kyi /
translated: They themselves have taken possession of the nature of things.

original: 'di ni su dag gis kyang lcags kyu med pa'i 'dod pas 'di dag la gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni su dag gis kyang lcags kyu med pa'i 'dod pas 'di dag la gzhag pa med do //
translated: No one can place them there with a hook by wishing to do so.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na la mkhas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de dang de dag tu rab tu bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i de kho na la mkhas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de dang de dag tu rab tu bshad de /
translated: The Tathāgatas, who are experts in the thatness of things as they are, have explained them in this and that way.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa las ji skad du //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa las ji skad du //
translated: As it says in the Compendium of Dharma Sūtra:

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis tha snyad du ston pa rnam pa bcur khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis tha snyad du ston pa rnam pa bcur khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: “Bodhisattvas should understand that the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Correctly and Perfectly Enlightened Ones teach in terms of ten conventional expressions.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste phung po ston pa dang / khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa dang / sems can ston pa dang / las ston pa dang / skye ba ston pa dang / rga ba ston pa dang / 'chi ba ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po ston pa dang / khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa dang / sems can ston pa dang / las ston pa dang / skye ba ston pa dang / rga ba ston pa dang / 'chi ba ston pa dang /
translated: That is to say, it teaches the aggregates, it teaches the elements, it teaches the sense bases, it teaches sentient beings, it teaches karma, it teaches birth, it teaches aging, it teaches death,

original: 'chi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor pa ston pa dang / de rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor pa ston pa dang / de rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: it teaches the connection with death, and it teaches nirvana, which is their complete pacification.

original: de bas na dkon mchog sprin las kyang /🔽rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog sprin las kyang / rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na /
translated: Therefore, the Cloud of Jewels says,🔽“Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas who have ten qualities are skilled in the conventional.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs su yang 'dogs la /
analyzed: gzugs su yang 'dogs la /
translated: They designate form,

original: don dam par gzugs su yang mi dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs su yang mi dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: but ultimately they do not observe form and do not settle down on it.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, they designate feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.🔽”

original: @70b de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: @70b de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Akṣayamatisūtra says,

original: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa ste /
translated: “Correct” means that all phenomena are selfless.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad rigs pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad rigs pas mthong ba'o //
translated: Thus, all phenomena are seen through reasoning.

original: ci ltar sems can bdag med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad rigs pas mthong ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar sems can bdag med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad rigs pas mthong ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Just as sentient beings are selfless, all phenomena are seen through reasoning.

original: rgyal ba bskyed pa las kyang rgyal bas ji skad du /
analyzed: rgyal ba bskyed pa las kyang rgyal bas ji skad du /
translated: The Jinajanana also says,

original: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Because of the emptiness of characteristics, consciousness is empty of the entityness of consciousness.”

original: gal te 'di ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If you say, “This is emptiness of an imputed entityness,”

original: de bden te yang dag par rang bzhin dang bcas pa yang yod do zhes bya ba de yang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: de bden te yang dag par rang bzhin dang bcas pa yang yod do zhes bya ba de yang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: that is true, but the existence of an intrinsically real entity is also just an imputed entityness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo yang dag par yod pa nyid du grub na ni gnyis la sogs pa brtags pa'o zhes bya ba de grub na sngar smos pa'i tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas de ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo yang dag par yod pa nyid du grub na ni gnyis la sogs pa brtags pa'o zhes bya ba de grub na sngar smos pa'i tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas de ni ma grub bo //
translated: But since the previously mentioned valid cognitions contradict that, it is not established.

original: glang po che'i rtsal gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: glang po che'i rtsal gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Hastikakṣya Sūtra says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽gang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems / gang chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yod pa yin nam /
translated: “Śāriputra, what do you think?

original: 'on te med pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te med pa yin /
translated: Is the knowledge of the nature of phenomena existent or nonexistent?🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'tshal ba de ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid 'chal ba ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'tshal ba de ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid 'chal ba ste / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis shing /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, the knowledge of the nature of all phenomena is the knowledge of the nature of an illusion.

original: mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: Blessed One, it does not exist and is not nonexistent.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ni sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Because the Blessed One has taught that all phenomena are the nature of an illusion.

original: sgyu ma lta bu gang lags pa de ni ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu gang lags pa de ni ma mchis pa'o //
translated: That which is like an illusion does not exist.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
