original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'tshal ba de ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'tshal ba de ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the reality of all phenomena is non-knowledge.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la gang yang yang dag par chos gang yang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la gang yang yang dag par chos gang yang mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because here, nothing whatsoever is perceived as a phenomenon.

original: 'o na ci ste kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'di gal te ci dngos po med pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ci ste kun rdzob kyi ngo bo 'di gal te ci dngos po med pa yin nam /
translated: Well, if this nature of the conventional is not a non-entity,

original: 'di dngos po med pa yin na ni mthong ba dang 'dod pa'i don byed pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dngos po med pa yin na ni mthong ba dang 'dod pa'i don byed pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: then if it is an entity, it contradicts being seen and performing a function.

original: de ni de lta ma yin par bstan pa /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin par bstan pa /
translated: It is taught that it is not like that:

original: ma brtags gcig bu'i nyams dga' zhing //
analyzed: ma brtags gcig bu'i nyams dga' zhing //
translated: It is delightful when not examined,

original: skye dang 'jig pa'i chos can pa //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa'i chos can pa //
translated: And has the nature of arising and disintegrating.

original: don byed pa dag nus rnams kyis //
analyzed: don byed pa dag nus rnams kyis //
translated: Those who are able to perform a function

original: rang bzhin kun rdzob pa yin rtogs //
analyzed: rang bzhin kun rdzob pa yin rtogs //
translated: Understand that the nature is conventional.

original: kun rdzob ni sgra'i tha snyad tsam gyis bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni sgra'i tha snyad tsam gyis bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The conventional is not just one's own verbal conventions.

original: mthong ba dang 'dod pa'i dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni brtag mi bzod pas @71a * //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'dod pa'i dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni brtag mi bzod pas @71a * //
translated: Things that are seen and desired, which arise dependently, cannot withstand analysis.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called “correct conventionalities.”

original: gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha snyad de lta bur byas pa'i brda dag gis tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa na de'i phyir don byed pa dang ci'i phyir 'gal te /
analyzed: gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha snyad de lta bur byas pa'i brda dag gis tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa na de'i phyir don byed pa dang ci'i phyir 'gal te /
translated: When one uses conventions such as “imputed” and so forth, which are conventional symbols, why would that contradict the performance of a function?

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises dependently

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: is explained to be emptiness.

original: de ni rgyur byas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni rgyur byas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation;

original: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin no // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: that itself is the middle way.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las /
translated: The noble Aksayamatinirdeśa sūtra says,

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?🔽It is whatever is a worldly convention, a letter, a word, or a

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brda bstan pa dag go //
translated: symbol.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes gang gsungs pa de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta ci smos zhes gang gsungs pa de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement, “The ultimate truth is where there is no movement of the mind, let alone words,” is as follows.

original: sems can dang snod kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten myong bar bya ba dang / myong ba'i ngo bo'i tshul 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten myong bar bya ba dang / myong ba'i ngo bo'i tshul 'dir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du dgongs pa ste /
translated: The world of sentient beings and the world of their environment are intended here as the objects of experience and the nature of experience, respectively, in terms of worldly convention.

original: byed pa'i sgrub pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i sgrub pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the agent is taken to be the means of accomplishment.

original: brjod pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of expression,

original: de ni yi ge la sogs pas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yi ge la sogs pas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is expressed by letters, etc.

original: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i don yin par bstan te /
analyzed: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i don yin par bstan te /
translated: The term “all” indicates the meaning of “without remainder.”

original: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the realization of nonconceptual consciousness does not transcend the conventional truth of form, etc., and pleasure, etc.

original: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir yi ge la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir yi ge la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
translated: The letters, etc., are also applied because they are related to that.

original: de'i phyir lung las byung ba dang / 'jig rten pa yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las byung ba dang / 'jig rten pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: Therefore, the scriptures and the world are included.

original: de ni yid kyi dang ngag gi'o //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi dang ngag gi'o //
translated: This is the mental and verbal.

original: dper na yid kyis brgya byin la chos mngon par bshad pa dang / yid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i lan btab par de dang de dag nas 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yid kyis brgya byin la chos mngon par bshad pa dang / yid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i lan btab par de dang de dag nas 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the explanation of Abhidharma to Indra by the mind, and the reply in verse by the mind, as it occurs in this and that.

original: de bas na spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa la ni sems rgyu ba yang med par bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa la ni sems rgyu ba yang med par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the ultimate truth, which is free from all the collections of conceptual elaborations, is not even the domain of the mind.

original: kun rdzob 'di ni rgyu med par mi rung ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di ni rgyu med par mi rung ste /
translated: This conventional truth is not suitable without a cause.

original: shing rta dang sems can la sogs pa btags pa bzhin ma yin nam /
analyzed: shing rta dang sems can la sogs pa btags pa bzhin ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not like the imputation of a chariot and a sentient being, and so on?

original: skyob pas kyang //
analyzed: skyob pas kyang //
translated: The protector Nāgārjuna also said:

original: dper na yan lag tshogs rnams la //
analyzed: dper na yan lag tshogs rnams la //
translated: For example, it is asserted that

original: shing rta zhes ni bya bar 'dod //
analyzed: shing rta zhes ni bya bar 'dod //
translated: a chariot is imputed in dependence on the collection of parts.

original: de bzhin phung po rgyur byas nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rgyur byas nas //
translated: In the same way, having taken the aggregates as the cause,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod // ces gsungs so //
translated: conventionally sentient beings are expressed.

original: gal te de lta na 'di la yang /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di la yang /
translated: If it is like that, then in this case as well,

original: brtag pa ma byas nyams dga' ba'ang //
analyzed: brtag pa ma byas nyams dga' ba'ang //
translated: without analysis, it is delightful.

original: bdag rgyu snga ma snga ma la //🔽brten nas phyi ma phyi ma yi //
analyzed: bdag rgyu snga ma snga ma la // brten nas phyi ma phyi ma yi //
translated: The later ones arise in dependence🔽on the earlier ones.🔽

original: @71b 'bras bu de 'dra 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: @71b 'bras bu de 'dra 'byung ba yin //
translated: The effect arises in that way🔽in dependence on the prior cause.

original: de phyir kun rdzob rgyu med na //
analyzed: de phyir kun rdzob rgyu med na //
translated: Therefore, if the conventional is causeless,

original: rung min zhes pa'ang legs ma yin //
analyzed: rung min zhes pa'ang legs ma yin //
translated: it is also incorrect to say it is not possible.

original: gal te 'di yi nyer len pa //
analyzed: gal te 'di yi nyer len pa //
translated: If you say that the appropriated

original: yang dag yin na de smros shig / de ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: yang dag yin na de smros shig / de ni bshad zin te /
translated: is real, then explain what it is.

analyzed: brtag mi bzod la don byed nus pa'i dngos po nyid ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ces bya ste /
translated: It has already been explained that that which is able to perform a function, although not able to withstand rational analysis, is called “real conventionality.”

original: gang zag la sogs pa ltar sgra tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //🔽de lta bu de la yang brjod pa'i tshul gyis brtags pas dpyad mi bzod pa'i rang gi rgyu la brten nas 'byung na rgyu med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa ltar sgra tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // de lta bu de la yang brjod pa'i tshul gyis brtags pas dpyad mi bzod pa'i rang gi rgyu la brten nas 'byung na rgyu med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: It is not just a mere word, like a person and so on.🔽If such a thing arises in dependence on its own cause, which cannot withstand rational analysis, how could it be causeless?

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyis dpyad na gang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa de blo gros dang ldan pas smros shig /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyis dpyad na gang gi rgyu'i rang bzhin yod pa de blo gros dang ldan pas smros shig /
translated: If you say that it has a cause, then explain what it is, for the wise say that it is not tenable to say that something is a cause and also that it is not a cause.

original: shing rta la sogs pa yang chos nyid 'di las mi 'da' ba nyid do zhes thams cad dang nye bar sbyar bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: shing rta la sogs pa yang chos nyid 'di las mi 'da' ba nyid do zhes thams cad dang nye bar sbyar bar bshad zin to //
translated: And it has been explained that chariots and so forth are not beyond this reality.

original: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
translated: Here, too, it is said:

analyzed: yi ge gcig sngags gang yang med //

analyzed: yi ge mang po gzhan yang med //

analyzed: yi ge 'gags pa rnams min la //

analyzed: brten nas de ni med pa yin // de bzhin rang gi yan lag las //
translated: But are dependent and do not exist.🔽In the same way, the medicine

analyzed: sman ni gud na mi snang ngo //

original: sgyu ma'i glang po snang ba de //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po snang ba de //

original: de dag las min gzhan yang min //
analyzed: de dag las min gzhan yang min //
translated: Is neither from those nor from another.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de //
translated: Who would assert that dependent origination

analyzed: yod dam med par su zhig 'dod // de la dmigs par byed pa yi //
translated: Exists or does not exist?

original: mig gi rnam shes byung ba ltar //
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes byung ba ltar //
translated: Just as the eye consciousness arises🔽Observing that,🔽So too the arising of existence with grasping

translated: Or is it not so?”

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don ni spong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don ni spong bar mi byed de /
translated: One does not reject the object that appears in the conceptual cognition of arising, etc.

original: de nyid blo la bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid blo la bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the term “relative” is applied to that in order to generate understanding of it.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dpyad pa nyid kyis bsal zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dpyad pa nyid kyis bsal zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But since conceptualization also has the nature of consciousness, isn’t it refuted by the very analysis of consciousness?

original: gzhan yang de lta na kun rdzob ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo la brten pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta na kun rdzob ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo la brten pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la sogs pa ni kun rdzob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, in that case, since the so-called relative depends on the conceptual mind, nonarising and so on would be relative,

original: don dam par ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ma yin te /
translated: but not ultimate,

original: shing la sogs pa sgra'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa sgra'i don bzhin no //
translated: like the meaning of the word “tree” and so on.

original: gzhan yang dngos po ma grub na de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa bdag gi dngos po de kho na la dngos po med pa la sogs pa yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po ma grub na de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa bdag gi dngos po de kho na la dngos po med pa la sogs pa yang med pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, if things are not established, then the imputed nature that depends on them would also not exist in reality, such as nonexistence and so on.

original: 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: This is stated:

original: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: If things are not established,

original: dngos po med par 'gyur mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur mi 'gyur //
translated: would nonthings come to be?

original: dngos po gzhan du gyur na ni //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du gyur na ni //
translated: If things transform into something else,

original: dngos po med ces skye bo smra //
analyzed: dngos po med ces skye bo smra //
translated: people say, “It is nonexistent.”

original: zhe'o // de skad du /
analyzed: zhe'o // de skad du /
translated: And also:

original: 'o mar zho la sogs med pa //
analyzed: 'o mar zho la sogs med pa //
translated: Milk does not have curd, etc.

original: de na snga na med ces bya //
analyzed: de na snga na med ces bya //
translated: That is called “non-existence of what is prior.”

original: zho la 'o ma med pa ni //
analyzed: zho la 'o ma med pa ni //
translated: Curd does not have milk.

original: zhi gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: zhi gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: That is the characteristic of the absence of tranquility.

original: mgo yi yan lag lcong ba dang // skye dang sra ba rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: mgo yi yan lag lcong ba dang // skye dang sra ba rnam spangs pa //
translated: The absence of the head and limbs, the absence of birth and solidity,

original: ri bong rva la sogs dngos su //
analyzed: ri bong rva la sogs dngos su //
translated: The absence of the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: de ni gtan med brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gtan med brjod pa yin //
translated: That is called “absolute non-existence.”

original: ba lang la ni rta sogs med //
analyzed: ba lang la ni rta sogs med //
translated: A cow does not have a horse, etc.

original: de ni gcig la gcig med brjod //🔽ce'o // gsog tu gyur pa dngos po med par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: de ni gcig la gcig med brjod // ce'o // gsog tu gyur pa dngos po med par gyur pa yang /
translated: That is called “mutual non-existence.”

original: dngos po yod pa nyid du nges pa'i zlas drangs nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid du nges pa'i zlas drangs nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The non-existence of an entity that is a mere collection, and the non-existence of an entity that is a real entity, are posited in contrast to the ascertainment of the existence of an entity.

original: mo gsham la sogs pa dang / bu la sogs pa yod par ma nges na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mo gsham la sogs pa dang / bu la sogs pa yod par ma nges na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the existence of a son, etc. were not ascertained in a barren woman, etc., the conception of a son of a barren woman, etc. would not occur.

original: de bas na blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las bstan pa /
analyzed: de bas na blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdo las bstan pa /
translated: Therefore, it is taught in the Sāgaramati Sūtra:

original: tshangs pa chos gang yongs su ma grub pa de yod pa nyid du zhe'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa chos gang yongs su ma grub pa de yod pa nyid du zhe'am /
translated: “Brahmā, that which is not established as a dharma, is that the existence of that?”

original: med pa nyid do zhes khas mi len to zhes 'byung ba 'di legs par bshad pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhes khas mi len to zhes 'byung ba 'di legs par bshad pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and “non-existence” is not accepted.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /🔽yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: The Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra says,🔽Non-existence is drawn by the contrast of existence;

original: med pa'ang yod pa'i zlas drangs so//
analyzed: med pa'ang yod pa'i zlas drangs so//
translated: existence is drawn by the contrast of non-existence.

original: de bas med par bsam mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par bsam mi bya //
translated: Therefore, do not think of non-existence;🔽do not imagine existence.

original: yod pa nyid du'ang mi brtag go / gang la ci yang mi skye ba //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du'ang mi brtag go / gang la ci yang mi skye ba //
translated: Whatever does not arise at all

original: ci yang 'gag par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: ci yang 'gag par mi 'gyur te //
translated: and does not cease at all,

original: 'jig rten rnam par dben mthong ba //🔽de la yod dang med pa med //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam par dben mthong ba // de la yod dang med pa med //
translated: seeing the world as empty,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: there is neither existence nor non-existence.

original: de la don ni de yin te //
analyzed: de la don ni de yin te //
translated: The meaning is this:

original: yod pa'i zlas drangs nas med pa rnam par @74a * //
analyzed: yod pa'i zlas drangs nas med pa rnam par @74a * //
translated: Non-existence is posited by the contrast of existence,

original: gzhag ste / dper na zhi gnas med pa la sogs pa med pa rnam pa gsum lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhag ste / dper na zhi gnas med pa la sogs pa med pa rnam pa gsum lta bu'o //
translated: like the three kinds of non-existence, such as the non-existence of meditative serenity.

original: med pa'i zlas drangs nas yod pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i zlas drangs nas yod pa ste /
translated: Existence is drawn by the contrast of non-existence,

original: dper na skye ba snga na med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skye ba snga na med pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the non-existence prior to arising.

original: snga na yod pa skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: snga na yod pa skye 'gyur na //
translated: If what existed before arose,

original: skyes pa yang ni skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes pa yang ni skye bar 'gyur //
translated: then what has arisen would arise again.

original: zhe'o // de lta bas na /
analyzed: zhe'o // de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: blo gros bzang pos gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: blo gros bzang pos gang gsungs pa /
translated: As Subhūti said,🔽Those who see things as real or unreal,

original: gang dag bdag dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos po med mthong ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag bdag dngos gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos po med mthong ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: As existent or nonexistent,🔽They do not see

original: yang dag mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha’s teaching.

original: yang dag dngos rnams rten byas nas //
analyzed: yang dag dngos rnams rten byas nas //
translated: Having relied on the real things,

original: chu yi zla ba lta bur ni //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba lta bur ni //
translated: Like the moon in water,

original: yang dag ma yin log min par //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin log min par //
translated: They are neither real nor unreal.

original: 'dod pa de dag ltas mi 'phrogs //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag ltas mi 'phrogs //
translated: Those who assert this are not carried away by views.

original: thams cad rtag min mi rtag pa'ang //
analyzed: thams cad rtag min mi rtag pa'ang //
translated: Everything is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: ci yang med de rtag de bzhin //
analyzed: ci yang med de rtag de bzhin //
translated: Nothing is permanent, and likewise,

original: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag par //
analyzed: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag par //
translated: If things were permanent or impermanent,

original: 'gyur na de ni ga la yod //
analyzed: 'gyur na de ni ga la yod //
translated: How could that be?

original: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
translated: Whatever is expressed is to be known

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
translated: As empty by nature.

original: stong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
translated: Even that which is called “empty” is empty,

original: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
translated: Because there is nothing that is not empty.

original: su la stong nyid 'di 'byung ba //
analyzed: su la stong nyid 'di 'byung ba //
translated: For whom this emptiness arises,

original: de la don rnams thams cad 'byung //
analyzed: de la don rnams thams cad 'byung //
translated: For them all things arise.

original: su la stong nyid mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: su la stong nyid mi 'byung ba //
translated: For whom emptiness does not arise,

original: de la ci yang 'byung ba med //
analyzed: de la ci yang 'byung ba med //
translated: Nothing whatsoever arises from that.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is well said.

original: de bas na klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa chen po las /
analyzed: de bas na klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa chen po las /
translated: Therefore, in the Questions of the Nāga King Sāgara Sūtra it says:

original: sngon mtha' stong zhing phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong //
analyzed: sngon mtha' stong zhing phyi ma'i mtha' yang stong //
translated: The prior limit is empty and the later limit is also empty.

original: skye dang 'jig dang gnas pa'i dngos po stong //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig dang gnas pa'i dngos po stong //
translated: Things that arise, disintegrate, and endure are empty.

original: 'di ni dngos po yod min dngos med min //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po yod min dngos med min //
translated: This is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽'o na de ni rtogs gyur pas //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong // zhes gsungs so // 'o na de ni rtogs gyur pas //
translated: All phenomena are empty of their own essence.🔽If that is realized,

original: de yi rang bzhin mngon sum phyir //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin mngon sum phyir //
translated: then the nature of that is directly perceived.

original: mi mkhas rnams kyang dngos rnams kyi //
analyzed: mi mkhas rnams kyang dngos rnams kyi //
translated: Even the unwise would realize

original: dngos po 'di 'dra cis mi rtogs //
analyzed: dngos po 'di 'dra cis mi rtogs //
translated: the suchness of things.

original: de rtogs na de'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa ni mi rigs te /🔽bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs na /
analyzed: de rtogs na de'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa ni mi rigs te / bum pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs na /
translated: If that is realized, it is not reasonable that its nature is not realized,🔽just as when one observes a ground that is empty of pots,

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa bum pas dben pa rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa bum pas dben pa rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: one realizes the emptiness of pots that is the nature of the ground.

original: dngos po rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i lta ba dkar po ma yin pa tha shal rnams kyis kyang dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa las sgro btags pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i lta ba dkar po ma yin pa tha shal rnams kyis kyang dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med pa las sgro btags pas /
translated: Things are imputed by the inferior views of ordinary beings, who are not virtuous, as having the aspects of things, etc.

original: sgro btags pa yang dag pa ji skad du smos pa mtha' dag dang bral ba kho na yin par rtogs na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa yang dag pa ji skad du smos pa mtha' dag dang bral ba kho na yin par rtogs na /
translated: When one realizes that the imputation is only devoid of all the things mentioned, as they really are,

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin par mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin par mi rtogs she na /
translated: why would one not realize that things are that way?

original: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
analyzed: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
translated: No, because of the force of the beginningless continuum

original: dngos por sgro btags dbang byas pas //
analyzed: dngos por sgro btags dbang byas pas //
translated: of the power of the imputation of things.

original: de phyir srog chags thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir srog chags thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, all living beings

original: mngon sum rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not realize it by direct perception.

original: thog ma med pa'i srid par skyes pa dngos po la mngon par @74b zhen pa'i dug gis dkrugs pa'i blo can dag gis mngon sum tsam du rtogs pas rnam pa khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i srid par skyes pa dngos po la mngon par @74b zhen pa'i dug gis dkrugs pa'i blo can dag gis mngon sum tsam du rtogs pas rnam pa khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: Those whose minds are disturbed by the poison of attachment to things, who are born in cyclic existence without beginning, are unable to comprehend the aspects of things, because they only realize them by direct perception.

original: 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dmigs pas blo snad pa dag gis skad cig pa nyid mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dmigs pas blo snad pa dag gis skad cig pa nyid mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like those whose minds are impaired by the observation of a succession of similar moments, and so do not realize that things are momentary.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
translated: Moreover, this is not at all amazing.🔽For, although the shape of a cow, etc., which is devoid of a pot, a cow, etc., is not seen clearly,

original: 'di ltar bum pa dang ba lang nyid la sogs pas dben pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i dbyibs gsal bar ma mthong yang /🔽ser skya dang gzegs ma la spyod pa'i lugs kyis blo gros shin tu phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag de ltar rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dang ba lang nyid la sogs pas dben pa'i ba lang la sogs pa'i dbyibs gsal bar ma mthong yang / ser skya dang gzegs ma la spyod pa'i lugs kyis blo gros shin tu phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag de ltar rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: those who are extremely confused, such as the followers of Kapila and Kanada, do not understand it in that way.🔽But who do understand it?

original: 'o na su dag gis de rtogs she na /🔽bshad pa / de la sgro 'dogs gcod byed pa //🔽shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //🔽rjes su dpog pa rnam shes byed //
analyzed: 'o na su dag gis de rtogs she na / bshad pa / de la sgro 'dogs gcod byed pa // shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis // rjes su dpog pa rnam shes byed //
translated: It is said:🔽The yogins, the lords,🔽clearly perceive it through direct perception.

original: rnal 'byor dbang rnams mngon sum gsal //🔽dngos po la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba bsgrub pa phyogs tsam zhig ji skad bstan pa dag gi thos pa bas mtho ba /

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa bsags pa dag spros pa dang bral ba nges par brtag par byed do //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa bsags pa dag spros pa dang bral ba nges par brtag par byed do //
translated: The yogins, the lords, clearly perceive it through direct perception.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug rnams ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid du rnam par phye ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las byung ba'i ye shes rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma brtags na
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i dbang phyug rnams ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid du rnam par phye ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las byung ba'i ye shes rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis nang dang phyi'i dngos po ma brtags na
translated: The lords of yoga, through the wisdom that arises from the samadhi that discerns the nature of all phenomena as equality and so on, understand that internal and external things are without essence, like a plantain tree trunk,

original: dga' ba snying po med pa /
analyzed: dga' ba snying po med pa /
translated: and that they are not to be analyzed.

original: chu shing gi sdong po lta bu thams cad ji ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i sa bon yang phyis mi skye ba de ltar thugs su chud de /
analyzed: chu shing gi sdong po lta bu thams cad ji ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i sa bon yang phyis mi skye ba de ltar thugs su chud de /
translated: They understand that all things are without the essence of pleasure and are like a plantain tree trunk, such that the seeds of superimposition are never again produced.

original: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las /
translated: The sutra Engaging the mind with great compassion says:

original: ji ltar chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
translated: Just as the trunk of a wet plantain tree🔽is not found to have an essence🔽when one searches for it,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: so too is the body.

original: ched du brjod pa las kyang /🔽gang zhig au dum b'a ra dag la ma tog ltar //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa las kyang / gang zhig au dum b'a ra dag la ma tog ltar //
translated: The Udanavarga also says:

original: srid pa dag la snying po med par sems byed pa //
analyzed: srid pa dag la snying po med par sems byed pa //
translated: Those who think of existence as essenceless🔽like a flower in the sky🔽are monks who have gone beyond

original: dge slong 'di ni pha rol min pa'i pha rol son //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni pha rol min pa'i pha rol son //
translated: to the other side that is not this side.

original: sprul rgas pa yi pags pa rnying pa brje ba bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sprul rgas pa yi pags pa rnying pa brje ba bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as an old snake sheds its skin.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khas blangs na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par khas blangs na /
translated: If one accepts that all phenomena are essenceless,

original: phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa rang las ma grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa rang las ma grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: then because the property of the position and so forth are not established from itself, are not the conventions of the inferential evidence and the inferential subject not established?

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpog pa pos ji ltar gtan la dbab /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpog pa pos ji ltar gtan la dbab /
translated: Therefore, how could the inferential subject be determined by the inferential evidence?

original: gal te yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma brjod na /
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma brjod na /
translated: Moreover, if one does not state a reason proving that all phenomena are essenceless,

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs med par mi @75a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs med par mi @75a * //
translated: then at that time, because the reason is not stated,

original: 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po //
translated: the intended meaning is not established.

original: ci ste brjod na ni gtan tshigs yod de /
analyzed: ci ste brjod na ni gtan tshigs yod de /
translated: But if one does state it, then the reason exists.

original: de lta na yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par mi 'grub pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po //🔽'di ni ji na ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med par mi 'grub pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po // 'di ni ji na ste /
translated: In that case, because all phenomena are not established as essenceless, the intended meaning is not established.🔽This is just like the following analogy:

original: 'di ltar / gzhung gis bskyed pa'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhung gis bskyed pa'i bye brag gis //
translated: The difference is produced by the text.

original: chos can spangs nas mkhas pa dang // bud med byis pa'i bar dag la //
analyzed: chos can spangs nas mkhas pa dang // bud med byis pa'i bar dag la //
translated: And the learned, and women, and children,

original: grags par gyur pa'i dngos rnams la //🔽bsgrub dang sgrub pa'i dngos po 'di //
analyzed: grags par gyur pa'i dngos rnams la // bsgrub dang sgrub pa'i dngos po 'di //
translated: All the things that are renowned in the world,🔽The things that are established and the things that are to be established,

original: ma lus yang dag 'jug par 'gyur //🔽de lta min na gzhi ma grub //
analyzed: ma lus yang dag 'jug par 'gyur // de lta min na gzhi ma grub //
translated: All of these are properly engaged.🔽If that were not so, then how could you respond

original: la sogs lan ni ji skad gdab //🔽bdag ni snang ba'i ngang can gyi //
analyzed: la sogs lan ni ji skad gdab // bdag ni snang ba'i ngang can gyi //
translated: To the charge that your reason is not established?🔽I do not refute the things

original: dngos po dgag par mi byed de //
analyzed: dngos po dgag par mi byed de //
translated: That appear to the mind.🔽Therefore, there is no confusion

original: de lta bas na sgrub pa dang // bsgrub bya gzhag pa 'khrugs pa med //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgrub pa dang // bsgrub bya gzhag pa 'khrugs pa med //
translated: Between the thesis and the proof.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni phan tshun mi mthun pas grub pa'i mthas bskyed pa chos can tha dad pa yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni phan tshun mi mthun pas grub pa'i mthas bskyed pa chos can tha dad pa yongs su btang ste /
translated: All conventions of inference and the objects of inference are mutually inconsistent. Therefore, abandoning the different subjects that are produced by philosophical systems,

original: mkhas pa dang bud med dang byis pa'i bar gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi phyogs sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la brten nas 'jug go //
analyzed: mkhas pa dang bud med dang byis pa'i bar gyi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi phyogs sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la brten nas 'jug go //
translated: we engage in the inference of the things that are renowned in the world, from the eye, ear, and so on of the learned, the women, and the children, in dependence on subjects such as sound that appear to the mind.

original: de lta min na du ba dang / yod pa la sogs pa'i me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par 'dod pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta min na du ba dang / yod pa la sogs pa'i me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par 'dod pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the basis of the reason in all instances of the desire to prove such things as smoke, fire, and impermanence would not be established.

original: sgrub pa'i chos can yan lag can dang / nam mkha'i yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos can yan lag can dang / nam mkha'i yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subject of the probandum, the whole, and the nature of such things as the quality of space are not established.

original: de lta na chos gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i dpe'i chos can yang mi 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na chos gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i dpe'i chos can yang mi 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, the example subject that possesses both properties would not be established.

original: gal te bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad 'di lta bu 'di gzhan dag kyang khas len na ni de lta na mkhas pa brgal ba'i grags pa 'di ci dgos te /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'i tha snyad 'di lta bu 'di gzhan dag kyang khas len na ni de lta na mkhas pa brgal ba'i grags pa 'di ci dgos te /
translated: If you accept this kind of convention of probandum and proof, then what is the point of this dispute with the wise?

original: 'di ltar rang gi phyogs la mi lta bar gzhan gyi phyogs kyi nyes pa 'di nyid brjod du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi phyogs la mi lta bar gzhan gyi phyogs kyi nyes pa 'di nyid brjod du zad do //
translated: In this way, you are simply stating the faults of the opponent’s position without regard to your own position.

original: kho bo yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi dngos po ni mi sel mod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngang can gyi dngos po ni mi sel mod kyi /
translated: We do not reject things that appear to the consciousnesses of eyes and so on.

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyis dpyad na chu shing gi sdong po bzhin du snying po bag tsam yang mi snang bas don dam par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyis dpyad na chu shing gi sdong po bzhin du snying po bag tsam yang mi snang bas don dam par mi 'dod do //
translated: When examined by wisdom and knowledge, they do not appear to have even a trace of an essence, like a plantain tree trunk. Therefore, they are not accepted as ultimate.

original: de lta bas na snang ba'i don ma bkag pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa'i bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa'i tha snyad 'jug pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par smra ba la gnod pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na snang ba'i don ma bkag pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa'i bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa'i tha snyad 'jug pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med par smra ba la gnod pa ci yang med do //
translated: Thus, since the meaning of appearance is not refuted, there is no harm at all in the claim that all phenomena are essenceless, since the conventions of the proof and the probandum are engaged without adherence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: 'dzin pa sdug la mi brten na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa sdug la mi brten na //
translated: If one does not rely on the attachment to the object

original: tha snyad rab tu 'grub 'gyur la //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'grub 'gyur la //
translated: The convention will be well established.

original: tha snyad rnams la mkhas gyur na /
analyzed: tha snyad rnams la mkhas gyur na /
translated: If one is skilled in the conventions,

original: @75b bstan bcos don la rmongs pa med //🔽ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @75b bstan bcos don la rmongs pa med // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One will not be confused about the meaning of the treatise.

original: don dam pa'i tshul la sdang bas dbang sgyur ba gang dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la sdang bas dbang sgyur ba gang dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who are dominated by hatred of the ultimate

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par lta ba nyid ni med pa nyid du lta bar spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba nyid yin no zhes smra ba dang / de ltas rgyu dang 'bras bu skur 'debs pa ;
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par lta ba nyid ni med pa nyid du lta bar spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba nyid yin no zhes smra ba dang / de ltas rgyu dang 'bras bu skur 'debs pa ;
translated: Thus, the view that denies cause and effect

original: / log ltas dkar phyogs drungs 'byin dam chos kyi //
analyzed: / log ltas dkar phyogs drungs 'byin dam chos kyi //
translated: Is a wrong view that uproots the white forces,

original: lo tog ser ba nam mkha'i me tog 'di //
analyzed: lo tog ser ba nam mkha'i me tog 'di //
translated: A hail that destroys the crop of the sublime Dharma, a sky flower.

original: legs 'dod rnams kyis rgyang ring spang bar bya //
analyzed: legs 'dod rnams kyis rgyang ring spang bar bya //
translated: Those who desire goodness should cast it far away.

original: zhes smra ba de dag gi phyir 'di brjod de /
analyzed: zhes smra ba de dag gi phyir 'di brjod de /
translated: This is what we say in response to those who make such claims.

original: de phyir thog med srid rgyud nas //🔽dngos dang dngos med rtogs sogs kyi //
analyzed: de phyir thog med srid rgyud nas // dngos dang dngos med rtogs sogs kyi //
translated: Therefore, in the beginningless continuum of existence,

original: rigs mthun sa bon yod par ni //
analyzed: rigs mthun sa bon yod par ni //
translated: The seeds of similar type of the realization of things and nonthings

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yin //
translated: And so on must be inferred to exist.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu stobs kyis //
translated: This is not due to the power of things,

original: 'byung ba ma yin de med phyir //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin de med phyir //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid de //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi bdag nyid de //
translated: The nature of things

original: rgya cher rab tu bkag pa yin //🔽rim gyis 'byung phyir glo bur min //
analyzed: rgya cher rab tu bkag pa yin // rim gyis 'byung phyir glo bur min //
translated: Has been extensively refuted.🔽Because they arise gradually, they are not adventitious.

original: rtag 'byung ma yin rtag pa min //
analyzed: rtag 'byung ma yin rtag pa min //
translated: Because they do not arise permanently, they are not permanent.

original: de bas goms 'dra de nyid phyir /
analyzed: de bas goms 'dra de nyid phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is similar to the familiar.

original: dang po rang gi rigs las skyes //
analyzed: dang po rang gi rigs las skyes //
translated: It arises from its own type.

original: 'di ltar don dam par na dngos po 'di dag thams cad ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par na dngos po 'di dag thams cad ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba yin na /
translated: Thus, in reality, all these things are free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de lta bu de dag la blo dkar po ma yin pa rnams kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu de dag la blo dkar po ma yin pa rnams kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: However, for those who are not pure-minded, conceptual thoughts such as existence and nonexistence arise in regard to them.

original: de dag kyang thog ma med pa'i las dang srid pa la sogs pa'i rgyun nas rigs mthun pa'i sa bon bor na rgyu gzhan med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang thog ma med pa'i las dang srid pa la sogs pa'i rgyun nas rigs mthun pa'i sa bon bor na rgyu gzhan med do //
translated: And those arise from the seed of a homogeneous type that has been cast since beginningless time through the continuum of karma and becoming, etc., and there is no other cause.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise through the power of an object,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things that are the nature of existence and nonexistence, etc., have been extensively refuted.

original: de la gal te rang gi rigs mthun pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu med du zin na /
analyzed: de la gal te rang gi rigs mthun pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu med du zin na /
translated: In that regard, if they do not have a cause that is a seed of a homogeneous type,

original: de las lhag ma gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de las lhag ma gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: what other remainder is there?

original: 'o na skye ba'i rgyu med pa'am /🔽rgyu rtag pa skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na skye ba'i rgyu med pa'am / rgyu rtag pa skyes pa'am /
translated: But, you say, there is no cause for arising,

original: bdag nyid rtag pa de yod de /
analyzed: bdag nyid rtag pa de yod de /
translated: or else the cause is eternal, or else the effect is eternal, or else the self is eternal.

original: ji ltar glo bur 'byung bar smra ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la 'chel pa dang / shes pa yod pa rtag ces khas len pa lta bu'o zhe na /🔽de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar glo bur 'byung bar smra ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la 'chel pa dang / shes pa yod pa rtag ces khas len pa lta bu'o zhe na / de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: For example, the Sāṃkhyas say that the effect is eternal, the Vaiśeṣikas say that the cause is eternal, the Cārvākas say that things arise fortuitously, the followers of Īśvara say that Īśvara is the cause, and the followers of consciousness say that consciousness is eternal and is the cause.

original: de dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because they arise in sequence.

original: rgyu la mi ltos pa dang rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu la mi ltos pa dang rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: The cause that does not depend on another and that always exists is incompatible with sequential arising.

original: de bas na dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir tshe 'di la dang po byung ba dag kyang 'dra ba la goms pa'i bag chags las skye @76a * //🔽bar rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir tshe 'di la dang po byung ba dag kyang 'dra ba la goms pa'i bag chags las skye @76a * //🔽bar rjes su dpag ste /
translated: Therefore, because of the conceptualization of things, etc., we infer that even the first arising in this life arises from the latent predispositions of habituation to similarity.

original: skyes pa rnams gong nas gong du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa goms pa'i stobs las 'byung ba dngos po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams gong nas gong du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa goms pa'i stobs las 'byung ba dngos po la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: The man is differentiated by the distinctions of lesser, middling, greater, etc., which arise from the power of habit, like the conceptual thoughts of entity, etc.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i srid pa gzhan grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i srid pa gzhan grub po //
translated: Therefore, the other, beginningless existence, is established.

original: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin te /
translated: By this, the inference of future existence is also explained.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'chi ba'i sems la ni bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir sems gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'chi ba'i sems la ni bdag dang bdag gi la chags pa'i phyin ci log gi bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir sems gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor nus te /
translated: Thus, in the mind of death of one not free from attachment, because it is connected with the latent tendencies of error attached to “I” and “mine,” it is able to connect with another mind.

original: de sngon gyi sems skyes pa dang 'dra bas sgrub pa gsal lo //
analyzed: de sngon gyi sems skyes pa dang 'dra bas sgrub pa gsal lo //
translated: Because it is like the previously arisen mind, the proof is clear.

original: de phyir rtag chad lta ba rnams //
analyzed: de phyir rtag chad lta ba rnams //
translated: Therefore, the views of eternalism and nihilism

original: gzhung 'di la ni ring du gnas //
analyzed: gzhung 'di la ni ring du gnas //
translated: Dwell far from this treatise.

original: ldog dang rjes su 'jug pa yang //
analyzed: ldog dang rjes su 'jug pa yang //
translated: Also, the reversal and engagement

original: sa bon myu gu lcug sogs bzhin //
analyzed: sa bon myu gu lcug sogs bzhin //
translated: Are like the seed, sprout, and so on.

original: don dam par rtag pa dang tshad pa dag gi skabs med pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par rtag pa dang tshad pa dag gi skabs med pa nyid de /
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no occasion for permanence and annihilation.

original: de gnyis ni dngos po la brten pa yin pas dngos po yod na de dag ltag la yod /
analyzed: de gnyis ni dngos po la brten pa yin pas dngos po yod na de dag ltag la yod /
translated: Since those two are based on entities, if entities exist, they exist.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas ni snga ma snga ma'i skad cig log na skad cig gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas dngos po rnams la thog ma dang tha ma med de /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas ni snga ma snga ma'i skad cig log na skad cig gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas dngos po rnams la thog ma dang tha ma med de /
translated: Based on the conventional truth, if the previous moment ceases, other moments arise, so entities do not have a beginning or an end.

original: phyi rol pa dag 'dod pa dang 'dra bas de gnyis shin tu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa dag 'dod pa dang 'dra bas de gnyis shin tu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are similar to what is asserted by non-Buddhists, those two do not exist at all.

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: yod na dngos po rtag 'gyur la //
analyzed: yod na dngos po rtag 'gyur la //
translated: If they exist, entities would be permanent.

original: med na nges par chad 'gyur te //
analyzed: med na nges par chad 'gyur te //
translated: If they do not exist, they would definitely be annihilated.

original: dngos yod gnyi gar 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: dngos yod gnyi gar 'gyur bas na //
translated: Since entities would be both,

original: de phyir dngos po khas mi blang //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po khas mi blang //
translated: therefore entities are not accepted.

original: gang phyir dngos por rang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos por rang 'byung ba //
translated: Since entities arise by themselves,

original: de phyir chad par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: therefore they do not become annihilated.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Since entities cease,

original: de phyir rtag par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir rtag par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: therefore they do not become permanent.

original: gang dag byang chub brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub brten pa'i phyir //
translated: Those who are steadfast in enlightenment

original: don du med par khas mi 'che //
analyzed: don du med par khas mi 'che //
translated: do not deny the non-existent.

original: mi sems spyod par mi byed pa //
analyzed: mi sems spyod par mi byed pa //
translated: They do not think, they do not act;

original: de dag ji ltar med par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar med par 'dod //
translated: how can they be said to be non-existent?

original: ce'o // dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
analyzed: ce'o // dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
translated: The Ratnamegha-sutra also says,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is it that the bodhisattva is skilled in the Great Vehicle?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la yang slob la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la yang slob la /
translated: Here the bodhisattva trains in all the trainings,

original: slob pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: slob pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: but does not apprehend the training,

original: bslab pa'i lam la yang mi dmigs gang slob pa de yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i lam la yang mi dmigs gang slob pa de yang mi dmigs te /
translated: does not apprehend the path of training, and does not apprehend the one who trains.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chad par lta bar mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen de dang gzhi des chad par lta bar mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that reason, for that cause, for that condition, for that basis, he does not fall into the view of annihilation.”

original: yang de nyid las //
analyzed: yang de nyid las //
translated: And the same text says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis gzugs la rtog / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa @76b la rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis gzugs la rtog / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa @76b la rnam par rtog ste /
translated: “Here, son of noble family, the bodhisattva examines form with right wisdom, and examines feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de gzugs la rtog pa na gzugs kyi skye ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: de gzugs la rtog pa na gzugs kyi skye ba mi dmigs /
translated: When he investigates form, he does not observe the arising of form.

original: kun 'byung ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mi dmigs /
translated: He does not observe its origination.

original: 'gag pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'gag pa mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not observe its cessation.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba mi dmigs /
translated: He does not observe the arising of feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: kun 'byung ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mi dmigs /
translated: He does not observe their origination.

original: 'gag pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'gag pa mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not observe their cessation.

original: de yang don dam par skye ba med par dpyod pa'i shes rab kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang don dam par skye ba med par dpyod pa'i shes rab kyis yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this is done by the wisdom that analyzes the ultimate non-arising of things,

original: tha snyad kyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: not by the conventional nature of things.

original: rnam par grol ba yang gzhung 'di la sla ba nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yang gzhung 'di la sla ba nyid de /
translated: Liberation is also easy in this system.

original: 'di ltar / chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
translated: Thus, the skilled one in the selflessness of phenomena

original: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa goms byas pas //
translated: becomes accustomed to the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
translated: The afflictions that arise from error

original: nyon mongs sgrim pa med par spong //
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrim pa med par spong //
translated: are abandoned without effort.

original: zla ba'i sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du /
analyzed: zla ba'i sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du /
translated: The Moon Lamp Concentration Sūtra says:

original: des gang chags pa dang / gang la chags pa dang / gang gis chags pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: des gang chags pa dang / gang la chags pa dang / gang gis chags pa'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: He does not see the thing that is attached, the thing to which one is attached, or the thing that is attached.

original: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
translated: And here it is also said:

original: dngos por khas len yod na ni //
analyzed: dngos por khas len yod na ni //
translated: If one accepts things as real,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
translated: attachment and aversion will arise.

original: lta ba ma rungs yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: lta ba ma rungs yongs su 'dzin //
translated: One will hold to a bad view,

original: de las byung ba'i rtsod par 'gyur //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rtsod par 'gyur //
translated: and from that, disputes will arise.

original: de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
translated: That is the cause of all views.

original: de med nyon mongs mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: de med nyon mongs mi 'byung ste //
translated: If that does not exist, the afflictions will not arise.

original: de bas de ni yongs shes na //
analyzed: de bas de ni yongs shes na //
translated: Therefore, if one fully understands that,

original: lta dang nyon mongs yongs su 'byung //
analyzed: lta dang nyon mongs yongs su 'byung //
translated: views and afflictions will be fully understood.

original: gang gis de shes 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gang gis de shes 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If one asks, “By what will that be understood?”

original: rten cing 'byung ba mthong bas te //
analyzed: rten cing 'byung ba mthong bas te //
translated: It is said, “By seeing dependent origination.”🔽The supreme knower of reality said,

original: brten nas skyes pa ma skyes zhes //🔽yang dag mkhyen pa mchog gis gsungs //
analyzed: brten nas skyes pa ma skyes zhes //🔽yang dag mkhyen pa mchog gis gsungs //
translated: “What arises dependently does not arise.”

original: she'o // gzhan yang rang bzhin med pa'i tshul la gang mi 'thad do zhes rgol ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: she'o // gzhan yang rang bzhin med pa'i tshul la gang mi 'thad do zhes rgol ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang yin / rnam par byang ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is the afflictive state of karma and birth, and what is the state of purification?

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad la sogs pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad la sogs pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the connection between karma and its effects, and what is the convention of inference and the inferred?

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / gnyen po goms par byas pa shin tu nyams su len pas nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa sdug pa dang mi sdug pa 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / gnyen po goms par byas pa shin tu nyams su len pas nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa sdug pa dang mi sdug pa 'byung ba dang /
translated: The relationship of cause and effect between the links of existence such as ignorance and formation, the arising of the state that is the opposite of the afflictions through the practice of cultivating the antidote, and the arising of the pleasant and unpleasant results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //🔽de ni de 'dra'i rtags sems kyi //
analyzed: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa // de ni de 'dra'i rtags sems kyi //
translated: The entity that is the way things really are🔽Is the cause of the mind that is the sign of that.

original: rgyu yin de las de lta'i dngos //
analyzed: rgyu yin de las de lta'i dngos //
translated: From that, the entity that is like that🔽Arises.

original: de bas des bskyed rtags can blo //
analyzed: de bas des bskyed rtags can blo //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is generated by that

original: zhes bya ba de @77a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de @77a * //
translated: is like that.🔽If you accept that, then you should definitely accept this response to all🔽criticisms: the relation of producer and produced is not tenable.

original: lta bu ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa'i dngos po ma yin nam gal te de lta na yang po ma bu cig car klan ka ngan pa thams cad kyi lan gdab pa 'di nges par zung shig / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: lta bu ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed pa'i dngos po ma yin nam gal te de lta na yang po ma bu cig car klan ka ngan pa thams cad kyi lan gdab pa 'di nges par zung shig / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni //
translated: The relation of cause and effect

original: kun rdzob tu ni ma bzlog pas //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ma bzlog pas //
translated: is not refuted conventionally.

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang sogs //
translated: Therefore, the presentation of affliction and purification

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'khrugs pa med //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'khrugs pa med //
translated: is not disturbed.🔽If you accept this presentation as ultimate, and strive for it, then at that🔽time, you should prove that from the subtle particles up to consciousness

original: gal te rnam par gzhag pa 'di don dam par khas len cing rab tu 'bad na de'i tshe rdul phra mo la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa la thug pa'i bar dag gcig pa'am du ma'i rang bzhin du sgrubs shig / sbyor ba sngar brjod pa rnams
analyzed: gal te rnam par gzhag pa 'di don dam par khas len cing rab tu 'bad na de'i tshe rdul phra mo la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa la thug pa'i bar dag gcig pa'am du ma'i rang bzhin du sgrubs shig / sbyor ba sngar brjod pa rnams
translated: are either one or many. You should also respond to the previous arguments.

original: kyi lan yang thob shig /'di ltar 'di ma lus bar bden zhing brdzun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kyi lan yang thob shig /'di ltar 'di ma lus bar bden zhing brdzun pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, all of this is completely true and not false.

original: mi slu ba'i chos can no zhes nges par khas len to //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos can no zhes nges par khas len to //
translated: It is a nondeceptive phenomenon.

original: 'di skad ces kyang gsungs te /🔽rnam par dben don mi shes la //
analyzed: 'di skad ces kyang gsungs te / rnam par dben don mi shes la //
translated: The Buddha also said:🔽Those who do not understand the meaning of emptiness

original: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
analyzed: thos pa tsam la 'jug byed cing //
translated: Engage in mere study

original: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
analyzed: gang dag bsod nams mi byed pa //
translated: And do not perform meritorious actions.🔽Those inferior people are lost.🔽The existence of the effects of karma

original: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / las kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang ; /'gro ba dag kyang shin tu brjod //
analyzed: skyes bu tha shal de dag brlag / las kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang ; /'gro ba dag kyang shin tu brjod //
translated: And the transmigration of beings are well proclaimed.🔽The complete knowledge of their nature

original: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes dang // skye ba med pa dag kyang bstan //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes dang // skye ba med pa dag kyang bstan //
translated: And their nonarising are also taught.

original: 'jig rten dbang du rgyal ba rnams //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang du rgyal ba rnams //
translated: The victors, in consideration of the world,

original: nga dang nga yi zhes gsungs ltar //
analyzed: nga dang nga yi zhes gsungs ltar //
translated: Speak of “I” and “mine.”🔽In the same way, in consideration of the world,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams //🔽de bzhin dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams // de bzhin dgongs pa'i dbang gis gsungs //
translated: They speak of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: she'o // yang dmigs pa can gang dag na re lta ba 'di la ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bkang ba 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: she'o // yang dmigs pa can gang dag na re lta ba 'di la ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bkang ba 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: The reificationists ask, “How could it be tenable to complete the accumulations of merit and wisdom in this view?”

original: gal te 'khor gsum yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'khor gsum yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “It would be completely pure in terms of the three spheres.”

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not a correct reason.

original: 'di ltar mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gang byin pa des ni dad pa shin tu bskyed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gang byin pa des ni dad pa shin tu bskyed kyi /
translated: For, one who gives with the desire to worship and to benefit generates a great deal of faith.

original: gang gis sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But, one who abides in the nonapprehension of the gift, etc. does not.

original: 'di ltar ci yang med pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci yang med pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs mi dmigs sam /
translated: Is the nonapprehension of the gift, etc. due to the nonexistence of anything at all?

original: 'on te yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'on te yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs /
translated: Or, is it due to the fact that they are not objects?

original: phyogs dang po la ni gang la gang gis ci la yang byin pa med pas bsod nams med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni gang la gang gis ci la yang byin pa med pas bsod nams med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first case, since there is no gift, giver, or recipient, there would be no merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir ngal ba gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams med pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir ngal ba gang yin pa de yang sems can rnams med pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, the exertion of the bodhisattvas for the sake of sentient beings would be pointless, since sentient beings do not exist.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang / len pa po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @77b kyis gzigs te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang / len pa po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @77b kyis gzigs te /
translated: The Tathāgatas see the gift, giver, and recipient.

original: de bas na yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is not perceived because it is not an object.🔽If the other things to be given, such as a son, and the giver and receiver, and one’s own mind and mental factors, are known by oneself, then how can it be said that they are not objects?

original: gzhan sbyin par bya ba bu la sogs pa dang / len pa po dang sbyin pa po rang gi sems dang sems las byung ba de dag rang gis rig par byed na de ji ltar yul ma yin yang smras pa /🔽sbyin pa gang zhig phan gdags dang // mchod pa'i phyir yang sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan sbyin par bya ba bu la sogs pa dang / len pa po dang sbyin pa po rang gi sems dang sems las byung ba de dag rang gis rig par byed na de ji ltar yul ma yin yang smras pa / sbyin pa gang zhig phan gdags dang // mchod pa'i phyir yang sbyin byed pa //
translated: It is said:🔽The generosity that is practiced in order to benefit and worship

original: de ni shin tu dad par byed //
analyzed: de ni shin tu dad par byed //
translated: is the generosity that is practiced with great faith.

original: mthong med gnas pas ma yin no //🔽med pa'i phyir ni mi dmigs sam //
analyzed: mthong med gnas pas ma yin no // med pa'i phyir ni mi dmigs sam //
translated: It is not practiced by one who abides in the absence of seeing.🔽Is it not perceived because it does not exist?

original: 'on te yul min phyir ram ci //
analyzed: 'on te yul min phyir ram ci //
translated: Or is it because it is not an object?

original: med na bsod nams 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: med na bsod nams 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, merit would be destroyed.

original: ngal ba'i don yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngal ba'i don yang med par 'gyur //
translated: And the purpose of hardship would be meaningless.

original: gsum char rgyal bas gzigs pas na //
analyzed: gsum char rgyal bas gzigs pas na //
translated: Since the Victor sees all three,

original: de bas yul min ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas yul min ma yin no //
translated: it is not that it is not an object.

original: rang gi sems dang sems byung gang //
analyzed: rang gi sems dang sems byung gang //
translated: Whatever is one’s own mind and mental factors

original: de dag rang gis rig par byed //
analyzed: de dag rang gis rig par byed //
translated: is known by oneself.

original: ces rgol ba de la sogs pa thams cad kyang //
analyzed: ces rgol ba de la sogs pa thams cad kyang //
translated: All of these objections and so on

original: de kho na mthong ba ltar mngon par shes pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba ltar mngon par shes pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since the superknowledges are not like the seeing of reality,

original: rgal bar bstan pa /🔽'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: rgal bar bstan pa / 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
translated: the objection is presented:🔽Since these phenomena of cause and effect

original: chos 'di rnam par gzhag pas na //
analyzed: chos 'di rnam par gzhag pas na //
translated: are posited in this way,

original: tshogs rnams dri ma med pa yang //
analyzed: tshogs rnams dri ma med pa yang //
translated: the collections are stainless

original: gzhung 'di nyid la rung ba yin //
analyzed: gzhung 'di nyid la rung ba yin //
translated: in this very treatise.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las ni //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las ni //
translated: From a pure cause

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'byung //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'byung //
translated: a pure effect arises.

original: yang dag ltas byung tshul khrims kyis //
analyzed: yang dag ltas byung tshul khrims kyis //
translated: From right view arises pure ethics,

original: yan lag la sogs rnam dag bzhin //
analyzed: yan lag la sogs rnam dag bzhin //
translated: like the purity of the limbs and so on.

original: de bzhin rnam dag ma yin las //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam dag ma yin las //
translated: Likewise, from an impure cause

original: 'bras bu rnam dag ma yin 'byung //🔽log lta'i stobs las byung ba yi //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam dag ma yin 'byung // log lta'i stobs las byung ba yi //
translated: an impure effect arises.🔽Like sexual misconduct and so on,

original: log par g-yem pa sogs pa bzhin //
analyzed: log par g-yem pa sogs pa bzhin //
translated: which arise from the power of wrong view.

original: 'bras bu thams cad ni rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang mthun par byed pas de rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa dang rnam par ma dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad ni rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang mthun par byed pas de rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa dang rnam par ma dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Since all effects accord with the presence and absence of their causes, they become pure or impure due to pure or impure causes.

original: dper na / legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod pa dang med ces zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na / legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod pa dang med ces zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “The results of good and bad actions are nonexistent.”

original: yang dag pa dang log par lta bas sngon du drangs pa'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / bag yod pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la sogs pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang log par lta bas sngon du drangs pa'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / bag yod pa'i yan lag la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la sogs pa de bzhin no //
translated: Also, the branches of morality and the branches of heedfulness, etc., which are preceded by right and wrong views, and sexual misconduct, etc., are like that.

original: 'dis ci zhig 'grub can /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig 'grub can /
translated: What is established by this?🔽It is stated:

original: bstan pa / tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas na //
analyzed: bstan pa / tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas na //
translated: Because of the presence of the damage of valid cognition,

original: dngos por dmigs pa yod pa ni //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa yod pa ni //
translated: The existence of the observation of things

original: smig rgyu la sogs shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs shes pa bzhin //
translated: Is like the cognition of a mirage, etc.

original: phyin ci log par yongs su rtogs //
analyzed: phyin ci log par yongs su rtogs //
translated: It is a mistaken conception.

original: yang dag par na @78a * //
analyzed: yang dag par na @78a * //
translated: In reality,

original: dngos po thams cad ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pas yod pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pas yod pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Since it is not tenable that all things have the nature of being one or many, the valid cognition that damages existence has already been explained.

original: rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul nyid la gnod pa'i tshad ma yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul nyid la gnod pa'i tshad ma yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of the object of knowledge and the knower, and the invalidating cognition with respect to the object itself, have already been explained.

original: de lta bas na 'di yang dag par yod do zhes mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di yang dag par yod do zhes mngon par zhen te /
translated: Therefore, this is the misconception that conceives of things as real.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la dmigs pa ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin te /
translated: The observation of all things, such as the object of giving, is a misconception because it is invalidated by valid cognition.

original: smig rgyu'i tshogs la chur shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i tshogs la chur shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa //🔽de phyir de mthus byung ba yi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gyur pa // de phyir de mthus byung ba yi //
translated: Because it is so,

original: pha rol phyin pa sgrub pa kun //🔽bdag dang bdag gir log pa las //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa sgrub pa kun // bdag dang bdag gir log pa las //
translated: all the practices of the perfections🔽that arise from that🔽are weak,

original: byung ba bzhin du stobs chung ngo //
analyzed: byung ba bzhin du stobs chung ngo //
translated: like those that arise from the misconception of self and entities connected to the self.

original: ji ltar phyi dang nang gi mu stegs can rnams kyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa la nan tan byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi dang nang gi mu stegs can rnams kyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa la nan tan byed pa /
translated: How is it that the non-Buddhist practitioners of the past and present practice giving, morality, and so on?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las byung ba ni de ma thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
