analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las byung ba ni de ma thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: The view of the transitory collection does not immediately become the factors of perfect enlightenment.

original: stobs chung ba de bzhin du dmigs pa can rnams kyi yang stobs chung ste /
analyzed: stobs chung ba de bzhin du dmigs pa can rnams kyi yang stobs chung ste /
translated: Likewise, the view of those who have objects is weak,

original: phyin ci log las byung bar bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung bar bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from error, and because it is not distinguished.

original: dngos por dmigs pa med pa las //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa med pa las //
translated: It arises from the non-apprehension of an object.

original: byung ba 'bras bu chen po ste //
analyzed: byung ba 'bras bu chen po ste //
translated: It is the great result,

original: rgyas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
translated: because it arises from the cause of expansion.

original: sa bon grung po'i myug sogs bzhin ;
analyzed: sa bon grung po'i myug sogs bzhin ;
translated: It is like the sprout of a strong seed.

original: / yod pa dang rig par bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / yod pa dang rig par bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because existence and the object of knowledge are untenable,

original: yang dag par na rig par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag par na rig par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: in reality, the object of knowledge and so forth are not apprehended.

original: rgyas pa'i rgyu ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyu ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of expansion is non-erroneous,

original: gang zag la bdag med par lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par lta ba bzhin no //
translated: like the view of the selflessness of persons.

original: de las byung ba sbyin pa la sogs pa ni stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyus sngon du drangs ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de las byung ba sbyin pa la sogs pa ni stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyus sngon du drangs ba'i phyir ;
translated: The giving and so forth that arise from that are drawn forth by the cause of strength,

original: 'bras bu shin tu rgya che ba mngon par sgrub nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu shin tu rgya che ba mngon par sgrub nus par 'gyur te /
translated: One is able to accomplish a very vast result,

original: sa bon grung po las byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon grung po las byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a sprout that comes from a healthy seed.

original: 'di ni chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Compendium of Dharma:

original: chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: “All phenomena are without reference point.

original: de la rnam par shes pa mi 'jug go zhe'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa mi 'jug go zhe'o //
translated: Consciousness does not engage with them.”

original: yang de nyid las ;
analyzed: yang de nyid las ;
translated: And in the same text:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mthong ba ni yang dag par mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ma mthong ba ni yang dag par mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Blessed One, not seeing any phenomena is seeing reality.”

original: rgyal ba bskyed ma las kyang /
analyzed: rgyal ba bskyed ma las kyang /
translated: And in the Sutra of the Mother of the Victorious Ones:

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhuti, what do you think?

original: shar phyogs kyi nam mkha'i tshad gzung bar sla 'am /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi nam mkha'i tshad gzung bar sla 'am /
translated: Is it easy to measure the sky in the east?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhuti replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags @78b so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags @78b so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Blessed One, that is not so.”

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang mi gnas par sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de'i bsod nams kyi phung po yang tshad gzung bar sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gang mi gnas par sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de'i bsod nams kyi phung po yang tshad gzung bar sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, it is not easy to measure the mass of merit of a bodhisattva who gives gifts without taking anything as a basis.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi zhig mun par zhugs nas //
analyzed: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi zhig mun par zhugs nas //
translated: For example, a person with eyes, having entered the darkness,

original: ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du gang dngos por lhung ba las sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba byang chub sems dpar blta'o //
analyzed: ci yang mi mthong ba de bzhin du gang dngos por lhung ba las sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba byang chub sems dpar blta'o //
translated: would not see anything. In the same way, you should see a bodhisattva who gives gifts while falling into the belief in a real self.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam langs te nyi ma shar nas mig dang ldan pa'i mis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dag mthong ba de bzhin du gang dngos por ma lhung bas sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpar blta'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na / nam langs te nyi ma shar nas mig dang ldan pa'i mis gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs dag mthong ba de bzhin du gang dngos por ma lhung bas sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpar blta'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: For example, when dawn breaks and the sun rises, a person with eyes would see various forms. In the same way, you should see a bodhisattva who gives gifts without falling into the belief in a real self.

original: mchod pa dang phan 'dogs par 'dod bas gang sbyin pa de 'khor gsum yongs su dag par byin na de nyid blo gros dang ldan pa rnams la shin tu dad pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchod pa dang phan 'dogs par 'dod bas gang sbyin pa de 'khor gsum yongs su dag par byin na de nyid blo gros dang ldan pa rnams la shin tu dad pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: When one gives what is to be given with the desire to worship and to benefit, and one gives it with the three spheres completely purified, then that very thing becomes a basis for the faith of the wise.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Thus, this non-apprehension is non-erroneous,

original: de yang gti mug med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gti mug med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: and that is the root of the wholesome which is without delusion.

original: bsod nams dang 'jig pa dang ngal ba don med bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: bsod nams dang 'jig pa dang ngal ba don med bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni /
translated: Nor does it follow that merit, destruction, and useless fatigue are pointless, because the reality of cause and effect

original: kun rdzob tu nam bzlog pas zhes pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu nam bzlog pas zhes pas bstan zin to //
translated: has been explained by “is never refuted in the conventional.”

original: gsum char yang gzigs zhes bya ba yang kun rdzob pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum char yang gzigs zhes bya ba yang kun rdzob pa nyid do //
translated: And the statement “all three are seen” is also conventional.🔽And self-awareness is included in conventional truth, because it cannot withstand analysis as having the nature of being either one or many.

original: rang gi rig pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa nyid de gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa yang kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa nyid de gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas gtan la phab zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been established.

original: de'i phyir 'chos zin pa yang mi 'cha'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chos zin pa yang mi 'cha'o //
translated: Therefore, what has been repaired is not repaired.

original: gang dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dam bcas bas rgol ba ngan pa thams cad kyi lan btab phar 'dod pa'i kun rdzob kyi dngos po de dag gang yin pa de dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dam bcas bas rgol ba ngan pa thams cad kyi lan btab phar 'dod pa'i kun rdzob kyi dngos po de dag gang yin pa de dpyad par bya'o //
translated: We must examine what these things are that are accepted as causes and effects, in order to answer all the bad arguments.

original: ci sems dang sems las byung ba tsam gyi bdag nyid kho na'ang /
analyzed: ci sems dang sems las byung ba tsam gyi bdag nyid kho na'ang /
translated: Are they only of the nature of mind and mental factors?

original: ci'i phyir bdag nyid kyang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag nyid kyang yin zhe na /
translated: Or are they also of the nature of the self?

original: de la kha cig ni phyogs phyi ma la brten te bstan bcos las sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa ni byed pa po dang zab po dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad du smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni phyogs phyi ma la brten te bstan bcos las sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa ni byed pa po dang zab po dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad du smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: Some, relying on the latter position, say that the treatise declares that “it is mind only” in order to refute the agent and the experiencer.

original: gzhan dag sems pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems pa ni /
translated: Others think that

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba yang //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur ba yang //
translated: The cause and the effect

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na ste //
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na ste //
translated: Are only consciousness.

original: rang gis grub pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: rang gis grub pa gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is self-established

original: de ni shes par gnas pa yin//
analyzed: de ni shes par gnas pa yin//
translated: Is established as consciousness.

original: @79a * // rang gis grub pa'i ngo bor na shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan rtog pa med do //
analyzed: @79a * // rang gis grub pa'i ngo bor na shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan rtog pa med do //
translated: If it is self-established, it is established as the nature of consciousness, and there is no other conceptualization.

original: rang gis grub pa'i rang bzhin yang rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gis grub pa'i rang bzhin yang rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: And the nature of the object that is established is like the form in a dream or an illusion.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol du 'dod pa rnams shes pa las gud na yod par bzhugs na yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i tshe na rab tu nye ba'i rgyu med pas rig par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol du 'dod pa rnams shes pa las gud na yod par bzhugs na yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa'i tshe na rab tu nye ba'i rgyu med pas rig par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Even if the external objects such as form, etc., were to exist apart from consciousness, they would not be known, because, like the eye, etc., they would not be a cause that is present at the same time or at a different time.

original: de lta bas na de dag myong ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sngon po la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa myong ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag myong ba ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sngon po la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa myong ba ste /
translated: Thus, the experience of those is not different from the experience of the form of blue, etc.

original: myong ba'i ngo bo yin pas rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: myong ba'i ngo bo yin pas rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i gzugs myong ba bzhin no //
translated: Since it is the nature of experience, it is like the experience of the form in a dream or an illusion.

original: gal te shes pa'i rnam pa bskyed pa'i don gzhan zhig 'bras bu las gud na yod par rjes su dpog na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i rnam pa bskyed pa'i don gzhan zhig 'bras bu las gud na yod par rjes su dpog na /
translated: If one infers that an object that is different from consciousness and that generates the form of consciousness exists apart from the result,

original: de lta na yang mngon sum du grub par ma gyur gyi rjes su dpag par zad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum du grub par ma gyur gyi rjes su dpag par zad do //
translated: even so, it is not established by direct perception but only by inference.

original: de lta na yang 'di med par grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di med par grub ste /
translated: Even so, it is established that it does not exist.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges par yod pa dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges par yod pa dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the condition as the antecedent of the next moment is definitely present, and because the subtle atom and so on are refuted.

original: / de ltar byas na sdug po bkod pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba thams cad dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar byas na sdug po bkod pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba thams cad dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: If it is done in this way, it is in agreement with all that is taught in the Gandavyuha, the Samdhinirmocana, and so on.🔽In the Lankaavatara,

original: lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: it is taught:

original: phyi rol gzugs ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gzugs ni yod ma yin //
translated: External form does not exist.

original: rang gi sems ni phyi rol snang //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni phyi rol snang //
translated: One's own mind appears as external.

original: zhes bstan pa 'di yang legs par bshad pa min no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa 'di yang legs par bshad pa min no snyam du sems so //
translated: I think that this is not a good explanation.

original: blo'i mthu mi chung ba dang lhag par mngon du brtson pa dag gis kyang sems de la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du brtags na /🔽don dam par snying po mi mthong bas /
analyzed: blo'i mthu mi chung ba dang lhag par mngon du brtson pa dag gis kyang sems de la gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du brtags na / don dam par snying po mi mthong bas /
translated: Even those who have a little mental power and who strive with special effort, when they examine that mind as to whether it is of the nature of one or many,🔽do not see an ultimate essence.

original: yang dag par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the correct assertion.🔽Hence:

original: de'i phyir / sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
translated: Relying on mind only,

original: phyi rol dngos med shes par bya //
analyzed: phyi rol dngos med shes par bya //
translated: one should know that external things do not exist.

original: tshul 'dir brten nas de la yang //
analyzed: tshul 'dir brten nas de la yang //
translated: Relying on this method,

original: shin tu bdag med shes par bya //
analyzed: shin tu bdag med shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that it is utterly devoid of self.

original: sems tsam gyi tshul la brten nas /🔽mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i sems las phyi rol du 'dod pa bdag dang bdag gi dpe /
analyzed: sems tsam gyi tshul la brten nas / mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i sems las phyi rol du 'dod pa bdag dang bdag gi dpe /
translated: Relying on the Mind Only system,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par tshegs med pa kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par tshegs med pa kho nar rtogs so //
translated: one realizes without difficulty that what is asserted to be external to the mind and its concomitant factors, such as the self, the person, the inner sense source, the outer sense sources, the object apprehended, the apprehending subject, and so on, are all devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: tshul 'di ni rang 'byung ba med pas sems de rang bzhin med par rtogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni rang 'byung ba med pas sems de rang bzhin med par rtogs su zin kyang /
translated: This system is not self-originated. Therefore, although one realizes that the mind is devoid of intrinsic existence,

original: mtha' thams cad spangs pa dbu ma'i lam 'di rtogs na /
analyzed: mtha' thams cad spangs pa dbu ma'i lam 'di rtogs na /
translated: if one realizes this path of the middle way that abandons all extremes,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas rang bzhin med par shin tu rtogs so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas rang bzhin med par shin tu rtogs so //
translated: one will realize very well that it is devoid of intrinsic existence, since it is devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten @79b las 'das pa'i le'u las /🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gzhan yang khams gsum pa ni sems tsam du rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten @79b las 'das pa'i le'u las / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gzhan yang khams gsum pa ni sems tsam du rtogs te /
translated: Thus, in the Sūtra on Transcendent Wisdom, the chapter on the supramundane states,🔽“O children of the Victorious One, moreover, one should realize that the three realms are mind only.

original: dus gsum yang sems dang mtshungs par rtogs so //
analyzed: dus gsum yang sems dang mtshungs par rtogs so //
translated: One should realize that the three times are also the same as the mind.”

original: sems de yang mtha' dang dbus med par khong du chud do zhes bstan pa 'di legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems de yang mtha' dang dbus med par khong du chud do zhes bstan pa 'di legs par bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: And the mind is understood to be without middle or end.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtha' dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbus med pa'i phyir mtha' dang dbus med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtha' dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbus med pa'i phyir mtha' dang dbus med pa'o //
translated: This is well explained, because it has no end or middle, since it has no end of arising and destruction, nor a middle with the character of enduring.

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Dharmasangiti:

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni kun brtags pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni kun brtags pa'i snying po ste /
translated: Bhagavat, all dharmas have a core of imagination.

original: sems tsam du bas pa rdzas ma mchis pa sgyu ma ltar rtsa ba ma mchis pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems tsam du bas pa rdzas ma mchis pa sgyu ma ltar rtsa ba ma mchis pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are exhausted in mind only, insubstantial, rootless, like an illusion.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Lankaavatara:

original: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni brten nas su //
translated: Relying on mind only,

original: phyi rol don la mi rtog go //
analyzed: phyi rol don la mi rtog go //
translated: one does not imagine external objects.

original: yang dag dmigs par gnas nas su //🔽sems tsam las kyang shin tu bzla //
analyzed: yang dag dmigs par gnas nas su // sems tsam las kyang shin tu bzla //
translated: Dwelling in the right object,🔽one goes beyond mind only.

original: sems tsam las ni bzlas nas kyang //
analyzed: sems tsam las ni bzlas nas kyang //
translated: Having gone beyond mind only,

original: snang ba med las shin tu bzla //
analyzed: snang ba med las shin tu bzla //
translated: one goes beyond the absence of appearances.

original: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: snang med gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who dwells in the absence of appearances

original: de yis theg pa chen por mthong //
analyzed: de yis theg pa chen por mthong //
translated: sees the Mahayana.

original: 'jug pa lhun gyis grub cing zhi //
analyzed: 'jug pa lhun gyis grub cing zhi //
translated: Its activity is spontaneous and peaceful.

original: smon lam dag gis rnam par sbyangs //
analyzed: smon lam dag gis rnam par sbyangs //
translated: It is purified by the power of aspiration.

original: ye shes dam pa bdag med pa //🔽snang ba med la mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa bdag med pa // snang ba med la mi mthong ngo //
translated: The highest wisdom is non-self.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not seen in the absence of appearances.🔽Also: The cessation of causes and conditions,

original: yang / rgyu dang rkyen ni rnam log dang ; / rgyu yang nges par bkag pa dang // sems tsam rnam par gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: yang / rgyu dang rkyen ni rnam log dang ; / rgyu yang nges par bkag pa dang // sems tsam rnam par gzhag pa ni //
translated: The refutation of causes, and the establishment of mind-only

original: skye ba med par dag bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba med par dag bstan to //
translated: Are taught to be the absence of arising.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phyi dngos med //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phyi dngos med //
translated: Things have no external reality.

original: sems kyang yongs su gzung ma yin //
analyzed: sems kyang yongs su gzung ma yin //
translated: The mind also is not apprehended.

original: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir //🔽skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spang ba'i phyir // skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In order to abandon all views,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The characteristic of non-arising is taught.

original: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is also said:

original: 'di la skye ba ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la skye ba ci yang med //
translated: Here there is no arising at all,

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba ci yang med //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba ci yang med //
translated: Nor is there any cessation at all.🔽Arising and cessation

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dag / shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dag / shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //
translated: Are only the mind itself.

original: 'byung ba tshe la sogs bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba tshe la sogs bshad pa //
translated: The arising of the elements and so on

original: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
analyzed: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
translated: Are subsumed in consciousness.

original: de shes pas ni 'bral 'gyur na //
analyzed: de shes pas ni 'bral 'gyur na //
translated: By knowing that, one becomes free.

original: log par rnam brtags ma yin nam//
analyzed: log par rnam brtags ma yin nam//
translated: Are not misapprehensions?

original: zhe'o ; / tshul gnyis shing rta zhon nas su //
analyzed: zhe'o ; / tshul gnyis shing rta zhon nas su //
translated: Those who ride the chariot of the two approaches

original: rig pa'i srab skyogs 'ju byed pa //
analyzed: rig pa'i srab skyogs 'ju byed pa //
translated: And hold the reins of reasoning

original: de dag de phyir ji bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag de phyir ji bzhin no //
translated: Are therefore just as they should be.

original: theg pa chen po pa nyid thob //
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa nyid thob //
translated: They have attained the Mahayana.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la 'jug pa rnams /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la 'jug pa rnams /
translated: Those who engage in inference based on the power of fact

original: tshul gnyis brjod pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: tshul gnyis brjod pas bsdus pa /
translated: Are included in the two approaches.🔽The Mahayana is the vehicle

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshegs @80a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshegs @80a * //
translated: In which the tathagatas have gone and will go.

original: shing rjes su gshegs pa'i theg pa chen pos dngos po mtha' dag rang bzhin med par khong du chud par byed de /
analyzed: shing rjes su gshegs pa'i theg pa chen pos dngos po mtha' dag rang bzhin med par khong du chud par byed de /
translated: It causes one to understand that all things are essenceless.

original: shing rta chen po la zhon pa dag kha bsdams pa'i srab skyogs legs par bzung ba bzhin du don dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yang dag par 'thob par byed do //
analyzed: shing rta chen po la zhon pa dag kha bsdams pa'i srab skyogs legs par bzung ba bzhin du don dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po zhes bya ba yang dag par 'thob par byed do //
translated: Those who ride the chariot of the Mahayana hold the reins of reasoning well, and they are said to have attained the authentic Mahayana.

original: lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The Lankavatara-sutra says:

original: tshul gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po de mdor bstan pa ni 'di snyed de /
analyzed: tshul gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i theg pa chen po de mdor bstan pa ni 'di snyed de /
translated: The Mahayana included in the two approaches is summarized as follows.

original: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin gsum //
analyzed: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin gsum //
translated: The five topics, the three natures,

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med gnyis kyi dngos por ni //🔽theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad nyid dang // bdag med gnyis kyi dngos por ni // theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
translated: The eight consciousnesses, the two kinds of selflessness,

original: zhes 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo ;
translated: All the Mahayana is included in these.

original: / tshul rnam pa 'di gnyis ni rnam 'dor dang / khyab 'jug dang mig mi bzang la sogs pas rnam pa mang du bshad la /
analyzed: / tshul rnam pa 'di gnyis ni rnam 'dor dang / khyab 'jug dang mig mi bzang la sogs pas rnam pa mang du bshad la /
translated: These two modes have been explained in many ways by the likes of Samkaranandana, Visnu, and Rahulabhadra.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod dam /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod dam / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the difference between the Mahayana and the Hinayana?

original: 'dud rtsi'i thigs pa gsang ba las bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dud rtsi'i thigs pa gsang ba las bstan pa /
translated: The following is taught in the Secret Drop of Elixir Tantra:🔽Mere consciousness is always pure,

original: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag /'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu grol pa yin //
analyzed: rnam rig tsam ni rtag tu rnam par dag /'di ltar sangs rgyas rtag tu grol pa yin //
translated: And thus the Buddha is always free.

original: blang dang dor ba med ces rab brtags pa //
analyzed: blang dang dor ba med ces rab brtags pa //
translated: It is imagined that there is nothing to adopt or reject.

original: tshangs pa mya ngan med par rtag gnas byos //
analyzed: tshangs pa mya ngan med par rtag gnas byos //
translated: Brahma, remain always in the absence of sorrow.

original: she'o // zhag lnga pa nas 'byung ba /
analyzed: she'o // zhag lnga pa nas 'byung ba /
translated: The fifth day of the bright fortnight of the month of Jyaistha.

original: ming tsam las ni rab 'das shing //
analyzed: ming tsam las ni rab 'das shing //
translated: It is beyond mere name,

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam spangs pa //
translated: And it is free from entity and nonentity.

original: dbyung dang bsdu las nges grol ba //
analyzed: dbyung dang bsdu las nges grol ba //
translated: It is free from the activities of emanating and gathering.

original: de ni nor lha'i bu zhes bya //🔽dngos la dngos nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni nor lha'i bu zhes bya // dngos la dngos nyid yod ma yin //
translated: He is called the son of the god of wealth.🔽Things do not have reality.

original: dngos med la yang dngos nyid min //
analyzed: dngos med la yang dngos nyid min //
translated: Nor do unreal things have reality.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam grol bar //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam grol bar //
translated: Those who know that which is free from things and non-things

original: gang de shes de rig bye rig / ce'o //
analyzed: gang de shes de rig bye rig / ce'o //
translated: Know the knower, the knowable, and the knowledge.

original: zhi ba'i mdzes sbyar las byung ba //
analyzed: zhi ba'i mdzes sbyar las byung ba //
translated: This is stated in the Śāntarakṣita composition

original: bu gcig tshangs pa mchog tu bden //
analyzed: bu gcig tshangs pa mchog tu bden //
translated: The Son of the Conqueror, the supreme truth of Brahmā.

original: rig pa'i dbang phyug mu mtha' yas //🔽'ba' zhig yod pa nyid smra ba //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang phyug mu mtha' yas // 'ba' zhig yod pa nyid smra ba //
translated: The lord of knowledge, the infinite one,🔽The one who speaks of the existence of only that

original: de yang zhig bar rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de yang zhig bar rab tu brjod //
translated: Is also said to be destroyed.

original: ce'o // pha dang bu'i sbyor ba las brjod do //
analyzed: ce'o // pha dang bu'i sbyor ba las brjod do //
translated: This is stated in the Pitulaputra composition.

original: drang srong chen po ser skyas smras pa /
analyzed: drang srong chen po ser skyas smras pa /
translated: The great sage Kapila said:

original: yon tan rnams kyi rang bzhin mchog / mthong ba'i lam du 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyi rang bzhin mchog / mthong ba'i lam du 'gro ba yin //
translated: The nature of the qualities is the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam du gang 'gyur de //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du gang 'gyur de //
translated: That which is on the path of seeing

original: sgyu ma lta bur shin tu gsog / ce'o//
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur shin tu gsog / ce'o//
translated: Is like an illusion, completely empty.

original: de bas na 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu byed pa thun mong yin pa ci yod /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu byed pa thun mong yin pa ci yod /
translated: Therefore, what is the common activity of the Tathāgata in this regard?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin stong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that all phenomena are empty by nature

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis seng ge'i sgra mu stegs byed kyi glang po che dang / ri dags kyi tshogs skrag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis seng ge'i sgra mu stegs byed kyi glang po che dang / ri dags kyi tshogs skrag par byed pa'o //
translated: is the lion’s roar of the Tathāgata himself, terrifying the hordes of elephants and deer of the tīrthikas.🔽In this way, all tīrthikas who are attached to views such as the self

original: 'di ltar pha @80b rol mu stegs byed pa bdag la sogs pa lta ba la mngon par zhen pa thams cad ni nyi tshe ba kho na'i stong pa nyid brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha @80b rol mu stegs byed pa bdag la sogs pa lta ba la mngon par zhen pa thams cad ni nyi tshe ba kho na'i stong pa nyid brjod de /
translated: are merely partial to emptiness.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gsang ba pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dag ni bdag dam pa ni gcig pu kho na rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gsang ba pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dag ni bdag dam pa ni gcig pu kho na rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: For example,

original: nam mkha' chen po dang 'dra zhes brjod de /
analyzed: nam mkha' chen po dang 'dra zhes brjod de /
translated: the followers of the Upaniṣads say that the supreme self is a single consciousness that is the nature of the great space.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa goms pas gnyug ma dang gnyug ma ma yin pa'i ma rig pa dang bral nas bum pa la sogs pa chag na de'i nam mkha' nam mkha' chen por 'du ba bzhin du srog kyang der 'du na rab tu smra ba dag gis de
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa goms pas gnyug ma dang gnyug ma ma yin pa'i ma rig pa dang bral nas bum pa la sogs pa chag na de'i nam mkha' nam mkha' chen por 'du ba bzhin du srog kyang der 'du na rab tu smra ba dag gis de
translated: Yogis who are familiar with that are free from both innate and noninnate ignorance. When a vase and so on is broken, just as the space in it is included in great space, the life force is also included in that.

original: srog dang yon tan dang 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa dngos po mtha' yas par rnam par brtags so //
analyzed: srog dang yon tan dang 'byung ba nyid la sogs pa dngos po mtha' yas par rnam par brtags so //
translated: Life, qualities, elements, and so on—all things are imagined to be infinite.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te gnyis su med kyang rmi lam rmis pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi ngo bor snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te gnyis su med kyang rmi lam rmis pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi ngo bor snang ngo //
translated: This world is illusory by nature. Although it is nondual, it appears as various entities, like a dream.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽bum pa la sogs zhig pa na //🔽bum pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / bum pa la sogs zhig pa na // bum pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa //
translated: Here someone might say:🔽When a pot and so on is destroyed,🔽the space of the pot and so on

original: ji ltar nam mkha' 'du 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' 'du 'gyur ba //
translated: is not seen to be destroyed.

original: de bzhin srog kyang bdag 'dir 'du //
analyzed: de bzhin srog kyang bdag 'dir 'du //
translated: In the same way, life is not seen to be destroyed here.

original: gzugs dang 'bras bu rab tu brjod //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'bras bu rab tu brjod //
translated: It is said to be the form and the effect.

original: de dang der ni tha dad kyang //
analyzed: de dang der ni tha dad kyang //
translated: Although it is different in each case,

original: nam mkha' la ni tha dad med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni tha dad med //
translated: space is not different.

original: de bzhin srog kyang nges pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin srog kyang nges pa yin //
translated: In the same way, life is certain.

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams la ni //
translated: Just as for the childish

original: nam mkha' dri mas dri can 'gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha' dri mas dri can 'gyur //
translated: space becomes defiled by defilements,

original: de bzhin mi mkhas rnams la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin mi mkhas rnams la yang //
translated: in the same way

original: bdag ni dri mas dri can 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag ni dri mas dri can 'gyur //
translated: for the unwise the self becomes defiled by defilements.

original: ji ltar mun khung ma rtogs te //
analyzed: ji ltar mun khung ma rtogs te //
translated: Just as in a dark house

original: thag pa sprul gyi rgyun la sogs //
analyzed: thag pa sprul gyi rgyun la sogs //
translated: a rope is mistaken for a snake,

original: dngos por rnam par brtags pa ltar //
analyzed: dngos por rnam par brtags pa ltar //
translated: Just as things are imagined to exist,

original: de bzhin bdag kyang rnam par brtags //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag kyang rnam par brtags //
translated: so too is self imagined.

original: ji ltar thag pa nges rtogs na //
analyzed: ji ltar thag pa nges rtogs na //
translated: Just as when a rope is recognized,

original: rnam par rtog pa ldog 'gyur te //🔽thag pa gcig nyid gnyis min pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ldog 'gyur te // thag pa gcig nyid gnyis min pa //
translated: the thought of snake is eliminated,🔽so too is the self, which is not two,

original: de ltar bdag kyang nges pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar bdag kyang nges pa yin //
translated: certain to be eliminated.

original: srog la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: The infinite things such as life

original: dngos po de dag rnam par brtags //
analyzed: dngos po de dag rnam par brtags //
translated: are all imagined.

original: gang gis de dag nyid rmongs pa //
analyzed: gang gis de dag nyid rmongs pa //
translated: Those who are confused about them

original: de ni lha de'i sgyu ma yin //
analyzed: de ni lha de'i sgyu ma yin //
translated: are deceived by the illusions of the gods.

original: srog tu rigs pas srog ces brjod //🔽'byung ba yin zhes de rigs rnams //
analyzed: srog tu rigs pas srog ces brjod // 'byung ba yin zhes de rigs rnams //
translated: Life is called life because it is suitable as life.🔽Those who are of that type say, “It is an element.”

original: yon tan rigs rnams yon tan snyam //
analyzed: yon tan rigs rnams yon tan snyam //
translated: Those who are of that type think, “It is a quality.”

original: yang dag yin zhes de rigs rnams //
analyzed: yang dag yin zhes de rigs rnams //
translated: Those who are of that type say, “It is real.”

original: gnyis min yid ni rmi lam na //
analyzed: gnyis min yid ni rmi lam na //
translated: The nondual mind in a dream

original: gnyis su snang ste the tshom med //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ste the tshom med //
translated: appears as two, there is no doubt.

original: de bzhin gnyid kyis la log tshe //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyid kyis la log tshe //
translated: Likewise, when one falls asleep,

original: gnyis min gnyis snang tshe tshom med //
analyzed: gnyis min gnyis snang tshe tshom med //
translated: the nondual appears as two, there is no doubt.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Whatever it may be, moving or unmoving,

original: gnyis su snang ba 'di yid yin //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba 'di yid yin //
translated: this appearance as two is the mind.

original: yid ni med par gyur pa na //
analyzed: yid ni med par gyur pa na //
translated: When the mind has ceased to be,

original: gnyis su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the apprehension of duality does not occur.

original: bdag ni bden pa rtogs @81a * //
analyzed: bdag ni bden pa rtogs @81a * //
translated: Since I have realized the truth,

original: gyur pas // gang tshe kun tu mi rtog pa //
analyzed: gyur pas // gang tshe kun tu mi rtog pa //
translated: when there is no discursive thought,

original: de tshe yid ni mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de tshe yid ni mi 'gyur te //
translated: then the mind does not move.

original: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas de 'dzin med //
translated: Since there is no object, there is no subject.

original: ce'o // bdag rtag pa lta ba gnyis su med par brjod pa'i tshul 'di thams cad kyang sngar spangs zin to //
analyzed: ce'o // bdag rtag pa lta ba gnyis su med par brjod pa'i tshul 'di thams cad kyang sngar spangs zin to //
translated: All of these methods of expressing nonduality in terms of the view of the permanent self have already been refuted.

original: gzhan yang gcig grol thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gcig grol thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if one were liberated, all would be liberated.

original: 'on te ma grol na grol bar 'dod pa yang ma grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ma grol na grol bar 'dod pa yang ma grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if one were not liberated, then even one who desires liberation would not be liberated,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference.

original: gzhan du na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pas tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnas pas tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since the opposite would be present, there would be a difference.

original: rnal 'byor goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The yogi who is familiar with yoga

original: ci zhig bzlog cing ci zhig sgrub //
analyzed: ci zhig bzlog cing ci zhig sgrub //
translated: reverses nothing and accomplishes nothing.

original: de yi bdag nyid phyin ci log / spang bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid phyin ci log / spang bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The error of his identity cannot be removed.

original: shes pa yang dag bskyed bya min //
analyzed: shes pa yang dag bskyed bya min //
translated: Nor is it the case that correct cognition is produced.

original: de nyid rtag tu gnas phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rtag tu gnas phyir ro //
translated: because it always remains.

original: de phyir rnal 'byor bsgoms pa 'di //
analyzed: de phyir rnal 'byor bsgoms pa 'di //
translated: Therefore, this meditation of yoga

original: 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: would be without result.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: ye srid pa'i dngos po rtag pa dang gcig pu dgag pa sngar brjod pa nyid kyis bum pa dang nam mkha'i dpe yang ma grub po //
analyzed: ye srid pa'i dngos po rtag pa dang gcig pu dgag pa sngar brjod pa nyid kyis bum pa dang nam mkha'i dpe yang ma grub po //
translated: The example of the pot and space is also not established, because of the previous statement that refutes permanent and singular entities that have always existed.

original: gcig 'du na thams cad kyang 'du bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on te ma yin na 'dod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig 'du na thams cad kyang 'du bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on te ma yin na 'dod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one is included, all would be included, and if not, then it would not be accepted,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der yang brgal zhing brtag pa dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der yang brgal zhing brtag pa dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: because there would be no difference. This is also a suitable objection and examination.

original: de kho na mthong ba goms pas glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems skad cig gis 'jig pa'i chos can la 'thad do //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba goms pas glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems skad cig gis 'jig pa'i chos can la 'thad do //
translated: Also, it is reasonable that one who is free from the afflictions through cultivating the vision of reality has a mind that is naturally luminous, and that it is momentary and subject to destruction.

original: gzhan du na snga phyi'i gnas skabs su dag pa dang ma dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na snga phyi'i gnas skabs su dag pa dang ma dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be pure and impure in the earlier and later states.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa dang 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa rnam par gzhag pa tha dad par brjod pa yang skad cig pa la rten pa nyid la rigs te /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa dang 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa rnam par gzhag pa tha dad par brjod pa yang skad cig pa la rten pa nyid la rigs te /
translated: The presentation of certainty and uncertainty, error and non-error, is also reasonable in terms of the momentary basis.

original: skyes bu rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo la 'tshol bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag gi lan gdab par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rtag pa gcig pu'i ngo bo la 'tshol bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs 'di dag gi lan gdab par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to respond to these states of inquiry in terms of a permanent, unitary person.

original: shes pa'i skyes bu rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin la gnyid kyis log pa dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs 'jog pa la yang gnas med pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa'i skyes bu rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rang bzhin la gnyid kyis log pa dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs 'jog pa la yang gnas med pa nyid de /
translated: It is also unreasonable to posit the states of sleep and wakefulness in terms of a permanent, unitary person who is a knowing being.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable for different states to exist.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rig byed mtha' la nges rnams kyis //
analyzed: rig byed mtha' la nges rnams kyis //
translated: those who are certain about the Vedānta🔽see this world as like a dream or an illusion,

original: rmi lam sgyu ma ci 'dra dang // dri za'i grong khyer ci 'drar mthong //
analyzed: rmi lam sgyu ma ci 'dra dang // dri za'i grong khyer ci 'drar mthong //
translated: like a city of gandharvas.

original: de ltar 'jig rten 'di dag mthong //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten 'di dag mthong //
translated: Thus they see this world.

original: 'gog pa med cing skye ba med //
analyzed: 'gog pa med cing skye ba med //
translated: There is no cessation and no arising.

original: bcings pa med cing sgrub pa med //
analyzed: bcings pa med cing sgrub pa med //
translated: There is no bondage and no establishment,

original: thar 'dod med cing thar ba med //
analyzed: thar 'dod med cing thar ba med //
translated: No one desiring liberation and no liberation.

original: @81b 'di ni don dam nyid yin no //🔽chags dang 'jigs dang khro bral ba //
analyzed: @81b 'di ni don dam nyid yin no // chags dang 'jigs dang khro bral ba //
translated: This is the ultimate truth.

original: rig byed mthar phyin thub rnams kyis //
analyzed: rig byed mthar phyin thub rnams kyis //
translated: The sages who have reached the end of the Vedas,

original: spros pa nyer zhi gnyis med pa'i //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi gnyis med pa'i //
translated: Free from attachment, fear and anger,

original: rnam par mi rtog 'di mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog 'di mthong ngo //
translated: See this non-conceptual state,🔽The pacification of elaborations, the non-dual.

original: zhes de dag gis gang brjod pa de ni bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa spros pa'i tshogs thams cad las grol ba /
analyzed: zhes de dag gis gang brjod pa de ni bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa spros pa'i tshogs thams cad las grol ba /
translated: What they describe is spoken by the Sugata, free from all elaborations.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten na mdzes so //🔽rtag pa dang gcig pu'i bdag bkag pa 'dis nye dbang gi lugs kyang bsal zin to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten na mdzes so // rtag pa dang gcig pu'i bdag bkag pa 'dis nye dbang gi lugs kyang bsal zin to //
translated: It is beautiful when based on ultimate truth.🔽By refuting a permanent and singular self, the Sāṃkhya system is also refuted.

original: ye srid pa'i lta ba yang khyab pa dang / rtag pa'i bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa bsal bas bsal zin to //
analyzed: ye srid pa'i lta ba yang khyab pa dang / rtag pa'i bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa bsal bas bsal zin to //
translated: The eternalist view is also refuted by refuting a permanent self and space, and so on.

original: ye srid pa'i der yang rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / byed pa po la sogs pa yang dag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye srid pa'i der yang rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / byed pa po la sogs pa yang dag pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the self is permanent, all-pervading, and the agent, etc.

original: ser skyes brjod pa snying stobs dang // rdul dang mun pa mnyam pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid gtso bo dang dam pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yang sngar smos pa'i khyab pa dang rtag pa'i dngos po bsal ba nyid kyis bsal zin to //
analyzed: ser skyes brjod pa snying stobs dang // rdul dang mun pa mnyam pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid gtso bo dang dam pa'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yang sngar smos pa'i khyab pa dang rtag pa'i dngos po bsal ba nyid kyis bsal zin to //
translated: The statement of Kapila that the self is the nature of the primary principle, sattva, rajas, and tamas in equilibrium is also refuted by the refutation of the things that are all-pervading and permanent, as previously mentioned.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag chos thams cad dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig 'chad pa na smad pa dang / nyung ba'i don la sogs pa 'chad de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag chos thams cad dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig 'chad pa na smad pa dang / nyung ba'i don la sogs pa 'chad de /
translated: Those of our own Buddhist schools who explain the words of the scriptures, “All things are unreal, etc.,” as meaning “depreciated” and “few,” etc.,

original: dngos po rnams ngan pa yin pas dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngan pa yin pas dngos po med pa ste /
translated: say that things are unreal because they are bad.

original: dbus dang da ltar gyi gnas skabs na mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus dang da ltar gyi gnas skabs na mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not supported in the middle or present time.

original: yang na dngos po dag ni dngos po med pa mang bas dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dngos po dag ni dngos po med pa mang bas dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Or, things are unreal because things are few in comparison to the unreal.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar ma skyes pa dang / 'das par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthar ma skyes pa dang / 'das par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has not yet arisen in the past and future does not exist essentially.

original: bshad pa 'di yang gal te sngar dpyad par byas pa'i spangs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang dag par yod par grub na ni kho bo'i sems rangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di yang gal te sngar dpyad par byas pa'i spangs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang dag par yod par grub na ni kho bo'i sems rangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the existence of the dependent were established by the refutation stated earlier, then I would be satisfied.

original: gzhan du ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / gnas ma bu'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: gzhan du ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / gnas ma bu'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Otherwise, following the Vaibhāṣika and the Vātsīputrīya,

original: 'di ni lhur grangs can la sogs pa'i lugs kyi dngos po dgag pa yin no zhes 'di bshad mi nus pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'di ni lhur grangs can la sogs pa'i lugs kyi dngos po dgag pa yin no zhes 'di bshad mi nus pa ci yod /
translated: why can’t we explain this as a refutation of the systems of the Sāṃkhya and so on?

original: yang na bshad pa 'di ni 'dul ba'i skye bo blo mi zhib pa'i skrag pa bsal ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: yang na bshad pa 'di ni 'dul ba'i skye bo blo mi zhib pa'i skrag pa bsal ba'i phyir te ;
translated: Or else, this explanation is for the purpose of dispelling the fear of those disciples who are not subtle-minded.

original: de dag tu zad do zhes bya ba ni mi sems so //
analyzed: de dag tu zad do zhes bya ba ni mi sems so //
translated: “ It is just these” is not what I think.

original: de lta bas na thub pa'i rgyal pos nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa kho na mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni mdzes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na thub pa'i rgyal pos nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa kho na mu stegs byed kyi tshogs thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni mdzes pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is only beautiful.

original: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du /
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las 'di skad du /
translated: In the Candrapradīpa-samādhi-sūtra it is said:

original: chos rnams thams cad @82a * //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad @82a * //

original: rtag tu rang bzhin stong //
analyzed: rtag tu rang bzhin stong //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: 'dir yang brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang brjod pa /
translated: Here, too, it is said:

original: shin tu phra ba'i dngos la yang //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i dngos la yang //
translated: Even with respect to very subtle things,

original: gang gis skye bar rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: gang gis skye bar rnam brtags pa //

original: mkhas pa ma yin de yis ni //
analyzed: mkhas pa ma yin de yis ni //
translated: are not learned;

original: rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
translated: they do not see the meaning of dependent origination.

original: gal te don gcig yod gyur na //
analyzed: gal te don gcig yod gyur na //
translated: If things existed through their own characteristics,

original: ci yi phyir na rang bzhin med //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na rang bzhin med //
translated: how could they be essenceless?

original: mdo sde mang dang 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mdo sde mang dang 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: It would contradict many sūtras.

original: 'jig rten mi mthun nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi mthun nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be contrary to the world.

original: zhe'o // de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe'o // de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: khyab dang dbang la sogs ma myong //
analyzed: khyab dang dbang la sogs ma myong //
translated: you have not experienced the all-pervading, the powerful, and so forth.

original: dpag tu med par gnas pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: dpag tu med par gnas pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of abiding in the immeasurable,

original: 'jig rten spyi bor gyur pas kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten spyi bor gyur pas kyang //
translated: Even the one who is the crown of the world

original: shin tu myong pa ma yin pa //🔽yang dag bdud rtsi dag pa 'di //
analyzed: shin tu myong pa ma yin pa // yang dag bdud rtsi dag pa 'di //

analyzed: thugs rje dag pa'i rgyu rkyen gyi //
translated: This is the cause and condition of pure compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the Tathāgata,

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod ma yin no //
translated: It is not the enjoyment of others.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer ltar dag pa gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i bdud rtsi 'di ni skyob pa shin tu gsol te /
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer ltar dag pa gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin nyi tshe ba ma yin pa'i bdud rtsi 'di ni skyob pa shin tu gsol te /
translated: This ambrosia, which is the nature of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, pure like the light rays of the moon, is enjoyed by the protector.

original: des na rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang / thugs rje'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i sku /
analyzed: des na rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang / thugs rje'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i sku /
translated: Therefore, the body composed of the atoms of wisdom and compassion endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phung po ma lus pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phung po ma lus pa dang bral ba /
translated: Free from the mass of afflictive and cognitive obscurations without exception,

original: thams cad kyi mchog 'khor ba ji srid bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mchog 'khor ba ji srid bar bzhugs so //
translated: The supreme of all, remains as long as saṃsāra lasts.

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag med pa dang po rtogs pas blo rnam par dag pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag med pa dang po rtogs pas blo rnam par dag pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis yang ma yin na /
translated: In this way, it is not even the case that the pure minds of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who have realized the first selflessness, are the object of the great lord Viṣṇu, Brahmā, and so on, who are attached to the wrong view of self.

original: log pa bdag tu lta ba la zhen pa lha chen po khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa'i sa ma yin par lta ci smos /
analyzed: log pa bdag tu lta ba la zhen pa lha chen po khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa'i sa ma yin par lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is not the object of those who are attached to the wrong view of the self of the tīrthikas?

original: de phyir log par bstan pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir log par bstan pa yi //
translated: Therefore, compassion

original: grub mthar 'chel ba'i blo can la //
analyzed: grub mthar 'chel ba'i blo can la //
translated: arises for those who are attached

original: de lugs rjes 'jug blo can rnams //
analyzed: de lugs rjes 'jug blo can rnams //
translated: to the tenets of the wrong teachings.

original: snying rje nyid ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: snying rje nyid ni rab tu skye //
translated: Compassion arises for those who follow🔽their system.🔽The body is the cause for a stream of suffering

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus la sdug bsngal gyi rgyun bskal pa mi nyung bar rjes su 'brel ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus la sdug bsngal gyi rgyun bskal pa mi nyung bar rjes su 'brel ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba /

original: log par bstan pa'i chos 'dul ba byed pa rnams dang de'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams la de kho na shes pa 'di lta bu tshol bas de kho na mchog gtan la phebs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa snying rje'i rigs kyi khyim khas len pa /
analyzed: log par bstan pa'i chos 'dul ba byed pa rnams dang de'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams la de kho na shes pa 'di lta bu tshol bas de kho na mchog gtan la phebs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa snying rje'i rigs kyi khyim khas len pa /
translated: This knowledge of reality is sought by those who practice the Dharma and Vinaya that is taught correctly and by those who follow them. Having ascertained the supreme reality, they accept the teaching of the Sugata as their family home.

original: skyes bu lcid khyer ba /
analyzed: skyes bu lcid khyer ba /
translated: They are the ones who carry the load.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi snying rje chen po /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi snying rje chen po /
translated: They are the ones who have realization. They are the ones in whom great compassion arises,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu dang yang ma 'dres pa skye ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs chung ngu dang yang ma 'dres pa skye ste /
translated: unmixed with even the slightest opposing factors.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje chen po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje chen po yin no //
translated: The desire to free others from suffering is great compassion.

original: de dag gi sdug bsngal dang / de'i rgyu rab @82b tu 'phel na skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal dang / de'i rgyu rab @82b tu 'phel na skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises when the suffering of others and the causes of that suffering are greatly increased.

original: bud shing bsnan na me lce 'bar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bud shing bsnan na me lce 'bar ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a blazing fire when more fuel is added.

original: don dam pa la rnam par sdang ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i mchog la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa la rnam par sdang ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i mchog la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Those who hate the ultimate truth abide in the supreme cause of suffering.

original: 'di dag ji lta bar bya ba dag ni de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi dag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ji lta bar bya ba dag ni de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi dag ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so with these, for they are not like that for oneself or others.

original: de dag ni rlung gis bskyod nas cu'i chu bur byung ba lta bur shin tu mi rtag pa /
analyzed: de dag ni rlung gis bskyod nas cu'i chu bur byung ba lta bur shin tu mi rtag pa /
translated: They are very impermanent, like bubbles of water blown about by the wind.

original: bdag la phan pa cung zad kyang mi nus pa'i lus rang can grangs yod pa gcig gsod par zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa cung zad kyang mi nus pa'i lus rang can grangs yod pa gcig gsod par zad kyi /

original: 'di dag ni 'khor ba ji srid bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'khor ba ji srid bar bzhugs pa /
translated: But these bodhisattvas remain for as long as there is cyclic existence,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas mdzes pa /🔽grangs las 'das pa'i rgyal ba dang 'brel pa'i chos kyi sku la gnod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas mdzes pa / grangs las 'das pa'i rgyal ba dang 'brel pa'i chos kyi sku la gnod pa ste /
translated: beautiful with the perfection of benefit for oneself and others,🔽and related to the victors beyond number.

original: de'i sa bon chos kyi de kho na la mos pa la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sa bon chos kyi de kho na la mos pa la gnod pa byed par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are engaged in destroying the seed of the Dharma, which is the aspiration to the reality of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa'i chos spong ba'i rnam par smin pa shin tu mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po mdo sde las brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam pa'i chos spong ba'i rnam par smin pa shin tu mi bzad pa rnam pa mang po mdo sde las brjod do //
translated: For this very reason, the sutras speak of the extremely terrible and manifold results of abandoning the holy Dharma.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: And again it is said:

original: shin tu rgya cher rab zab la //
analyzed: shin tu rgya cher rab zab la //
translated: Vast and very deep,

original: sgyid lug shin tu ma sbyangs pa //
analyzed: sgyid lug shin tu ma sbyangs pa //
translated: And are lazy and not at all trained.

original: bdag gzhan dgra dag gti mug gis //
analyzed: bdag gzhan dgra dag gti mug gis //
translated: Through delusion, we and others

original: da ltar theg pa che la smod //
analyzed: da ltar theg pa che la smod //
translated: now disparage the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: tshul khrims las ni nyams bla yi //

analyzed: lta bas cis kyang ma yin te //

analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris 'gro //

analyzed: lta bas go 'phang mchog tu 'gyur //

original: gti mug dbang gis bsgribs gyur te //
analyzed: gti mug dbang gis bsgribs gyur te //

original: gang zhig yang dag bgegs byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig yang dag bgegs byed pa //
translated: one creates obstacles to the view.

original: de la dge ba'i 'gro ba med //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i 'gro ba med //
translated: For that one, there is no good rebirth,

original: thar pa med pa smos ci dgos //🔽gnod pa'i sa bon gyur pa yi //
analyzed: thar pa med pa smos ci dgos // gnod pa'i sa bon gyur pa yi //
translated: let alone liberation.🔽Seeing the many tīrthikas

original: mu stegs byed mang mthong nas ni //🔽chos 'dod skye ba po rnams la //
analyzed: mu stegs byed mang mthong nas ni // chos 'dod skye ba po rnams la //
translated: who are seeds of harm,🔽who would not have compassion

original: snying rjer mi 'gyur su zhig yod //
analyzed: snying rjer mi 'gyur su zhig yod //
translated: for those who desire the Dharma?

original: ce'o // zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las /
analyzed: ce'o // zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las /
translated: As it is said in the Candrapradīpa Sūtra,

analyzed: dang po bzod pa'i khyad par las ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: and as it is taught in the first chapter of the Bodhicaryāvatāra.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi lugs 'di la brtags na nyid ma'i 'od zer shin tu 'jebs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi lugs 'di la brtags na nyid ma'i 'od zer shin tu 'jebs pa /
translated: When we examine this other system, we see that it is like the rays of the setting sun.

original: gangs ri kha ba'i du ma grugs la bab na 'ju bar 'gyur ba lta bur gting mi tshugs pas bdag legs su 'dod pa rnams 'di la ma zhen par bya ba ched du ched cher 'dzin to //
analyzed: gangs ri kha ba'i du ma grugs la bab na 'ju bar 'gyur ba lta bur gting mi tshugs pas bdag legs su 'dod pa rnams 'di la ma zhen par bya ba ched du ched cher 'dzin to //
translated: Just as snow falling on a mountain peak does not remain but melts, so too, since it does not remain in the mind, those who desire their own welfare should not cling to it but should hold it to be very important.

original: gzhan yang kho bo bdag cag dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rgya cher dpyad pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba 'di de kho na bsdus pa dang / don dam pa gtan la dbab pa la sogs par dpyad zin gyis /🔽shin tu rgyas par 'dod pa dag @83a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo bdag cag dang / gzhan gyi gzhung lugs rgya cher dpyad pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba spros pa'i tshogs thams cad dang bral ba 'di de kho na bsdus pa dang / don dam pa gtan la dbab pa la sogs par dpyad zin gyis / shin tu rgyas par 'dod pa dag @83a * //
translated: Moreover, since we have extensively analyzed our own and other systems, we have already analyzed dependent arising free from all the hosts of elaborations in such texts as the Compendium of Principles and Ascertainment of the Ultimate.🔽Those who wish for a very extensive explanation should understand it from those texts.

original: gis de dag las khong du chud par gyis shig / de'i phyir /
analyzed: gis de dag las khong du chud par gyis shig / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore:

original: blo nor ldan pas lugs gzhan la //
analyzed: blo nor ldan pas lugs gzhan la //
translated: The wise see that other systems

analyzed: ji ltar snying po med mthong ba // de ltar de dag skyob pa la //
translated: lack any essence.🔽Thus, they generate great respect

original: gus pa shin tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gus pa shin tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: for the Protector’s teaching.

original: bdag shes pa su zhig gzhan gyi lugs ni rigs ngan blun po'i skye bo la yang grags pa'i yul rags pa la yang 'khrul par mthong la /
analyzed: bdag shes pa su zhig gzhan gyi lugs ni rigs ngan blun po'i skye bo la yang grags pa'i yul rags pa la yang 'khrul par mthong la /
translated: What wise person would accept a system that is seen to be mistaken even with regard to gross objects that are known to even lowly, ignorant people?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
translated: The scriptures of the Tathāgata are virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.🔽They are not undermined by the direct perceptions, inferences, and statements of others, just as gold is not undermined by being heated, cut, and rubbed.

original: gser bzang po lta bur bsreg pa dang / gcad pa dang / brdar ba dang / 'dra ba'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rang gi tshig rnams kyis gnod par ma gyur pa ni 'khor ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na shin tu 'thibs po la 'khrugs pa med par mthong nas mi dang lha yul pa'i 'dren pa mtha' dag gi cod pan gyi phreng bas zhabs
analyzed: gser bzang po lta bur bsreg pa dang / gcad pa dang / brdar ba dang / 'dra ba'i mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / rang gi tshig rnams kyis gnod par ma gyur pa ni 'khor ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na shin tu 'thibs po la 'khrugs pa med par mthong nas mi dang lha yul pa'i 'dren pa mtha' dag gi cod pan gyi phreng bas zhabs
translated: Seeing that the wisdom that is not mixed with the saṃsāric world sees the extremely obscured reality without confusion, the entire human and divine world should place garlands at the feet of the Tathāgata, the leader of the world.

original: pad ma gnyis mdzes par byas pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi bla ma bdag shes pa su zhig mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i dad pa mi skyed /
analyzed: pad ma gnyis mdzes par byas pa dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi bla ma bdag shes pa su zhig mngon par ma zhen pa'i tshul gyis sgrub pa snying por byed pa'i dad pa mi skyed /
translated: What worldly guru, who is adorned with the two lotuses of wisdom and compassion, would not generate the faith that is the essence of practice, without being attached to this?

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: yang dag shes tshol sngon btang ste //

original: yang dag dad pas rjes 'brangs pa //

original: thub pa'i brtul zhugs blang byas te //

analyzed: de ni yang dag shes tshol brtson //

analyzed: blo mig zhib pa'i blo ldan dag / lam gang nas ni 'jug 'gyur pa //
translated: and who enter the path

original: lung dang rigs pa gsal ldan pa //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa gsal ldan pa //
translated: And is clear about scripture and reasoning,

original: de ltar phyogs tsam bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs tsam bstan pa yin //
translated: I have taught just a fraction of it.

analyzed: 'dir ni zla ba dag 'dra'i bsod nams bdag gis gang thob pa //
translated: Here, whatever merit I have obtained, which is like the moon,

analyzed: des ni thub mchog lugs kyi yang dag dga' ldan 'jig rten kun //
